story:
Thousands of unaccompanied children are coming to the United States every week.  The press has been covering this story for several months.  The government has known about it for several years but still hasn't developed a plan to deal with it.  Busing frightened children around the country and stuffing them into cold dormitories isn't a plan.  It isn't good for the children and it isn't good for us.  It's time to get serious about a real problem that's getting dramatically worse.  We need to recognize the children for what they are, refugees.  They're refugees from horrific conditions in their home countries.  By taking in thousands who are able to escape we're actually making it worse for millions who are left behind.  Refusing to recognize that there's a problem in those countries doesn't do anything to correct it or to help the people who are suffering.  We need to get proactive and go to the source of the problem, to the borders of Central America.

We're trying to build a refugee shelter in Mexico, in the southeastern state of Tabasco, near the border with Guatemala.  Refugee shelters are supposed to be built near the borders of the countries from which the refugees come.  Most refugees want to go home, if they can, and the world community has an obligation to make it safe for them to do so.  Making that dream come true is our goal too but we can't do it without your help.  Please make a personal commitment to this cause and send your donation today!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things you should know. 

I accepted an unpaid internship.  Your funds will assist me in paying for my room and board.  I will be here for 3 months and need help with paying my rent, food costs, and utilities.  The status of this campaign is closed now.  It was open for more than 30 days in an effort to raise funds from my family and friends to help me pay my living costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • If you know of anyone who has a housing opportunity for me, please give me a shout out! 

That's all there is to it.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

If you know of anyone who has a housing opportunity for me, please give me a shout out! 


That's all there is to it.

story:
Hi All! 

It took 30 years of fishing Jamaica Bay for James “Frank the Fish” Culleton to build his home and business. It took just one night for the bay to reclaim them. For the past year, I have been documenting Frank the Fish's life as of one of Rockaway's last commercial fisherman and charter boat captain. This work has resulted in a piece entitled Devil in the Night (see below for link), and some of its images were published in the today’s New  York Times (Sunday, October 27, 2013). Devil in the Night chronicles the lasting mental and physical losses James endured during and after Superstorm Sandy. His relationship with the water is the centerpiece of his life, the prism through which he views his world. For 12 months now, I have watched Frank bounce around from place to place trying to find a warm bed. Early on, dispossessed from his ruined home, he frequently slept in the front seat of his van. He eventually  spent weeks on friends’ sofas and in a SRO. He remains in limbo.The stress of not knowing where he will sleep every night is tremendous. 

LET’S END THIS CYCLE AND HELP FRANK! 

Please help raise $7,500 so Frank can buy a motor home, allowing him to finally move back onto his property. If we succeed, it will be the first time since Superstorm Sandy hit one year ago, so that Frank will have a private place to eat, sleep, and shower. Every dollar raised will go into the purchase of a motor home for Frank. 

Why does Frank need a motor home? Good question. Let’s break it down: 

1. A permanent place to live, no more bouncing around!

2. His own bed. This would be the first time in a year that Frank would have his own bed. 

2. Mobility. In the event of another storm, Frank can move his RV to high ground and escape the same predicament

3. Flexibility. Frank can follow the fish during the winter and make the money he needs to re-build his house, which will costs a lot more than a 

motor home. 

Please donate as much as you can afford, whether it is $10 or $1000 do. Help Frank pick up the pieces of his life. I ask on his behalf, because he is a hardworking and proud man who would never ask for help himself despite his tremendous need. Please help with whatever you can! Let’s do this this week, so Frank has something to celebrate on this one year anniversary of Sandy.


Here are some related links. 

Anchor Me Here. Documentary Short.4minutes

http://vimeo.com/m/59762924

Synopsis: Abstract narrative meditating on the long-term effects of Hurricane Sandy from a community perspective. Based on the evolution of recovery: catalyst, loss, and rebuilding, the film is told in impressionistic strokes - contrasted with explorations of nature in all its beauty and lonliness. Storytelling through the eyes of first responders, fishermen, leaders of faith, and families.

Official screening and reception by MoMA/PS1in Summer 2013. Winner in Transmedia category at Tribeca Film Festival 2013 (exhibited under Sandy Storyline). Currently in rounds of submissions to various short film festivals.  Planned hard launch online in Fall 2013 on year mark anniversary in conjunction with media partner. Camera grant of Phantom Miro provided by Vision Research as part of one of four finalists in nationwide search. 

Frank's Story in New York Times: 

http://www.nytimes.com/2013/10/27/opinion/sunday/riding-out-sandy-in-the-rockaways.html

Jonah Markowitz's photographic piece on Frank: 

http://jonahmarkowitz.com/#/devil-in-the-night/photographic-narrative

story: Kyle already has to worry about paying rent in a crappy 2 bedroom apartment he's sharing with 4 other people. He has to worry about paying his car insurance, phone bills and so on. He is a damn charity case. That's why you need to should consider giving him money to pay for a new computer, or at the very least, some new computer parts!

He is a damn charity case. That's why you need to should consider giving him money to pay for a new computer, or at the very least, some new computer parts!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
**  ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE!!!  ** 

egaliHope's Global Impact

There are thousands of small nonprofit organizations based here in the United States doing incredible work both domestically and abroad.  Over the past year, members of the egaliHope team have been fortunate enough to work with, and become friends with, many of the outstanding individuals operating and working with just a few of these organizations.

As we became more familiar with each organization's story, however, it became clear to us that an overall lack of visibility, funding, and coordination, was rendering many of them inefficient, and unable to maximize the contributions they were receiving.  This then lead to the idea/concept behind egaliHope Unlimited; to create an organization that brought small nonprofit Partners and compassionate Givers together in one site, thus increasing visibility, funding opportunities, and enhanced coordination amongst small nonprofits working in the same geographic or niche areas.

The concept is fairly straightforward, wherein small nonprofit Partners create accounts and then submit projects related to the Essential Eight categories we have identified to help sustain communities around the world (Food, Water, Orphans, Education, Medical, Faith, Economic, and Infrastructure).  Each project is then posted on the site and, depending upon funding levels requested by the Partner, runs for a specified length of time, the culmination of which results in the Partner receiving 100% of the funding received (assuming the funding goal is met).

From a compassionate Givers standpoint, individual contributors will have one site that they can create accounts with and review potentially hundreds of projects worldwide that they can contribute to, again knowing that 100% of their contribution goes to the project(s) they choose.  At the same time, they will have the ability to add friends, family, and social network contacts to their own 'myCommunity', thus having the broad ability to witness their global impact through their own networks.

As the site grows, both in Partners and Givers, our hope is that it will create a Social Network for Nonprofit Organizations, thus providing the visibility, funding, and coordination opportunities they would not be able to get on their own, and allowing them to then enjoy economies of scale that typically only larger nonprofit firms would appreciate.

egaliHope is a 501(c)(3) organization meaning all contributions are tax deductible (we anticipate receiving our IRS designation this spring as we applied in June 2012).  We are also so happy to be joined on our Board of Directors by some of the finest friends that we could imagine teaming with, both in regards to their character and their faithful compassion towards others.

Who we are

The concept of egaliHope was developed by Tom Shaffer, a manufacturing manager by trade, after a variety of life events. Tom and his family moved to Columbus, Ohio and began to attend a church that had 100 countries represented. During this time, Tom was also reading the book "The Hole in our Gospel" written by the President of World Vision, Richard Sterns. Moved by the tremedous need of people around the world and discovering the work of various nonprofits serving to bring about lasting change in these communities, Tom & a group of his friends formulated the original concepts of egaliHope.

At the same time, Tom and his wife Michele were blessed enough to be able to adopt two beautiful little boys from Ghana to add to their existing family of four biological children, thus increasing the passion to reach out and help others.

egaliHope is a new innovative nonprofit organization connecting compassionate givers to the projects managed by small to medium sized nonprofits. We are focused on small to medium sized nonprofits because they need increased visibility to attract funding and we believe that egaliHope will also create nonprofit connections that will provide efficiencies in the work being done around the world. Nonprofits will leverage each other's competencies so that dollars received go a long way.  

For the compassionate givers that visit the website, by using egaliHope to support nonprofits, you will be able to see your global impact. You'll have the opportunity to connect your friends through other social media outlets (ex. facebook, linkedIn) and see how your community (myCommunity) can be part of buidling sustainable communities around the world through your own myHope page. 

While we collectively cannot ensure that all people share the same levels of economic, educational, spiritual, and healthcare opportunities, we believe that we can collectively create a world where each individual has an “equal” (egal) amount of Hope regarding their future.

What We Need & What You Get

Our organization will support its own administrative and overhead expenses, thus 100% of the funds designated for each project will go to the nonprofit organization sponsoring the project.  As a result, we need your help raising dollars to develop our website and pay for operating expenses. 

We are currently in the process of developing egaliHope's website, which will be instrumental in realizing our mission. We are asking for $65,000 to cover the development and operational expenses for calendar year 2013. The funding for this campaign will go towards website development, graphic design, legal & accounting fees and marketing. 

Although we are awaiting our official 501(c)3 IRS Determination Letter, we are currently a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization per IRS regulations for the next three calendar years (2015), as such, all contributions to this campaign are tax deductible. We anticipate receipt of our Determination Letter in early 2013 as we submitted our application in June, 2012. 

All contributions to this campaign that are between $25-$99 will receive a special shout out on our Facebook page and contributions of $100 or more will be individually listed as an Angel Investor on egaliHope's website for a minimum of one year. 

Help us bring egaliHope to life!

Tom Shaffer, President

story:
Our Story

Welcome to our campaign page! We are the team behind The Daily Muse, a community of smart, confident women supported by career-focused content, job opportunities and professional development. Our goal: to inspire and support these women as they dream big and achieve their goals. We want to offer insightful articles and career advice written just for them, that fills the void between The New York Times and Glamour.


We currently offer sharp, authoritative content and multiple newsletters to our readers, but want to do much more. Help us reach 50,000 women, develop into a thriving network, and bring high quality professional development courses and job opportunities to the educated, ambitious women of our generation.




Founders Kathryn Minshew, Alex Cavoulacos, and Melissa McCreery met in their first job out of college at a management consulting firm. There they learned the ins and outs of the business world, but also found that a lot of what work was about wasn't taught in school: should you be negotiating your first salary? If so, how do you do so without offending your first employer? What happens if you want to change careers? How can you speak with confidence the first time you're put in front of a room of executives? How do you balance your job and your personal life (or your checkbook...)?


After joining forces on another venture, Kathryn, Alex, and Melissa knew that they wanted to work together to help young professional women like themselves. They assembled a top-notch team of editors, writers, business minds, social media ninjas, talented illustrators, marketing gurus, and event whizzes (yup, the whole nine yards), and The Daily Muse was born.


Now, with a strong community of contributing writers from around the world, The Daily Muse provides multiple perspectives on job search, career, education and grad school and entrepreneurship. We also cover the non-work side of life, from health and personal finance to workplace fashion and traveling. A powerhouse collection of established bloggers and industry experts have joined us as regular columnists, sharing their insight and bringing years of collective expertise to the team.


Now that our site is live, we have two goals for which we need your help: 


  1. Reach 50,000 young women through campus outreach, events, advertising, and word of mouth.
  2. Develop and launch 4 online training courses tailored to the needs of our readers, to help them achieve those big milestones that seem so daunting to take on alone. 
    • Your input will help define the topics; early suggestions have included "pre-job search preparation," "a guide / companion to the first 30-days of your new job" and "how to do your taxes for the first time," but the possibilities are endless!


We appreciate every contribution, no matter how small, and sincerely thank you for your support.


The Vision

There’s a movement coming. You can’t find it in Cosmopolitan or the latest issue of US Weekly. You may not notice it in GQ or Esquire. But look a little closer to home—at your sister, your girlfriends, or your colleagues—and you’ll see a massive cultural shift underway: the rise of the smart, confident young professional woman.


The movement has its trailblazers—Sheryl Sandberg, Arianna Huffington, Oprah and Diane Von Furstenberg among others. But its strength, increasingly, is coming from the masses: from thousands upon thousands of ambitious women entering the workforce and finding that, as a culture, we haven’t quite caught up. And we've been there too: being a young woman navigating the professional world for the first time isn't easy. Although as a culture, we’ve left behind the antagonistic, us-versus-them mentality of the women's movement of the 70s and 80s, we’ve found the modern refrain that “men and women should be indistinct in the workplace” rings hollow, too. Call it nature or nuture, there are differences in how men and women approach professional conduct, and facing these issues head-on will make us all more equipped to succeed.


That’s why we talk about Working with a Boss of a Different Gender or How to Avoid Crying in the Workplace. As a culture, we are still trying to create and define the practical version of our mothers’ feminism, turning their chorus of “Yes We Can” into tangible increases in women holding leadership positions and the realization that success is no longer a zero sum game.


So—welcome to a newly flexible feminism. Welcome to a movement and a space that will define what it means to be a young, intelligent woman in the 21st century. Welcome to the movement. And welcome to The Daily Muse.

(from The Daily Muse manifesto, originally published on The Huffington Post)


What We Need & What You Get

Our initial campaign goal of $10,000 will provide the extra "boost" we need to expand our reach through:

  • informational socials and workshops
  • networking events
  • advertising placements
  • promotional campus visits

The funds raised will also go a long way towards the development of our training courses as we:
  • work with educational specialists in key areas
  • commission the creation of supplemental multimedia
  • connect with our target audience to best address the areas where guidance is needed

All contributions through this campaign will be focused towards our goal of reaching 50,000 young women and kicking off our training courses, and we appreciate every step you can take with us towards success.

In return for your invaluable support, we're offering some amazing, exclusive opportunities. The column on your right lists the various contribution levels and their perks—there's something for everyone. We'll make sure you're recognized at the $2 level, included in our training courses at the $25 level, strutting your stuff in some fabulous TDM merchandise at the $100 level, taking you out on the town at the $2,500 level, and that's just the start of it! Check out the full list and join us!


Other Ways You Can Help

Let us count the ways!

1. "Like" The Daily Muse on Facebook

2. Follow us on Twitter @dailymu_se

3. Sign up for our newsletters to receive any combination of our featured articles, our famous "best of the web," and hot job opportunities straight to your inbox

4. (but not least) Share us with your friends, colleagues, sisters, cousins, daughters, girlfriends, frenemies and significant or unsignificant others who you think would love what we have to offer or might even want to contribute to this campaign! You can also easily tweet, post, or share our articles using the "Share" tools at the bottom of any Daily Muse article you love.

There they learned the ins and outs of the business world, but also found that a lot of what work was about wasn't taught in school: should you be negotiating your first salary? If so, how do you do so without offending your first employer? What happens if you want to change careers? How can you speak with confidence the first time you're put in front of a room of executives? How do you balance your job and your personal life (or your checkbook...)?

After joining forces on another venture, Kathryn, Alex, and Melissa knew that they wanted to work together to help young professional women like themselves. They assembled a top-notch team of editors, writers, business minds, social media ninjas, talented illustrators, marketing gurus, and event whizzes (yup, the whole nine yards), and The Daily Muse was born.

Now, with a strong community of contributing writers from around the world, The Daily Muse provides multiple perspectives on job search, career, education and grad school and entrepreneurship. We also cover the non-work side of life, from health and personal finance to workplace fashion and traveling. A powerhouse collection of established bloggers and industry experts have joined us as regular columnists, sharing their insight and bringing years of collective expertise to the team.

Now that our site is live, we have two goals for which we need your help: 




Reach 50,000 young women through campus outreach, events, advertising, and word of mouth.
Develop and launch 4 online training courses tailored to the needs of our readers, to help them achieve those big milestones that seem so daunting to take on alone. 

Your input will help define the topics; early suggestions have included "pre-job search preparation," "a guide / companion to the first 30-days of your new job" and "how to do your taxes for the first time," but the possibilities are endless!



We appreciate every contribution, no matter how small, and sincerely thank you for your support.


The Vision
There’s a movement coming. You can’t find it in Cosmopolitan or the latest issue of US Weekly. You may not notice it in GQ or Esquire. But look a little closer to home—at your sister, your girlfriends, or your colleagues—and you’ll see a massive cultural shift underway: the rise of the smart, confident young professional woman.

The movement has its trailblazers—Sheryl Sandberg, Arianna 
Huffington, Oprah and Diane Von Furstenberg among others. But its 
strength, increasingly, is coming from the masses: from thousands upon 
thousands of ambitious women entering the workforce and finding that, as
 a culture, we haven’t quite caught up. And we've been there too: being a young woman navigating the professional world for the first time isn't easy. Although as a culture, we’ve left behind the antagonistic, us-versus-them 
mentality of the women's movement of the 70s and 80s, we’ve found the modern refrain that 
“men and women should be indistinct in the workplace” rings hollow, too.
 Call it nature or nuture, there are differences in how men and
 women approach professional conduct, and facing these issues head-on 
will make us all more equipped to succeed.

That’s why we talk about Working with a Boss of a Different Gender or How to Avoid Crying in the Workplace.
 As a culture, we are still trying to create and define the practical 
version of our mothers’ feminism, turning their chorus of “Yes We Can” 
into tangible increases in women holding leadership positions and the 
realization that success is no longer a zero sum game.

So—welcome to a newly flexible feminism. Welcome to a movement and a space that will define what it means to be a young, intelligent woman in the 21st century. Welcome to the movement. And welcome to The Daily Muse.
(from The Daily Muse manifesto, originally published on The Huffington Post)



What We Need & What You Get
Our initial campaign goal of $10,000 will provide the extra "boost" we need to expand our reach through:


informational socials and workshops
networking events
advertising placements
promotional campus visits


The funds raised will also go a long way towards the development of our training courses as we:

work with educational specialists in key areas

commission the creation of supplemental multimedia
connect with our target audience to best address the areas where guidance is needed


All contributions through this campaign will be focused towards our goal of reaching 50,000 young women and kicking off our training courses, and we appreciate every step you can take with us towards success.

In return for your invaluable support, we're offering some amazing, exclusive opportunities. The column on your right lists the various contribution levels and their perks—there's something for everyone. We'll make sure you're recognized at the $2 level, included in our training courses at the $25 level, strutting your stuff in some fabulous TDM merchandise at the $100 level, taking you out on the town at the $2,500 level, and that's just the start of it! Check out the full list and join us!


Other Ways You Can Help

Let us count the ways!
1. "Like" The Daily Muse on Facebook
2. Follow us on Twitter @dailymu_se 
3. Sign up for our newsletters to receive any combination of our featured articles, our famous "best of the web," and hot job opportunities straight to your inbox
4. (but not least) Share us with your friends, colleagues, sisters, cousins, daughters, girlfriends, frenemies and significant or unsignificant others who you think would love what we have to offer or might even want to contribute to this campaign! You can also easily tweet, post, or share our articles using the "Share" tools at the bottom of any Daily Muse article you love.

story:
On June 13th, Esther celebrated her birthday in Israel with friends. On June 14th, her computer crashed and she is now unable to connect to the Internets. This is a simple appeal to join forces as Esther’s friends and put our collective power together to buy Esther a Macbook for her birthday (it’s time for her to convert).

This is the plan – I am flying to Israel on June 30th for the ROI Summit. I want to present the computer to her then as her belated birthday gift, and I will include everyone’s name who donated to the cause. I have to go to the Apple Store beforehand so the deadline is JUNE 30th to contribute!!

So please help Esther get a new computer for her bday now! Don’t read this email and then go back to Facebook stalking. Seriously.

Also, please try to keep this gift a surprise. I know it’s gonna be hard, but no tweeting! If you want to share, please send a Facebook message or an email. Feel free to share, but not with Esther!

I know that we’re in a recession and times are tough. Esther has lots of friends so whatever you can give is generous, $10, $20, $30, etc. Give up a few cups of coffee for one of the most giving, funny and computer-addicted people that I know and love.

If you have any questions or know how to get a discount directly with Steve Jobs, please email me at lindsaylitowitz@gmail.com.

Todah Raba,
Lindsay

story:
WE WILL HAVE A VIDEO POSTED SHORTLY

Facebook page and Twitter pages will be up shortly as well.

Nashua NH is also a relative location, the camp will be in that general area.

Short Summary

Camp Wolf Den will be an outdoor sports facility specializing in Live Action Role Playing, Airsoft/Paintball and teaching disaster and wilderness survival skills. We are looking to build this site not for profit, but for love of the activities that will take place on them.

In addition the site will play host to a small farm and the home for several caretakers. The site will also be as green as possible, utilizing wind and solar energy as well as participating in recycling programs and things of that nature.

As most of you probably know each of these sports communities have suffered of late due to the high cost of facilities and the poor economy. We seek to address and begin to fix this problem with this site.

So lets all get together and build this site to help revitalize the communities!

 

LARP site

  • Designed by LARPers for LARPers 
  • Minimal cost of operation means decreased cost to attend events.
  • Designed for maximum immersion without the site of vehicles and out of game non player characters.
  • Massive site that will encourage exploration and travel, but still be accesible by anyone with minimal effort.
  • Games currently to be hosted on site are: Dystopia Rising NH, Degeneration, Empires in Flames, Land in Chaos and Zombie Menace.
Airsoft/Paintball Fields
  • Multiple fields of different designs.
  • Designed to host multiple small groups at the same time or one massive group.
  • All fields are interconnected and open allowing for quick changes in play style and rules with a short walk.
  • Minimal cost of operation combined with other activities means a minimal cost to use the fields.
Teaching Facilities
  • Classes ranging from simple outdoor survival to surviving the zombie apocalypse.
  • Classes range in length from a few hours to several days.
  • Classes include classroom style teaching and active use of new skills for an optimal learning experience. 
  • Cost of attending classes will be minimal, materials and a small fee to  help with insurance.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking Seven Hundred Thousand Dollars to purchase the land and build everything needed for the facility. All money appropriated will go either towards purchasing land, or purchasing buildings and equipment such as Cabins module spaces and tools.

If we do not reach our funding goal for the project we are still going to use the funds to start up the project. 

Funds will be allocated in the following order.

  • Purchase of land.
  • Development of land.
  • Buildings.
  • Green energy utilities.
  • Tools and equipment needed for day to day operations.
Once everything is built and ready to use we will be able to host events for LARP games at a cost of Thirteen Hundred dollars or less based on insurance. For Airsoft and Paintball players we will be able to offer use of the fields at a cost of only Ten to Fifteen dollars per day per person. For those seeking education in survival we will be able to ofer classes at a cost of Thirty to One Hundred Fifty dollars, based on materials needed.

The Impact

Once the facility is built this means that the cost of LARPing, attending Airsoft/Paintball events, or learning survival skills will drop in price significantly. The average cost to attend a LARP event these days is up around Seventy Five to Eighty dollars depending on the game and location and that doesn't include food. For Airsoft/Paintball players attending an event can cost upwards of Sixty dollars just for a few hours out in the field.

The goal of these facilities is to drop the cost for LARPers down to around Forty Five dollars for an event at the absolute most. For Airsoft/Paintball Players we will drop the cost of attendance to Ten to Twenty dollars based on insurance.

By supporting this project you will be helping to revitalize the LARP, Airsoft/Paintball communities as a whole and create opportunities for people to learn valuable survival skills.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who cannot contribute for any reason, but love the project do not lose heart! Spread the word about the project to everyone you know and post links to it every where. Share it all over social media sites and we will get this camp off the ground!

story:
Dear Friends,

Cameron has been diagnosed with Nodular Lymphocyte Predominant Hodgkin Lymphoma, a rare form of Hodgkin Lymphoma and one that is considered highly treatable. However, this course of therapy is aggressive and will take its toll. He will be undergoing chemotherapy for six months and it is unlikely that he will be able to work much, if at all, during treatment which could make it a challenging and stressful time for him and his family. Because we want to give Cameron the best opportunity for healing and recovery, we have undertaken to raise funds through this campaign to cover their house payments for the six months of his treatment.

Cameron is a musician and a carpenter. Maryke is a theatre artist and technician and works part time for Canada Post. They and their three year old son Harry live in downtown Armstrong BC, in a fixer upper heritage house that they are in the midst of renovating from the ground up.

Those of you who know Cameron and Maryke, understand them to be two of the most generous, hardworking, fun inducing people on the planet, always  ready to get involved in community projects, local (and far flung) fundraisers, and special events. Their longstanding work and volunteerism for Armstrong's Caravan Farm Theatre and Asparagus Theatre have benefitted both organizations, and their community, immensely. Now is the time to show them our support.

Stress and worry about meeting the bills is the last thing anyone needs when they are undergoing chemotherapy. By covering their house payments for the duration of the treatment, we can give Cameron and his family the time and space to focus on healing and recovery. Let's work together to help them through this process.

Any donation, large or small, will be welcome. If we surpass our goal, the extra funds will help with the other costs associated with his treatment, such as supplements and vitamins to address the side effects of the chemotherapy. If you want to leave a message please do. At the campaign's end your messages will be printed on a framed poster and given to Cameron and Maryke. 

If you are interested in other ways of helping, or would like a more hands on way of showing your care, this is what you can do: 

* Contribute professional skills or materials for the work bee to finish the main floor of their house (wiring, drywall, painting, floor sanding), scheduled for late August, early September. 

* Contribute ready-made meals or foodstuffs for their freezer. 

In either case contact his sister Maggie Shook at maggie.shook@gmail.com 

And you can help in a big way by sharing this campaign with others!

Thank you for your support,

Cameron's Sisters, Family and Friends

For more info on Nodular Lymphocyte Predominant Hodgkin Lymphoma visit:

http://www.orpha.net/consor/cgi-bin/OC_Exp.php?...

story:
Rochester Square Community Garden
Just three minutes walk from Camden Town Station sits nestled a garden of huge potential for creativity, skill sharing, and innovation. Protected under the London Squares Act, the site cannot be developed commercially or residentially. The half acre plot of land (with 3 green houses and workshop area) has been sitting disused for over ten years; deteriorating and downgrading the local image. Having once been a nursery for plants grown to supply the entertainment industry, the previous owner had sadly fallen ill and abandoned his business. 

We are the current occupiers and caretakers who hold a vision of rejuvenation to restore this magical space into an organic creative social hub for sustainable development - growing organic food, skill sharing, music, art and poetry events, crafts, courses, cinema evenings, talks/discussions, peoples kitchen cafe, hostel and more. The potential is truly limitless in terms of the community benefit as a melting pot for ideas and activities.

As it is, we have already renovated a large portion of the building and surrounding land which had been layered in overgrowth and rubbish. We currently hold a weekly cinema night on Thursday evenings (screening educational documentaries and hosting discussions), Yoga classes, bicycle repair workshop and we are also growing many vegetables and herbs such as spinach, leeks, sweetcorn, potatoes, mint etc. People from the surrounding area appreciate our presence and breathe of life we have brought to the square. We also have regular visitors from people all over London contributing and holding workshops, our most recent being a screen printing day.

We believe what we are doing is at the forefront of inspiration for the future of London.  Centers for urban farming, community interaction and social sustainable development are emerging for the people by the people. Now is the moment to transform our cities into thriving gardens of localised creativity; disused buildings are everywhere and waiting for such community spirit.

Current Projects and Developments
Our main need for funding right now is for a combination of short term and long term investment. Food growing is a primary focus; inviting local residents to take part in working with seeds and soil – learning about permaculture. Renewable energy: installing solar panels and recycling rainwater. For the long term, we need serious support in financially covering a lease-agreement with current proprietor.

~ Short term:

Insulation / heating
Skip hire / rubbish removal
Materials for building/maintaining greenhouse
Solar panels
Interioir and exterior decoration / renovation

For these commitments, we would require £2500 - to be put into immediate effect.

~ Long term:

Building accommodation huts/lodges
Roof repair – replacing asbestos panels
Professional disposal of Japanese Knot Weed
Legal and administrative costs of Lease agreement

The exact funding required for the above items is undefined; we estimate up to 100,000 would significantly benefit the longevity of this project.

We feel this target is reachable with the help of this platform along with community support, which is already gaining momentum.

As an investor, you are supporting an innovative example for the future of London – being part of a budding sustainable community.

Other Ways To Contribute
Pay us a visit! There is always somebody on site to fix you a cup of tea. Attend an event or even better – inspire an activity to take place; run a workshop!

We are also always looking for art materials, books, furniture and good materials for building structures etc. Just email us: ktcs.info@gmail.com or call our house phone: 07787732569

story:
The Tamale Lady had to shut down her business in June, but the Mission misses its Vagabond Abuelita! Virginia Ramos, who just turned 60, is ready to go legit with her own brick-and-mortar Tamaleria.



Virginia's Story:

Virginia Ramos is better known to the people of San Francisco as the beloved Tamale Lady.

In early 90s Virginia realized that her day job as a domestic worker cleaning houses was not earning enough money to send her 7 children to college.

Virginia learned to make Tamales from her Grandmother when she was growing up in Mexico – so to make extra money she began cooking tamales in her kitchen after her house cleaning work was done. During the evening she would fill an insulated cooler with her delicious tamales and travel from bar to bar selling a hot home cooked meals to hungry folks all over San Francisco.

Virginia is often referred to as an angel, a saint, or our Lady of the Tamales not just because she seems to miraculously appear when nightlife patrons need something to eat the most – but because she is known for her hugs, a shoulder to cry on, and her role as a surrogate grandmother to the people of the Mission – in fact she often wears a t-shirt that says “I don’t know you but I love you”.


Big Changes Ahead:

After meeting with Supervisor Campos and other City departments and with pro bono help from Barbary Coast Consulting, Virginia has decided that it’s time to take her business to the next level!

The Tamale Lady is proud to announce that she will be opening up a brick and mortar “Tamale Lady” restaurant in The Mission.

And she needs our help!

 

How We Can Help!

Because Virginia has been saving money for the last 20 years she will be able to pay for the majority of the Tamale store. Supervisor Campos is helping her find a vacant store front but she will need $50,000 to help build out a commercial kitchen in her new restaurant. 

If everyone in San Francisco who has eaten one of Virginia’s tamales donates what they are able we will help Virginia’s dream come true!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Tamale Lady and her crew appreciate all the individuals who supported her campaign before perks were added. To show our thanks, the first 350 donors will automatically qualify for recognition on the "People Who Made This Possible" wall in Virginia's Tamaleria (a $250 perk)--regardless of the amount donated.

Additionally, anyone who donated before the perks were added retroactively qualify!

__________________________________________________

Please enjoy the documentary below, Our Lady of Tamale, created by Cecil B. Feeder.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=v9ulLQRBOek

To show our thanks, the first 350 donors will automatically qualify for recognition on the "People Who Made This Possible" wall in Virginia's Tamaleria (a $250 perk)--regardless of the amount donated.
Additionally, anyone who donated before the perks were added retroactively qualify! 
__________________________________________________
Please enjoy the documentary below, Our Lady of Tamale, created by Cecil B. Feeder.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=v9ulLQRBOek

story:
By helping us with this project you'll be showing the world how important ideas like the environment, local business, sustainable local food, and farming are. You'll also see how awesome it is you got in on a fantastic event deal or telling your friends about the great organic produce you just picked up from your named tree!

I'll try to be Brief...

We want to establish a Permaculture farm with an Events Center.  Sound CRAZY?! Maybe, but we're all in and up for the challenge if you are! Even the local news thought it was a good idea, though! http://www.krem.com/news/Clayton-couple--221564...

When you watch the video you'll get a sense of who we are but we'd like to tell you a little more about our experience here.  We created Siemen Family Farms about five years ago to sell fresh, organic produce to our local co-op and small restaurants from our small, Urban Farm in the heart of Spokane, Wa. We've been working that land using Permaculture Principles with success where no one thought anything would grow!  Now we're ready to do the same thing on a larger scale and involve more people.

The concept we connect with most in Permaculture is that no single thing is the key to success - it's all things working together that make the whole work and produce.  With that, we have a handful of talented friends to share in this experience, and we want to invite you, too.


Here’s how the Money works!

We need $26,000 to get this thing rolling. We’re doing the work. What we need is help with the materials – 12-20 gallons of paint, carpet & padding, renting a carpet cleaner, wood stain, hog panel fencing and posts, greenhouse sheeting, orchard stock, perennial shrubs and flowers, etc. The best way to do that is to pre-buy something you may already be getting anyway!

That pays for some much needed upgrades on the event facility.  For example, the Bridal Cottage - a single bedroom additional house on the property - needs a good cleaning (which we can do for free) new padding and carpet, new paint, wallpaper removed, refinishing of cupboards, maybe even granite counter tops, and a new refrigerator.

There are some fixes needed on the main facility, too. For example, pigeons have moved into a corner of the metal roof.  The main doors need to be refinished on the outside from sun damage and the French doors on the main patio need to be replaced or refinished as well as the tongue and groove facing on the outside of them.

The groom's room is another space that needs help - right now it's a concrete floor. Seriously, there's a building but it's a concrete floor. Because we're creative, we can definitely work with that but paint, shelving, some overstuffed furniture, maybe a simple bar and TV would be nice while waiting for your big moment.  We'd also quadruple the use of the space for conferences, rehearsals, overnighters, retreats, etc. 

Some ideas for the future include using the one thing besides sunshine there's a lot of and that's the breeze.  Small wind generators are inexpensive to build, unobtrusive, and passively lower the cost of utilities all year round and that just makes sense for everyone. :-)

May I draw your Attention HERE:

To make you a part of this project, we're offering some unique perks.  All our Perks are Gift-able and Transferable - you'll just need to provide us with their contact information! Also, there's no expiration date on them so if you know you'll be celebrating your 50th wedding anniversary in 10 years, we'll still be there when you're date rolls around!

Because it's WEDDINGS we want to do the most, our biggest "deal" is, of course, a wedding.  But not just any wedding - YOUR wedding! It includes the rehearsal and dinner, an officiate, a coordinator, the ceremony and the reception, the cleanup, the tables/chairs/linens, and music with indoor and outdoor spaces for 135 guests the entire time. All that for $1,500! These are fully transferrable, gift-able, and come with no time limits so think fast - dates are based on availability!



Another of our personal favorites is the "Farm to Table" Events.  Imagine one long table decked with linens, fine tableware, lights, friends, and most importantly local food prepared by local artisans served under the stars.  It’s more than just dining, it’s the opportunity to meet new people, meet food producers you’ve probably never heard of, and tasting local flavors you may never have been made aware of.  With a good wine a local organic cut of beef you could easily reach $90.00 per plate!  How about $50 and you choose your event from the calendar as it's posted?



There's a perk to fit most budgets and wants so, please, enjoy the look and find something different! Also, regardless of the funding level achieved, we'll still be using every dime to build this property and this business and whatever you've bought WILL BE available to you as promised!

Make an Impact

It's easy to say what can't be done and all the reasons why.  It's easy to say it should be done a different way. But who likes listening to naysayers? We raised more than a few eyebrows when we moved into an urban neighborhood with a sketchy crime record.  In seven years every person who visits can't believe our house is here! We didn't listen to the "Debbie Downers" then and we won’t now, either.  There's no reason we can't build Eden up there to...and host some really great events in the process!

And we're not bailing on the community we've developed on our Urban Farm, either.  With our Connections at Main Market Co-Op and the Spokane Permaculture Study Group, already rented our home out to folks who want to live the same dream we do in an urban setting.  The tradition will carry on!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're not able to personally contribute, we understand.  But we still could use your help.
  • Consider posting this campaign to your social media pages - everyone knows someone who could use a good event location sometime in the next 12 months.
  • "Like" us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/montlammbelgians - and stay in touch with what's going on that way, too.
  • For all of you blogger mongers, you could write something complimentary and post a link.
  • The truth is, if you're on Indiegogo you're probably kind of a creative person anyway so be creative and our many thanks for believing this is a worthy project!

story:
Clean Energy?

We are founding Talassa Energy and Engineering with the motto of “Sustainable Energy for Green Future!”. This campaign will help us to raise funds to make this happen. You will be a part of history with the proud contribution to the future. The world is legacy of our children, we have to do our part.

We are two enthusiastic engineers (one of us in Turkey, one in the US) with education and international experience in energy sector. Energy need increases everyday, opposing to the sources, especially the ones we depend on. Fortunately, we start to gain awareness on environmetal issues. Our goal should be use avaliable energy with increasing efficiency and reduce the greenhouse emissions as much as possible by utilization of renewable energy.

So, no more Katrina?

The dependency of our energy consumption rates on fossil fuels threatens our sustainable energy dreams. Consumption rates increased drastically over the past century. Hopefully, we are exploring the way of solutions to utilization of renewable energy. By considering all with their pros and cons, sustainable energy for the green future is achiveable with careful energy management analysis.

Our first project is on ocean current energy. Ocean current energy may be the only reliable renewable energy since it will always present as far as our planet is alive. East coast of the US has one of the most powerful marine drives, Gulf Stream. There are many issues being worked on to overcome difficulties. We know incredible amount of energy is present and it is extractable.

Phase-1 of this project is to be able to start oceanographic studies in candidate areas. Not all turbines can be used everywhere, nor every spot with a fast current speed is viable. As you will see, $350 perk will grant you the results of this work in case you are interested in technical details.

Phase-2 will be more on the corporate side. We need to keep company alive and keep paying employees during non-profit term in order to finalize planning and construction work before putting turbine into water.

Phase-3 is likely going to be a public promotion of the installation. Since it is a new technology we need to do test run in order to observe the turbine reliability and environmental impact.

How Sustainable We Are?

We are going to use most of the funds for start-up needs for the company: Office and office supplies, personnel, communication and travel expenses. We likely end up being able to hire third party for oceanographic measurements (loan). This will not be a one day measurement, it will probably take a year around to see the changes. $1500 perk lets you join us on board around March 2014, in case you are interested (consider your visa and transportation arrangements to meet us in Miami, FL).

Don't reach the goal? The project will likely suffer and postponed for some years...

Our Children?

You should be proud of yourself even if you learned about this emerging technology. Now its time to make it real. New technology is always risky in business terms, so big corporations want to see us moving before supporting us. Even without monetary contribution, you can do good for our future. Please help us spread the word. Still, we like the contributions with financial results more; think about your children being proud of you with your customized t-shirt!

 

We are inviting you for the first ignition for sustainable energy for green energy:

"If I don't burn

     If you don't burn

         If we don't burn

how will the light

       vanquish the darkness?"

                              Nazim Hikmet Ran (Like Kerim)

story:
The Victoria Tool Library will empower the community by providing access to tools and the necessary skills needed to use them confidently and safely.

We’re going to rescue high quality hand and power tools from garages and through community donations, and put them into the hands of Tool Library members.

And we need your help to do it!

A tool library is similar to a book library, but instead of books, you check out tools. A membership to the Victoria Tool Library gives you access to a wide variety of tools and equipment.

We take care of the storage, maintenance and hassle of owning tools – you simply borrow them when you need them.

Would like to get your hands on a particular tool, but don't have the space or funds? Have a project you've been wanting to tackle? A tool library will make it possible.


This funding campaign will help us open our doors, so you can start borrowing tools.

The money we raise here, plus other funds we gain through grants, memberships, donations and fundraising events, will go towards our set-up and operating costs, and the development and maintenance of our tool collection.


To say thank-you, we’ve assembled great perks for our supporters:

As a part of the sharing economy, the Victoria Tool Library is driven by values that promote community building.

  • Access over ownership: We offer access to a variety of tools, as easily as possible. Membership is affordable and everyone is welcome.
  • Education and mentorship: We facilitate skill-building and knowledge sharing to empower members to use tools and take on projects.
  • Community building: We provide a physical place where people can connect with neighbours, be creative, build relationships, share skills and enhance  our collective resilience.
  • Sustainability: We act as stewards, encouraging people to share their resources, buy less, repair, reuse and make do – more.

story:
Orlando Tobon's Mi Casita 

Hello,my name is Chad Bernstein. With the holidays coming up and everyone starting to get into the holiday spirit, a very close friend of mine Orlando Tobon asked if I could help him out on his Project "My Casita" Which gives houses to 10 homeless families in Colombia. Orlando is working hand in hand with the Anti-defamation League in Colombia and the Colombian local government to make "Mi Casita" a reality. Andres is one of the little boys whose family received a home for the holidays last year. Let me tell you a little about Orlando Tobon and "Mi Casita"...

A little more about the man behind Mi Casita: Orlando Tobon

     Orlando Tobon is one of the most generous human beings I have ever met, he dedicates all his free time to helping families in need. Orlando was also an associate producer and played himself in the Oscar-nominated film "Maria Full of Grace", which is actually based on his life in the U.S, helping find refuge for Colombian drug mules and providing protection from the ruthless cocaine cartels. He has been featured in The New York Times, Time magazine and countless Tv shows for his relentless dedication to helping those around him. He is one, of the most humble humans I have ever met. Anytime he receives money he immediately gives it right back to those in need. Currently, he lives in Jackson Heights, Queens NY where he works out of his small travel and income tax agency office. Orlando continues to provide aid to those people who most need it in his community and around the world. 

So close...

Hey Guys, what we need is $28,000. The local Colombian government in the town of Cisneros, Antioquia and its mayor Nelly Quintero have already contributed $72,000. We are so close but still need more help to reach our goal of $100,000 so we can finish building these houses so young children like Andres, Alejandro, and Steven can have a roof over their heads.

The difference you will make

Guys, this will give families like Little Andres and his two brothers a home. 10 families just like Sergio’s will receive the greatest gift they could ever ask for, a home.

Other Ways to help build Mi Casita

Trust me, I know times are hard. There are ways that you can help that are just as useful as financial donations. Please, please, please use your Facebook, Twitter, g+, Instragram, and Indiegogo share tools. Spreading the word with our website will also help these families dream come true and get "Mi Casita" built for Little Andres and 10 families like his.

Thank you so much, none of this is possible without you guys, from the bottom of our hearts - we truly appreciate it!

Please go to our website to learn more about Orlando Tobon and "Mi Casita" http://www.concepto-media.com/#!orlando-tobons-mi-casita/cmpw

In the words of Orlando's mother, "If one human being dedicates one day of the year to do something for another individual, this world would be a much better place".

 Here is the address of last years recipient of Mi Casita, he is a very special and deserving man.   His name is Sergio Andres Ramirez- Calle 68 #57-46, Interior #301 Barrio El Ducado.  You can visit Sergio and here about how amazing Orlando and the Mi Casita project is.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 

En Español: 

"Mi Casita " de Orlando Tobón 
 
 Hola, mi nombre es Chad Bernstein. Con las vacaciones por delante y todo el mundo está empezando a entrar en el espíritu de dar, un amigo muy cercano mio llamado Orlando Tobón me pidio el favor de ayudarlo en su proyecto "Mi Casita" que ofrece 10 casas a familias sin hogar en Colombia. Orlando está trabajando mano a mano con la Liga Anti Difamación de Colombia y el gobierno local para hacer "Mi Casita" una realidad. Andrés es uno de los niño cuya familia recibió una casa para las fiestas del año pasado. Permítanme contarles un poco acerca de Orlando Tobón y "Casita Mi"...
 

Un poco más sobre el hombre detrás de Mi Casita: Orlando Tobón
      

Orlando Tobón es uno de los seres humanos más generosos que he conocido, dedica todo su tiempo libre a ayudar a las familias en necesidad. Orlando tambien fue productor asociado y jugó a sí mismo en la película nominada al Oscar "María llena eres de gracia", el cual se basa realmente en él ayudando a encontrar refugio para las mulas de la droga colombianos y proporcionando protección contra los cárteles de la cocaína despiadados. Ha aparecido en The New York Times y la revista Time por su dedicación incansable para ayudar a las personas a su alrededor. Es uno de los seres humanos más humildes que he conocido, en cualquier momento que recibe dinero de inmediato le da vuelta a los necesitados. Él vive en Jackson Heights, Queens Nueva York, donde continúa trabajando fuera de su agencia de viajes. Orlando ofrece ayuda a las personas que más lo necesitan en su comunidad y en todo el mundo.

Tan cerca ...

Chicos, lo que necesitamos es $ 28.000, el gobierno local de Colombia en Cisneros, Antioquia y su alcalde Nelly Quintero ya han contribuido con 72.000 dólares. Estamos tan cerca, pero todavía se necesita más ayuda para llegar a nuestra meta de $ 100.000 para poder terminar de construir estas casas para que niños como Andrés, Alejandro, y Steven puedan tener un lugar al que puedan tener un techo sobre ellos.


La diferencia que se va a hacer


Chicos, esto le dará a las familias como Andrésito y sus dos hermanos una casa digna. Este año unas 10 familias al igual que Sergio recibirán el mejor regalo que alguien podría pedir, un hogar.
 
Otras formas de ayudar a construir Mi Casita


Yo mismo sé que los tiempos estas un poco difíciles,pero aun asi hay maneras que usted puede ayudar ,que son tan útiles como las donaciones financieras. Por favor, por favor, por favor utilice su Facebook, Twitter, g+, Instragram,y herramientas IndieGoGo para compartir y difundir la palabra de nosotros. Compartiendo nuestro sitio web tambien es un imenso apoyo para que logremos ayudar a estas familias a hacer su sueño realidad - hacer posible realizar "Mi Casita" y construirle los hogares a niños como Andresito y  las 10 familias como la suya.

Muchas gracias, nada de esto es posible sin ustedes. Verdaderamente so lo apreciamos desde el fondo de nuestro corazón ...muchas gracias!


Por favor visite nuestro sitio web para aprender más acerca de Orlando Tobón y "Mi Casita" http://www.concepto-media.com/#!Orlando-tobons-...

En las palabras de la madre de Orlando: "Si un hombre dedica un día del año para hacer algo por otra persona, este mundo sería un lugar mucho mejor".

 Here is the address of last years recipient of Mi Casita, he is a very special and deserving man.   His name is Sergio Andres Ramirez- Calle 68 #57-46, Interior #301 Barrio El Ducado.  You can visit Sergio and here about how amazing Orlando and the Mi Casita project is.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
En Español: 
"Mi Casita " de Orlando Tobón   Hola, mi nombre es Chad Bernstein. Con las vacaciones por delante y todo el mundo está empezando a entrar en el espíritu de dar, un amigo muy cercano mio llamado Orlando Tobón me pidio el favor de ayudarlo en su proyecto "Mi Casita" que ofrece 10 casas a familias sin hogar en Colombia. Orlando está trabajando mano a mano con la Liga Anti Difamación de Colombia y el gobierno local para hacer "Mi Casita" una realidad. Andrés es uno de los niño cuya familia recibió una casa para las fiestas del año pasado. Permítanme contarles un poco acerca de Orlando Tobón y "Casita Mi"... 
Un poco más sobre el hombre detrás de Mi Casita: Orlando Tobón      
Orlando Tobón es uno de los seres humanos más generosos que he conocido, dedica todo su tiempo libre a ayudar a las familias en necesidad. Orlando tambien fue productor asociado y jugó a sí mismo en la película nominada al Oscar "María llena eres de gracia", el cual se basa realmente en él ayudando a encontrar refugio para las mulas de la droga colombianos y proporcionando protección contra los cárteles de la cocaína despiadados. Ha aparecido en The New York Times y la revista Time por su dedicación incansable para ayudar a las personas a su alrededor. Es uno de los seres humanos más humildes que he conocido, en cualquier momento que recibe dinero de inmediato le da vuelta a los necesitados. Él vive en Jackson Heights, Queens Nueva York, donde continúa trabajando fuera de su agencia de viajes. Orlando ofrece ayuda a las personas que más lo necesitan en su comunidad y en todo el mundo.
Tan cerca ...
Chicos, lo que necesitamos es $ 28.000, el gobierno local de Colombia en Cisneros, Antioquia y su alcalde Nelly Quintero ya han contribuido con 72.000 dólares. Estamos tan cerca, pero todavía se necesita más ayuda para llegar a nuestra meta de $ 100.000 para poder terminar de construir estas casas para que niños como Andrés, Alejandro, y Steven puedan tener un lugar al que puedan tener un techo sobre ellos.
La diferencia que se va a hacer
Chicos, esto le dará a las familias como Andrésito y sus dos hermanos una casa digna. Este año unas 10 familias al igual que Sergio recibirán el mejor regalo que alguien podría pedir, un hogar. Otras formas de ayudar a construir Mi Casita
Yo mismo sé que los tiempos estas un poco difíciles,pero aun asi hay maneras que usted puede ayudar ,que son tan útiles como las donaciones financieras. Por favor, por favor, por favor utilice su Facebook, Twitter, g+, Instragram,y herramientas IndieGoGo para compartir y difundir la palabra de nosotros. Compartiendo nuestro sitio web tambien es un imenso apoyo para que logremos ayudar a estas familias a hacer su sueño realidad - hacer posible realizar "Mi Casita" y construirle los hogares a niños como Andresito y  las 10 familias como la suya.
Muchas gracias, nada de esto es posible sin ustedes. Verdaderamente so lo apreciamos desde el fondo de nuestro corazón ...muchas gracias!
Por favor visite nuestro sitio web para aprender más acerca de Orlando Tobón y "Mi Casita" http://www.concepto-media.com/#!Orlando-tobons-...
En las palabras de la madre de Orlando: "Si un hombre dedica un día del año para hacer algo por otra persona, este mundo sería un lugar mucho mejor".

story:
Hi, I am a Mum of two girls one of whom got her first period last June 2011. When I went searching shops etc there was no starter or beginners set that I felt would make the transition from child to Woman easier. So I decided to try myself and have put together a gift that a Mum (or Lone Father) can give to their daughter when she gets her first period.  

IN the box is a hot water bottle, secret casket, diary, pads, eye mask and pocket tissues, along with a lovely information booklet to help them to understand what is happening to their bodies.  

I have tried to get funding from the bank to help me and even appeared on Dragons Den but after the successful pitch, the investment didn't materialize. So I have successfully brought the product to market and have sales but i need to launch a basic essentials kit as it is a recession so I need to make this affordable to everyone. At present the gift box costs 23.99 but the essentials kit would be under 13 euros.  

I have had a lot of support from people on twitter and Facebook and a wonderful reaction as I have ensured that I spread the word, but the only thing that is holding me back is funding.  

I would be so grateful if you could help me realise my dream and get into the UK market and have a pack that more people can afford. 

My incentive for you is that anyone who donates or contributes will be entitled to a discount of 5 euros off any Funky Goddess gift box  I have worked really hard on my own to get to this stage and I also believe that making girls feel a bit better through their teenage years is so important! 

If you can't contribute I would be sooo grateful if you could spread the word for me. I have never had money in the first place so the fact that I managed to get this far with no investment is amazing, so I won't let you all down. I plan to have a Thank you party someday for anyone who helps me with this.

Make it real for people and build trust.

story:
Dandy: Origins

What started as a vintage yard-sale vacation fund quickly evolved into an Etsy store (etsy.com/shop/LiveDandy) and, now, an actual store that'll have vintage furniture, furnishings and an available interior stylist to put 'em all together!

The Building: 5020 West Vliet Street

Our new/old Milwaukee property has nearly 7000 SQUARE FEET(!) of space for our storefront and creative studio share, but this industrial workshop wonderland is in dire need of TLC. 

Updates will include:

• Electrical
• HVAC (Heating & Cooling)
• Garage Doors
• Plumbing
• Exterior Painting
• And more...

And that's where you come in — but not for charity! See below to learn how your donation will be matched (and then some).

The More You Give, The More You Get

Simply put, your donation will be matched in credit to our Etsy store now, and our actual store when it opens in early 2018.

Here's how it works:

• Give $10 — Get $10 
• Give $25 — Get $30
• Give $50 — Get $60
• Give $75 — Get $90
• Give $100 — Get $125
• Give $250 — Get $300
• Give $500 — Get $600
• Give $1000 — Get $1250

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No prob. Here's how you can help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and fam.
  • Drop us a line if you or someone you know is looking for creative studio space in Milwaukee.

Thanks, Really

Thanks so much for checkin' us out! We're looking forward to sharing this amazing new space as it continues to develop. 

Love, Ryan + Jess

Follow Our Progress!

This is a 30-day campaign, but we've already started renovating! Keep an eye on this page or follow plain_as_rjday on Instagram for progress shots.

You can also visit our store at etsy.com/shop/LiveDandy or follow @LiveDandy on Instagram for photos, promo codes and interior styling projects.

Photos by CJ Foeckler
Branding ideation by Chris Walker
Video and music by Ryan Day

story:
Mercury Studio: Durham, Working Together

Mercury Studio is not a traditional coworking space. Our mission is to make Durham a better place by
  1. building community 
  2. helping individuals make money doing what makes them happy
Here are some of the ways we've made these goals happen over the past year (click links to learn more):
 
Coworking: A shared office/workspace where anyone working on anything will feel comfortable, welcome, and focused. Our members range from oil painters to computer programmers and they all find a space to thrive.
 
Events: We love events. We rent our space out for events and also bring people together for our own events around all sorts of things to accomplish our goals (see above). Here just some of the events that we host every month:

Art Salon: Local artist gather to present their current work and receive earnest and specific feedback from other artists, patrons, and curators. These events are cohosted with Laura Ritchie, the Gallery Director at The Carrack.

Listening Room: We bring in local songwriters for an evening of music and conversation. The artists play one set of original music for a rapt crowd and then have the opportunity to talk about their craft and process as well as take questions from the audience. It's a unique and intimate event, enjoyed by all parties involved.

groundworkk: All attenders contribute $5 to a mason jar, listen to a few pitches from local groups or individuals who have a project idea, but need funds, ask questions, and then vote. Whichever project receives the most votes, gets the cash.

#CinemaSeries: With the help of movie-buff community members, we screen and discuss movies ranging from documentaries to mainstream favorites.

What we need.

With so much going on at Mercury Studio, the space needs some upgrades! These changes and additions will allow us to accommodate more coworkers and make us better-equipped to keep hosting community-building events.

Here is the breakdown of our upgrade goals and costs:

  1. $3,300 - A better kitchen. Right now, we have a sink, refrigerator, and shelf. We'd like counter space, a dishwasher, cabinets, etc.. Apart from being a better use of space, this would also allow us to host a wider variety of events!
  2. $900 - Two new desk spaces. Once we have a new kitchen, we'll be able to make more space in our coworking room for two new desks! These will allow us to accommodate more coworkers, and also help Mercury Studio become more sustainable.
  3. $3,600 - A new membership for working artists. By re-outfitting our art studio and raising funds to subsidize membership costs, we will introduce 10-15 new  Working Artist Memberships. These members will utilize a collaborative meeting/workspace and participate in solo or group shows in our gallery. They will also be meeting once a month to set and report on professional goals and will be encouraged to teach public workshops in our space. The purpose of this membership is (like a lot of what we do) to help support people as they try to make a living doing what they love.
  4. $2,000 - A sound system and projector for our Back Room. This will not only allow us to more easily host film and live music events, but will also make our space more useful for other Durham businesses and organizations in need of meeting space.
  5. $1,000 - Gallery hanging system. This will allow us to show and change art more easily, help protect our walls, and create a more professional-looking space for our members and showing artists to display their work.
  6. $1,000 - General storage and furniture needs: A locking cabinet for new technology, art and furniture for bathrooms, and a nap area!

You might notice that this all adds up to $11,800, which is more than our goal. Well, we're hoping to smash our goal! We'll actually need almost $15000 raised here in order to have what we really need after fees and perk costs. That being said...

How you can help.

Obviously, making a contribution of your own is an awesome way to help us with this campaign, but there are other ways you can help us spread the word:

  • Social Media: Post the link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, MySpace, bulletin boards, or your forehead - whatever you use!
  • Personal emails: Email this campaign link to anyone who you think might be interested in participating. Friends, family, coworkers! We'll never know if they want to help unless someone asks them! Think about it. If you get two people to contribute what you contribute, you've tripled your contribution!
  • Listservs: Have a neighborhood listserv? A knitting listserv? An any kind of listserv? Send out the link!
  • Community Challenges: Really want to up the stakes? Issue a challenge to people in your community (office, neighborhood, etc.). Let them know what your contribution is and let them know how much you think your community should be able to raise. Also, let us know if you're doing this and we can come up with a prize for the community who, together, makes the greatest contribution!

Since Mercury Studio was just an idea in our brains, we've been blown away by the community support we have received. We wouldn't even exist if it hadn't been for a successful IndieGoGo campaign a year ago. Let's do it again!

So much love, 
Katie DeConto and Megan Jones

story:
Help us serve those that serve!

John Iannarelli and Mike O'Shaughnessy are part of a movement to bring some back home thanks and some back home cooking to our military men and women serving overseas,  

We have both been involved in other charitable causes that benefit law enforcement and have now found an opportunity to work with a group called Cooks of the Valley that benefits our military.  In November of this year we will be providing home cooked meals (steaks) to over 30,000 Sailors and Marines of the 7th Fleet.  Just think...these men and women aboard ships will receive a home cooked meal and a hearty thank you from home while serving overseas with the meal being served by those they are protecting.  What a great way to say thank you and show our appreciation!


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for donations to help offset the cost of the meals.  The meals are an out of pocket expense paid for by us, not the military (30,000 steak dinners).  Every dollar raised goes to defray the costs of the food.  John and Mike are handling the costs of their own travel and other expenses.  100% OF YOUR DONATION GOES TO FEEDING THE SERVICEMEN AND WOMEN.  Any amount raised above our goal will be donated to the Wounded Warrior Foundation.

We are asking for donations of any amount.  This trip will mean a great deal to our Armed Forces and we are proud to be able to be part of the team that will cook and serve to our fighting men and women!  

We know that everyone understands how important this type of event can be for the morale of our Servicemen and women but we also think it is important for YOU to participate and see the results.  

For everyone that contributes we will provide you a 8x10 photo memorializing the event!  This may not become a collectors piece but it will definitely show the gratitude and good work you helped to provide!

If you are generous enough to donate over $100 we will also provide you a DVD of all the stops where you will see what a difference this program makes! 

The Impact

Our military men and women need our support.  This small token brings a little slice of home to them as they protect and serve.  This is a tangible sign of what they mean to us and a recognition of the sacrifice they make to provide the freedoms we all enjoy.
Risks and Challenges
Although highly unlikely, the possibility always exists that the military will be forced to cancel this program for unforeseen reasons.  If that were to happen we will donate the entire amount to the wounded warrior foundation.  
Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out, forward this campaign to others so they too can participate.  We greatly appreciate your support!

story:
What's the Deal:

I'm a small business owner dedicated to the craft of screen printing. I'm asking for your support to help my business grow, and establish a place that can house workshops and provide a space for local Bay Area artists to display work. 

I'm currently operating a small print shop out of my garage called All Gold, but I would love to have a space to share the art of screen printing, as well as a gallery to exhibit local artists. Your contribution can help make this possible. 



Where Your Generous Donation Goes:  

1. Supplies. The community classes will be using ink, paper, emulsion, screens, drying racks and other materials. Your donation will help out with these costs.

2. Equipment. I've saved up over the last  18 months & have most of the large equipment required to run a small shop, but there are a few small pieces missing (heat press, tables, chairs, clamps, fans for ventilation, etc.) 

3. The building. Affording to live in the Bay Area is not an easy feat. I'm looking to rent a small shop in Oakland, and would use a portion of the funds collected to help offset the cost of the first and last month's rent. 

4. The perks. A good portion of the money raised will go towards materials and shipping costs for the prizes. 


Your donation will contribute to the growth of my small shop, and help provide opportunities to the community. PLUS, you'll get some really great prizes. 

After the funding is dispersed, I'll be maintaining the cost of running the shop by continuing to print custom orders for customers. 


+++

So, what community opportunities will you be contributing to?
+ One free print workshop per month open to the public
+ Donation-based guest workshops (ie. record club, sewing workshop, baking, specialty cocktails, etc.).
+ Art shows incorporating local Bay Area artists (A great way for local talented to get exposure and sell their work). 
+ A resource available to the community, and an environment where all kinds of artists will be welcomed.

+++


    I'm broke, how can I help?

    If you can't contribute money, but you'd still like to help, no worries! 
    Check out these other ways to show support: 

    + Follow All Gold on Facebook & share the campaign with all the homies

    + Show your support on Instagram

    + Do people use twitter? Y/N - If Y, tweet about us! @allgoldsf

    + Send the campaign to anyone you think might be interested in printing

    + Tell your friends to tell their friends to tell their friends


    PS. Gigantic thank you to Jeffrey Schwinghammer for the amazing video footage & dealing with how awkward I can be on camera. Check out more of his work here: jeffreyschwinghammer.com

    & special thanks to It's Just Great for offering a DJ set as part of the offered perks!


    And if you read this far down, thanks for your commitment. V dedicated.
