story:
WELCOME TO STARGAZER

 The tap room is furnished with dark woods, the lights are low and a warm fire crakles in a near by fireplace. There is an open sky light, allowing the beauty of the night sky to shine through. Picturesque photographs of cosmic themed artwork decorate the interior. You are welcomed by bright smiles as if you were long, lost family. “Come on in! We’re glad to see you tonight!”

 

STATEMENT OF PURPOSE

 We currently reside in Grand Rapids, Michigan but will soon be relocating to Corvallis, Oregon. This is a new business in the start-up phase.  Stargazer Brewing will be a small scale microbrewery that will be located in Corvallis, Oregon.  Oregon leads the nation in breweries per capita and due to certain tax advantages available only to microbrewers, it is a profitable business to be in. “Dozens of varieties of hops are grown in Oregon's valleys, grains from the highlands are raised for the malt and there are even some of the top labs making brewers yeasts, right in Oregon.” (Oregon.com) It is for these reasons and many more that Oregon is the ideal state for microbrewers seeking to start their own business.

 What is a microbrewery? A microbrewery is defined as one that brews less than 20,000 barrels per year. Stargazer Brewing plans to start production at 2,000 barrels per year, with plans to expand as production demand increases.

 This Initial brew rig will give us the capability of producing 1 barrel at a time and will aid in the securing of our brewing licenses. Initial plans are to travel to local festivals, handing out samples of our products, so that we become known in the community.

 Our long term plans are to produce two distinct lines of products. One shall be a line of fruit ales, complete with seasonal offerings. These types of beers sell quickly and tend to be quite popular. The second line of products will be a mix of English and Belgian style ales, which appeal to the more seasoned beer connoisseurs. In addition specialty house beers will be brewed and always available on tap. In-house and take-out sales will be offered through our planned on-site tap room. Tours and sampling will also be offered.

 

WHAT WE NEED

 We are currently asking for $10,000 for the purchase of larger brewing equipment, lab equipment, and the purchase of logoed brewery swag. Below is a break down of exactly what we need and the approximate costs.

 

55 gallon conical fermenter                      $1300

75 gallon boil kettle                                 $1000

55 gallon mash tun                                  $800

75 gallon hot liquor tank                      $1500

Brewery pumps and plumbing fittings $600

Microscope                                             $200

Stains & counting slides                       $80

Auto Clave                                            $600

Glass ware                                            $100

Trademarking Brewery Name              $550

 Total                                                    $6730

 The rest will be used to purchase brewery swag to share with all of you for investing your hard earned dollars in us!

  

MEET THE CREW

  Crystal Hibbs: I am a college student in my senior year at Grand Valley State University, majoring in Communications with an emphasis in film & video. I will receive my Bachelor of Communications in April. I also plan to pursue my MBA in the very near future. My eloquence and professionalism in speaking and writing make me a valuable asset to Stargazer Brewing as its business manager.

 Leslie Tenmaers: As chief engineer, Leslie is a tech geek with a background in industrial automation, PLC’s, and CNC repair. Leslie also plays bass guitar and drums and enjoys Japanese swordsmanship and spending time in the rainforest.

 Eric “Kiri” Stromberg: Kiri is a brewing experimenter. His first test of a new recipe is by-the-book, but then he’ll start doing interesting things with it and end up with something new and delightful. His “Einhorn” series of fruit beers are a notable success, and will become part of our regular lineup. He’s also an avid amateur astronomer who will tell you far too much about stellar evolution.

 Combined, we bring over 30 years of brewing experience to the team!

 

 

OUR MISSION STATEMENT

 

Everyone who opens a brewery wants to make great beer; we’re no exception to this. However, in founding this company we realized that we also had an opportunity to determine what kind of business it is that we want to run. After some discussion, we decided that it is necessary for Stargazer Brewing to reflect our values and remain true to them. This is who we are, and this is what we do.

Stargazer is committed to sustainability, community, and product.

 Commitment to sustainability:  To the extent that it’s possible, we will use power from renewable resources and include energy-saving technologies in our engineering. Water that’s used for heating and cooling will be recirculated and reused, instead of being allowed to go down the drain. Waste products from the brewing process will be returned to the environment through composting or used as livestock feed rather than going to a landfill. Our bottles will be washed and reused, and paper and cardboard products will be recycled. All of this is good for us and good for the environment.

 Commitment to community: Our intent is to provide permanent jobs to local people, at good wages and with attractive benefits. Our hiring will be without regard to race, gender, and orientation. We will create a workplace that’s friendly and enjoyable, and treat our people like they’re our people: our friends and family. Beyond our company, we will work to integrate with the community at large through providing student internships and supporting local pro-social causes. In short, we want this company to be as good a citizen as we are ourselves.

 Oh, and about our beer…

 Commitment to product: We will use locally-grown ingredients to make distinctive beers that reflect the unique character of their place of origin. Winemakers call this terroir; we want to bring that sensibility to bear upon our brewing. Further, we are interested in making and promoting less-common beer styles that don’t get much attention from large industrial breweries, thereby making enjoyment of beer a richer and more varied experience. We recognize that brewing is a real craft, and that great beer is made, not simply manufactured.

 Make an investment in Stargazer Brewing and help us protect the environment and share great beer with the world!

story:
My Story

Hello, I’m Tiffany Krumins inventor of the AVA the Elephant medicine dispenser and I'm an entrepreneur who is passionate about helping children. 

 

As I worked with children with special needs and volunteered at my local children's hospital, I watched children refuse to take the medicine their illness dictated and I was inspired to design and patent a one-of-a-kind talking medicine dispenser, AVA the Elephant!  AVA takes the fear and anxiety out of medicine time! (www.AVAtheElephant.com)  

 

 

 

I got my lucky break on ABCs Shark Tank when Barbara Corcoran invested $50,000 in AVA – taking my idea from prototype to consumer product!

Shortly after the show I was diagnosed with cancer and my desire to help sick children only grew, I knew so well the pain they faced.  

For the launch of my second product I wanted to take a different approach.  Read this article to learn why I decided on Indiegogo and crowd funding:

http://searchenginewatch.com/article/2216880/Successful-Crowdfunding-Campaigns-Arent-About-Cash-Says-Shark-Tank-Winner

 

 

 

 

After seeing the joyful faces of children and parents who use AVA, I decided to add a second product that would ultimately be the perfect fit for my brand! It solves the problems associated with taking a child’s temperature. As you can imagine developing medical devices can be quite expensive!

           

I need to launch my newest product, AVA the Elephant Thermometer Stickers!  It is always a struggle taking your child's temperature - wouldn’t you rather let them sleep at night while easily monitoring their temperature?

The AVA the Elephant thermometer sticker, with its liquid crystal technology, allows you to accurately monitor your child’s temperature for 24 hours without having to poke & prod and wake them up. I am thrilled to offer parents & caregivers a non-invasive, kid friendly way to read a child's temperature!

I made sure the stickers were Latex-FREE, hypoallergenic, and could be easily placed on the child's forehead. I kept the design simple and fun, and made sure the child's temperature was easy to read. 

 

 

There is nothing more challenging than watching your child suffer and that's why I'm asking for your help! Lets ease the pain and bring smiles to children's faces all across the country!

 

 

What I Need & What YOU Get! 

I need to raise $22,000 more to get my product into the hands of the moms & kids who need them most - that also includes hospitals and schools! 

My entrepreneurial journey started only because of my passion for helping children. I want to be able to give back to the kids who inspire me so I will be donating 10% of my funding to Camp Dream Street!  

What is Dream Street? It is a camp for children with life threatening illnesses where they can go to enjoy a week of worry-free fun at no cost to them.  I had the pleasure of visiting last year and I plan to be involved with them for many years to come! 

          (http://www.dreamstreetfoundation.org/)

To learn more about me and my story visit:  http://tiffanykrumins.com/

Here is a breakdown of the Perks:

$10 

One package of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!

$25   

Limited edition"AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser Personally as signed by the inventor, Tiffany Krumins! Also, 2 packages of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!  Your package will also include a thank you note from a child at Dream Street!  ($19.97 Retail Value!)  

$100

An AVA the Elephant Baby Gift Basket. Includes 1 edition "AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser with a personal thank you note from Tiffany the inventor. Also, 1 package of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!

I will also send a SECOND gift basket to a child at YOUR local children's hospital or favorite charity!  

$200

A signed copy of Barbara Corcoran’s new book Shark Tales, along with a signed photograph of the sharks on set! Also, a limited edition "AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser Personally as signed by the inventor, Tiffany Krumins! Also, 2 packages of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!  

$250

Your small business will be listed as a sponsor on AVAtheElephant.com. The listing will include your company logo and a link to your website!  I will also donate a full case of AVA the Elephant's to your local children's hospital, in honor of your small business!  You will also receive a signed copy of Barbara Corcoran’s new book Shark Tales, along with a signed photograph of the sharks on set! 

$1000- SOLD OUT! 

A private business consultation with Barbara Corcoran. A 30 minute Skype consultation to answer your questions and help you with your business! Also, a limited edition "AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser Personally as signed by the inventor, Tiffany Krumins! Also, 10 packages of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!

 

 

The Impact of the AVA the Elephant Brand!

"When Braison was diagnosed with a brain tumor our world came crashing down. And to add to the stress of it all he had to take multiple medications every day. It always resulted in pulling a screaming child from under a dining room table. Then we received Ava. Now not only does he beg me for his medicine..but so does his younger brother who doesn’t even need it! Begging for medicine? Who would have thought? Ava, you take the anxiety out of medicine time..which makes the whole family happy! THANK YOU for making Braison’s world a happier place!” 

 

"My 20 month old daughter would absolutely NOT take her medicine for her Croup. She thrashed and cvried and spit it back on us, until we used Ava on her! My husband had to apologize for his eye-rolling when he saw the unbelievably dramatic difference in her behavior. She actually nodded and opened her mouth when Ava counted and said "Open Wide"! Ava makes a HUGE difference in getting her to comply. I will give this as a gift to anyone with little ones!!!"

         

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please ask others to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Support Camp Dream Street in the future!

I am thrilled to offer parents & caregivers a non-invasive, kid friendly way to read a child's temperature!
I made sure the stickers were Latex-FREE, hypoallergenic, and could be easily placed on the child's forehead. I kept the design simple and fun, and made sure the child's temperature was easy to read. 
 
 
There is nothing more challenging than watching your child suffer and that's why I'm asking for your help! Lets ease the pain and bring smiles to children's faces all across the country!
 
 
What I Need & What YOU Get! 
I need to raise $22,000 more to get my product into the hands of the moms & kids who need them most - that also includes hospitals and schools! 
My entrepreneurial journey started only because of my passion for helping children. I want to be able to give back to the kids who inspire me so I will be donating 10% of my funding to Camp Dream Street!  
What is Dream Street? It is a camp for children with life threatening illnesses where they can go to enjoy a week of worry-free fun at no cost to them.  I had the pleasure of visiting last year and I plan to be involved with them for many years to come! 
          (http://www.dreamstreetfoundation.org/)

To learn more about me and my story visit:  http://tiffanykrumins.com/
Here is a breakdown of the Perks:
$10 
One package of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!
$25   
Limited edition"AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser Personally as signed by the inventor, Tiffany Krumins! Also, 2 packages of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!  Your package will also include a thank you note from a child at Dream Street!  ($19.97 Retail Value!)  
$100
An AVA the Elephant Baby Gift Basket. Includes 1 edition "AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser with a personal thank you note from Tiffany the inventor. Also, 1 package of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!
I will also send a SECOND gift basket to a child at YOUR local children's hospital or favorite charity!  
$200
A signed copy of Barbara Corcoran’s new book Shark Tales, along with a signed photograph of the sharks on set! Also, a limited edition "AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser Personally as signed by the inventor, Tiffany Krumins! Also, 2 packages of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!  
$250
Your small business will be listed as a sponsor on AVAtheElephant.com. The listing will include your company logo and a link to your website!  I will also donate a full case of AVA the Elephant's to your local children's hospital, in honor of your small business!  You will also receive a signed copy of Barbara Corcoran’s new book Shark Tales, along with a signed photograph of the sharks on set! 
$1000- SOLD OUT! 
A private business consultation with Barbara Corcoran. A 30 minute Skype consultation to answer your questions and help you with your business! Also, a limited edition "AVA the Elephant" medicine dispenser Personally as signed by the inventor, Tiffany Krumins! Also, 10 packages of the first run of "AVA the Elephant" Thermometer Stickers!
 
 
The Impact of the AVA the Elephant Brand!
"When Braison was diagnosed with a brain tumor our world came crashing down. And to add to the stress of it all he had to take multiple medications every day. It always resulted in pulling a screaming child from under a dining room table. Then we received Ava. Now not only does he beg me for his medicine..but so does his younger brother who doesn’t even need it! Begging for medicine? Who would have thought? Ava, you take the anxiety out of medicine time..which makes the whole family happy! THANK YOU for making Braison’s world a happier place!” 
 
"My 20 month old daughter would absolutely NOT take her medicine for her Croup. She thrashed and cvried and spit it back on us, until we used Ava on her! My husband had to apologize for his eye-rolling when he saw the unbelievably dramatic difference in her behavior. She actually nodded and opened her mouth when Ava counted and said "Open Wide"! Ava makes a HUGE difference in getting her to comply. I will give this as a gift to anyone with little ones!!!"
         
Other Ways You Can Help!
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please ask others to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
Support Camp Dream Street in the future!

story:
//SUUBI means HOPE//

In a place where 31% of the population lives on less than $1 a day, taking care of a child with disabilities can easily be put to the bottom of the priorties list . With no intentions of neglect, that is exactly what happens in many cases. Children go without the medical attention they desperately need and without the mental and physical stimulation that they so desperately crave.
Vanessa (pictured above) is one of the many. Found laying on the cold hard floor of her mothers small one roomed restaurant, deserted in her normal spot. She has cerebral palsy. Most likely this was brought on by letting malaria go untreated. Her father abandoned the family after Vanessa's condition worsened and he thought they had been cursed. Vanessa had no where to go, nothing to do and no hope. This is what Suubi House is all about...

Suubi House runs a day program in Kampala, Uganda where children with physical and mental disabilities come to get the care and attention they need and a place where their families are empowered to better care for them. It is a home full of HOPE. The program includes lots of playing, singing, filling our bellies, physical therapy, learning and growing. In the evenings Suubi House is used as a community house to hold things like youth group, discipleship programs and worship nights.

We aim to bring HOPE in and through Christ as we build a community caring for and empowering children and families who have been affected by disability.

And we need your help!

In order for five children to particpate in the program we need $845 per month. This cost covers rent and utilities for Suubi House, lunch for each child, transport costs for children, program resources, family training sessions and staff salaries.


Want to get involved?

- Give now!
- Ask us about sponsoring a child to be a part of our program.

- Volunteer in Uganda.

Contact us on FB @ facebook.com/SuubiHouse

or email suubihouse@gmail.com to learn more.

THANK YOU.

story:
Introducing GO Box: 

GO Box is the first reusable take-out container system available to the public that makes it easier to avoid the single-use disposables we encounter on a daily basis.

 

As a GO Box member, you can ask for a GO Box at your favorite participating vendors all over San Francisco and select Bay Area cities. 

With GO Box, your meal is served in a BPA-free, durable, and reusable container that is dishwasher and microwave safe and will be recycled at the end of its life. Now, you can eat your lunch and love the planet too!

 


The containers can be returned at convenient drop-off locations and washed at commercial dishwashing facilities. A sparkling clean container will be waiting for you to use again the next time you visit your favorite restaurant!

We are partnering with local restaurants like the five-star Luce Restaurant to wash GO Boxes and with soup kitchens like St. Anthony's to wash the containers after-hours when their dishwashing equipment sits idle. By optimizing the use of their commercial dishwashers, we are creating new job opportunities and a new green service for our cities!

 

Why is GO Box Important?

The GO Box service aims to reduce waste at the source, which is the best and most sustainable solution to our trash problem. Reusing saves energy, prevents pollution, fights climate change and takes pressure off our already overflowing landfills. We need to chip away at throw-away culture and usher in the new paradigm of reuse. 

Single-use disposable products are a relatively recent phenomenon. In the mid-50s the plastic and chemical industries sold the American public on the convenience of the “throwaway” lifestyle.  Now, throw-away packaging from every industrial nation litters beaches and oceans world-wide, piles up in landfills and contributes vast amounts of methane to the atmosphere. To learn more, please visit http://www.cleanwateraction.org/ca/rethinkdisposable 

Furthermore, trash reduction is the law as cities are under pressure to reach their trash reduction mandates.  The plastic bag ban is one example, and we've been receiving steady inquiries from Bay Area cities to bring Go Box to them. 

This innovative program will PREVENT thousands of single-use food containers from ending up in the trash and help change the landscape of lunchtime waste generation at:

  • food vendors
  • favorite eating spots
  • the office
  • the landfill
  • in our streets and waterways
And you can have a ground-level role in making it happen!

Your backing of this project will be a vote of support. It will send a message that people like the idea of product reuse and stewardship. And thanks to crowd-funding platforms such as Indiegogo, people now have the power to vote with their dollars to help create bottom-up green initiatives instead of waiting passively for government to do so. 

Together, let's take a leadership role to create green jobs and needed new green services that didn't exist before! 

Success here means expansion to other cities and a vote for Reuse!


What We Need:

Crowd-funding will allow us to get the GO Box ball rolling by expanding this concept into a major American city. After that, the program should expand synergistically: As more vendors and members sign up, more income will be generated, more inventory will get purchased, and expansion at new locations will take place. Our biggest challenge is the ambitious goal of rolling this program out at multiple Bay Area cities. If the campaign does not reach its goal, the funds will be used to implement the program in a smaller geographic area as we continue to seek additional funding. But the first step is to get the genie out of the "GO Box"!

Here are the key elements needed to get the project off the ground:

Inventory ($5,000): We will need $5,000 to purchase an inventory of 1,000 containers. This will be enough to begin implementing the program in the downtown core and conduct pilots in select cities and corporate locations around the San Francisco Bay Area.

Drop Boxes ($1,000): These attractive, custom made drop-off boxes are made from sustainably harvested wood. The price also includes a liner made from non-porous durable nylon.

Operations ($5,000): At its core, GO Box will need to be an efficient pick up and delivery service. To make that happen in a cost-effective way, we're partnering with restaurants and soup kitchens with commercial dishwashing facilities to wash the containers. But we still need to hire staff and deal with logistics. We'll also be purchasing a fleet of bikes and and bike trailers for efficient and zero emission transporting of the containers. 

Outreach for Membership and Partnerships ($2,000): For the program to succeed and expand, we will need to recruit more users and reach out to municipalities and companies for partnership and support. This will take time and expenses but these relationships and stream of income is the backbone of the business, so it's an important one!

Technology ($2,000): We can run the program using tokens, but wouldn't it be better if we had Android and iOs smartphone apps and SmartCard technology for optimum check-out and return of the containers? Continuous improvement on user experience is critical to our success!

What You Get:

We've got many reusable food-related items and unique perks for contributing to GOBox. All are great for the holidays and can make your stocking stuffers more sustainable! Here are some examples with photos of our perks in our Gallery (click Gallery tab on the top of page). 

  • Sustainable & Compact Utensils from our friends at Bambu
  • Reusable Cutlery from our friends at To-Go Ware
  • Metal mason jar drinking lids from EcoJarz
  •  Unbreakable silicone half-pint glasses from SiliPint
  • Bamboo Straws and Toothbrushes from our friends at Brush with Bamboo 
  • Beautiful reusable cloth napkins from our friends at Love for Earth
  • Delicious fair-trade chocolate truffles with compostable wrappers from AlterEco
  • Personalized Thank You videos from GO Box staff + family + pets 
  • Discounted GO Box memberships + GO Boxes for contributors not in San Francisco
  • Google Hangout with a member of WildLife Works + Awesome Eco Shirt!
  • Your very own GO Box namesake program in the Bay Area!

Keep an eye out on our updates- we will be introducing new perks as the campaign rolls on and have exclusive gifts for #GivingTuesday! 

Meet the Founder of GO Box SF, 

Paul Liotsakis:


When I was 9 years old my family moved from an suburban American town to a village in the island of Crete, Greece. I returned back to the U.S when I was 16 to finish high school and attend college. Spending my formative years in a small village gave me insight into ways other people see the world and live their lives. Most importantly, I was able to see (and be drawn to) the beautiful diversity our planet in terms of people and the environment. I'm passionate about work that makes a difference in the world and I take pride in seeing my projects reach their full potential. I don't like wasting opportunities or resources as I know how valuable they are. 

Since graduating college and subsequently getting my green MBA from the Presidio School of Management, I've worked on bringing once marginal environmental concepts into the mainstream. As an Americorps volunteer, I worked on urban gardening and greening and created a food business using products grown by youth in urban gardens. As the Associate Director for an environmental non-profit in the energy sector, I created and managed a program in peak power management (Demand-Response), a marketplace now worth over 1.3 billion dollars. With GO Box, I look forward to continue playing a role in ushering in new products and services that improve our world.

Waste reduction is synergistic with the energy conservation work I've been doing with small businesses and  property management firms. The people I speak with to implement energy saving initiatives are the same people I will need to talk to about implementing this waste reduction initiative. These companies along with the their sustainability-minded workers will be our customers. 

So far, everyone I have spoken to wholeheartedly embraces the idea AND can't wait to get started!!

Frequently Asked Questions: 

Are the containers clean and safe? The cleaning and sanitizing standards used are the same as those required of restaurants. GO Box containers are cleaned using commercial dishwashing equipment in a health department certified facility. After washing, the containers are also inspected by GO Box staff.

Can I bring my own clean container to the restaurant and ask them to serve my food in it? FDA rules prohibit restaurants from serving food in a container brought in to the establishment by a customer (beverage containers, like coffee mugs, are exempt from this rule). GO Box has solved this problem by delivering professionally-sanitized containers directly to the vendors. You are allowed, however, to take leftovers from your plate and put them in a container you brought in. 

Where will I be able to pick up food in a GO Box container once I sign up for the program? You will be able to take food to-go in any GO Box participating restaurant. Our goal is to get as many restaurants on board as possible, as soon as possible.

What if people don’t return their GOBox containers? Only GO Box members (either by having a token or the GoBox app showing current membership) will be allowed to take food in the reusable container. Membership will be verified by participating vendors. Upon return of your container at the drop site you will receive a token or scan your card allowing continued use of the system. Depending on technology capability, we may hold a deposit allowing you to continue using GO Box while having others unreturned.  The deposit will incentivize people to bring their containers back!

Won’t the collection bins get smelly and attract pests? The GO Box program in Portland has drop boxes in locations ranging from office lobbies to gyms and this have never been an issue in two years of operation. The sturdy and secure collection box along with the washable non-porous liner makes this not a problem.  The liner is changed at every pick up several times a week.

What about recyclable, compostable, or biodegradable containers? Aren’t those enough? Good question. Every time a reusable takeout container is used, that’s one less single-use container manufactured for just one meal. Each of those disposables needs to be manufactured, shipped a long way, and cared for at its end-of-life, leading to significant environmental impacts. Secondly, given today’s infrastructure and consumer behavior, most disposable containers still end up in the landfill, regardless of whether or not they could be recycled or composted. And finally, reusable takeout containers enable more economic activity to happen locally. We pay people to collect, clean, and redistribute the containers locally rather than paying manufacturers and distributors to make and ship containers a long distance.

Do containers get stained or fall apart if they’re used too many times? The containers have been tested in hundreds of places by thousands of customers and typically last for more than 400 uses and they don’t stain. Additionally they get inspected before going our and problem ones get removed from circulation.

Can I put GO Box containers in my own dishwasher or microwave? Yes, they are microwave and dishwasher safe.

How clean does the GO Box container need to be before I put it in the drop box? Do I need to wash it?
You do not need to wash or rinse the container before returning it to the drop box, but please make sure it’s as free of food and liquid as possible. If you have the ability to easily give it a quick rinse, that’s great, but not necessary.

Do you have any handouts I can email to coworkers and friends or print out for my office?
Yes we do! Please contact us. We also offer:
Green Box Lunch Presentations– Invite GO Box out for a free presentation!
Corporate Program – Get a Drop Box for your office!

Can I buy more than one subscription?
If you want to have a couple or several containers in circulation, no problem. You can buy as many subscriptions as you like. GO Box subscriptions also make great gifts!

What if I lose my container or my token?
Please email us at info@goboxsfbay.com if you lost your container or token.


Welcome Reuse Pioneers and ...

story:
The Hager Mountain Pack and Lok-Sling

Why?

I wanted a hiking and hunting pack that was made with classic materials and workmanship but had a modern, elegant design. Nothing like that existed on the market so I designed my own. After several prototypes and multiple hunting and hiking trials, we have something unique and functional made right here in the USA.

The Hager Mountain Pack

What's next?

The prototypes are complete, the US based material and hardware suppliers are chosen, and the Seattle-base manufacturer is ready to start. All we need is you!

What will this campaign do?

Raise money to buy materials and tooling and hire manufacturing capacity to make the first production run of packs and slings.

Tell us more...

Fall 2011: Stepping straight up the 45-degree slope, I follow the tracks just made by a mob of 5 or so elk. Fresh snow makes tracking easy. I turn as the elk did and move slowly across the steep slope, being careful of my footing with each step. I shift my rifle to my right shoulder, the downhill side, and reach out to steady myself with my left hand. I can touch the ground without bending over.  My downhill foot slips and I lunge for a tree to catch my fall, causing my rifle sling to slip off my shoulder. I grab for the sling with my left hand, slip again and sit down heavily, sliding down the hill several feet. The sling, hanging from the crook of my arm, allows the rifle to sit nicely in the snow.

Starting a long day

Ten minutes later I have cleared the snow from the barrel, wiped down the rifle, and am moving again.

This was during my first elk hunt in 2011. My bud Jim and I were in the Fremont Mountains of Oregon hunting on the northern slopes of Hager Mountain. The thing about elk is they really don’t like people, or roads, or trails, or terrain that is remotely comfortable for a human to travel on. 

Hager Mountain Summit

That slip and fall is memorable not because it happened once, but rather because it happened dozens of times. Along with the difficult terrain, I was being sabotaged by my equipment choices, specifically my pack and rifle sling in combination. The pack was uncomfortable and pulled me off balance even with the modest 20 pounds of stuff I was carrying, and it was too wide to allow the rifle to sling and stay on my shoulder. The width also made it catch and grab at the manzanita, scrub pine and blow-down we were surrounded by. I fell, dropped my rifle, and slipped and slid all day long. We saw and stalked that small group of elk for about 10 hours but they gave us the slip crossing over to the south side of the peak. By day’s end I was little more than an exhausted pile of frustration.

There had to be a better way to sling a pack and rifle  so you have good balance, both hands free, but still have quick and quiet access to your rifle, That night Jim and I started to modify my pack and sling to make it better suited for the job. I made a hacked up version that marginally improved the sling but most importantly it started the wheels turning.

2 and a half years later we have a fully realized and tested prototype, US materials suppliers and manufacturers lined up, and a production run of 200 minimum to begin. 

Hager Mountain Pack Prototype

Hager Mountain Lok-Sling prototype

This is where you the contributor come in. We need your help to make the Hager Mountain Pack and Lok-Sling a reality.

What's in it for me?

We have  a bunch of perks from mugs and t-shirts to exclusive leather logo coasters for smaller donations.

At the Coaster Testing Facility

Mug perk

Larger donations get you a first-run pack, a handmade (by Mike) Lok-Sling rifle sling, or both. You also get the good feeling of helping launch another American manufacturing business.

Cash is short. How else can I help?

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Use the tools at Indiegogo to share this campaign on social media.
  • Share this campaign on facebook
  • Tweet it
  • Tell everyone you know to tell everyone they know
  • blog it
  • shout it out
  • Buy US made goods whenever possible

classic materials and workmanship but had a modern, elegant design. Nothing like that existed on the market so I designed my own. After

unique and functional made right here in the USA.
The Hager Mountain Pack

and hardware suppliers are chosen, and the Seattle-base manufacturer is ready
to start. All we need is you!

story:
Everyone has a place in their heart to GIVE.

My name Veronica Neal and my family and I love to help people but this time we get to help people, help people! 

I have met two wonderful young ladies that love to serve, they both serve in the kids ministry at our church. The fact that I have three little high energy boys, I appreciate the teachers and students that volunteer their time and efforts. These girls are very involved in church functions and community outreach. 

We have been attending the church( ThatChurch) for about a year and a half and we love it! What I love the most is that there is always an opportunity to serve and impact the lives of others. And this is one of those opportunities.

It is a honor to help fund their mission trip. We can serve by giving.

 
 Ashleigh (21) is a nursing student at UCA & Maddie (15) is in 10th grade at Abundant Life School. They have both wanted to go on a mission trip for a few years now & Haiti was their 1st choice. 


We need your help! 

The mission trip is from June 18th - June 28th

The trip is around $1800 each $3600 for them both.

The focus of this trip is to minister the gospel to an impoverished people and help provide clean drinking water through water purification systems.

Can you imagine not having water? Or clean drinking water? Well, there are people in Haiti that don't have clean water and here is our opportunity to make that happen for them! Even though you and I may not be going to Haiti we still can play a HUGE part in meeting the need for clean water and the hearing of Gods word.

With your help together we can accomplish these things:

1. Needs will be met with the installation of the water purification systems.

2. Spead the gospel of Jesus Christ

3. Ashleigh and Maddie can go serve without burdening the family financially. And one of there dreams will become a reality.

This is a picture from last year mission trip. There is hope you guys!!!



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t give a donation that’s okay, just say a little prayer for Ashleigh and Maddie as they go to serve the people of Haiti and make God known. Also please share this link with your family and friends, your co-workers and on your social media sites this would help a lot. Thanks!

story:
Libby is a talented female competitive surfer from Gower, South Wales, She has been surfing for many years but never had the courage or confidence to enter competitions. Last year she managed to overcome all this and entered several Welsh and English competitions and was pleasantly surprised with the results! Her best result was placing 2nd in the Welsh Nationals!
Consequently she has been chosen by the Welsh Surfing Federation (WSF) to represent Wales at the 2015 European Surfing Championships held by the European Surf Federation International in Casablanca, Morocco, between 10 - 21 September.

This is fantastic news and Libby is ecstatic to have been given this opportunity to represent her country at an international standard.

The WSF have been fantastic in organising the Welsh team and arrangements for this event, however there is currently no sponsorship for the team and therefore the entire trip costs lie 100% with each individual.

Libby is lucky to be sponsored for some kit, which includes wetsuits from GUL, clothing from SLABI and a surfboard from SDF, however there are still others costs standing in her way i.e. flights & accommodation

This is where Libby desperately needs your support.

Whether you know Libby personally, as a friend or family member, or have heard of her through surfing. Maybe you're a fellow surfer wanting to help Libby fulfill her dreams to compete and progress, or maybe you're be a proud patriot of Wales and want to support the WELSH TEAM :) Whatever your reasons, Libby would be exteremly grateful for any support, no matter how big or small!

Please help Libby reach her goal and get her to MOROCCO!!!!!!!

story:
This project is inspired by Hugo's own story


On the outskirts of Buenos Aires, a city often touted as the Paris of South America, live 9 million people -- the majority in only "partially urbanized" settings, the streets still unpaved and the housing precarious.

Hugo grew up in one of these neighborhoods and the rest of his family still lives there, scraping by -- four generations live in a one-room house.  He wasn't born there, but rather in a province 800 miles to the north, and his family at that time was the most prominent in town. His father, grandfather and uncle owned the factories, trucking companies and dominated the import / export business.  They even had their own ambulance.  When televisions arrived to the area, they bought the first one.  Every afternoon they'd bring it outside, the whole town would gather and kids would even sit in the trees to watch.

When Hugo was five years old, his uncle passed away, and shortly thereafter his grandfather.  Hugo's dad got sick as well and lost everything they had.  The Rios family left the north and ended up in a poor settlement outside of the Capital. His dad drank himself to death and when Hugo was nine, he started working to support his mom and three older sisters.  

As such, he didn't have much of a childhood.  He was forced to learn skills, and he learned them well -- he worked in construction, carpentry, as a blacksmith, in a gas plant; he made thatched rooves, he installed cable, he even made chocolate easter eggs.  Now he has a team of ten working for him as a contractor, the men all from his neighborhood who he has spent years training.

This story is his, as is the dream -- I am writing it for him because he doesn't speak english.  When I told him about the concept of crowdfunding, he was amazed that people in another country would care about his cause.   I said they would, so please help me keep my word.  


The Dream Warehouse

This is a place to fulfill kids' dreams who normally get the don't much but the shaft.  They live in a low-income suburb just outside of the city proper, and they've never had a birthday party let alone been to the movies.  Most of their parents have two jobs and do they best they can.  Often times these kids don't know life outside of the "barrio" and don't see other possibilities.

The Dream Warehouse is for these kids.  

It will have the following:

  • A mini-cinema -- a projector and a big screen to show movies once a week and for use during birthday parties. 
  • A theater -- a stage to have puppet shows and also acting workshops for the kids, taught by a local who has volunteered her time.
  • A "pelotero" or "bouncing castle" -- this is the classic Argentine birthday party venue, which will be used to host birthday parties for free, for kids whose families can't afford to celebrate
  • Teaching space -- used for classes and workshops, both creative and vocational: from carpentry, baking and plumbing to painting and drawing. 

Hugo is conscious of the fact that many of the people in his neighborhood grew up the same way he did (please see his story below), but many choose an "easier" way out and end up on the wrong side of the line.  So his goal is to give kids a place to be kids and get to enjoy their childhood, despite their economic circumstances.  And in turn, as they have positive experiences, they'll be more inclined to participate in classes that will serve their future better, whether it be in carpentry, miniature woodwork, or how to build a home.



Two haves make a whole (not a typo :))

Hugo has invested all of his savings in buying the land for the space and the raw materials to start building.  He is also putting in all of the labor himself.  People in the neighborhood come and help when they can, and they have donated everything from door handles to piping.

With the unpredictable inflation here, Hugo doesn't have enough to finish the building and put a roof on the place.  And that's where you come in...

He needs help with the following:

  • Entrance and rolling steel garage door 
  • The structure and roof covering + ventilation --
  • Bathroom installations
  • Electric distribution
  • Chairs for the cinema and theatre
  • Baking ovens -- Hugo will have a working bakery which will cover the monthly operating costs, and he will also use them to teach classes
  • Theatre stage
  • Floor covering (cement)
  • The cinema projector and screen


Now more than ever, your donation will go far here -- currently, the exchange rate (8 pesos to 1 dollar) means that whatever amount you donate will make an incredible difference.  So even if you think that 15 dollars won't make a dent, it will and it will make one to remember!  

In return, you'll experience the appreciation first-hand of these very kids. They volunteered to make the perks when they found out about the project -- they will benefit in countless ways from your generosity and want you to know it.  



A dollar for your thoughts

Hugo asks that you think back for a minute about your own childhood,  Remember if you looked forward to getting a birthday present, or having a party.  

Now imagine kids having that same hope, but not having it fulfilled.  

This Dream Warehouse is for exactly that, so that a child never has to feel forgotten.  

Even if you can't contribute, you can share it with other people and ask them to think back.  Fire it up on facebook, on twitter, in your office, at your kid's school. There is no place where this isn't relevant, there is no place where someone wasn't once a child.


        To feel good today is to do good tomorrow.



Muchísimas gracias from Hugo and the kids.


* Note:  I, the narrator of this story, am Amanda -- an American living in Buenos Aires.  Last year I put up my own campaign to build the first female martial arts school in Argentina.  With the contributions I earned, I did just that and now my dojo is up and running. It's called Betsubara Dojo.  Hugo is the man who made it all happen, who took the empty space and turned it into something beautiful.  I tell you this so you see his capacity, both physically as a contractor and his vision in turning a dream into reality.  Please stop by the website or facebook to see photos of how the work turned out, and feel free to ask any questions about this project.

story:
Be A Part of "Adopting" Part of Tacloban

In partnership with All Hands Volunteers, Hope for Haiyan will be adopting an area of the Philippines hardest hit by the typhoon. When media attention goes away, All Hands comes in and starts the long, intensive process of rebuilding homes and communities. In fact, they are STILL on the ground rebuilding homes from Typhoon Sendong in 2011!!

Unlike other fundraising efforts or organizations, these coordinated efforts will be COMPLETELY transparent:

  • Continuous picture and video updates on the ground
  • ALL proceeds will go directly to All Hands Volunteers efforts in rebuilding the houses and communities
  • Volunteers come from Europe, N. America, Asia, and ALL pay their own travel expenses to the Philippines
  • Dedicated, tangible area of the Philippines (we are currently deciding which area of Tacloban, Leyte, or Ormoc to adopt)

Live Concert Event

On December 14th, 2013, Hope for Haiyan is also hosting a charity concert and performance in Houston, TX. More details about the event, and ticket purchasing information are here. We will be live streaming the event and announcing the IndieGogo fundraising progress at the event!!

Performances by:

  • Jeremy Passion - Singer/Youtube Star (FB Page & Twitter)
  • Brian Puspos - MTV's America's Best Dance Crew (FB Page & Twitter)
  • Andrew Garcia - American Idol Contestant (FB Page & Twitter)
  • Ian Eastwood - (FB Page & Twitter)

Track Record

All Hands has vast experience managing projects in the Philippines. 

Project CDO Highlights

  • 180 permanent homes built
  • 352 volunteers empowered
  • 40,000 volunteer hours
  • Project CDO Overview


Where the Funds Will Go

  • 100% of funds (less cost of shirts and posters) go straight to All Hands Volunteers 
  • All volunteers pay their own travel expenses EXCEPT for sponsors of the "All Star" perk (limit of 4), for which round-trip airfare will be paid from their donation (estimated cost: $1200). All other proceeds go straight to rebuilding.

story: My best friend is an awesome queer woman who dreams of being a midwife. She has trained to be a doula and is a single mother to an amazing two year old. They are really struggling right now. She has finally found a place and is no longer homeless. She has a job but it doesn't pay enough money for her to pay for child care. My friend's mother can watch her child for free but unfortunately she has no transportation most days to get her daughter to her mothers so she can go to work. She has been finding ways to make things work with friends helping out but these solutions aren't reliable. She recently started having to miss work due to lack of child care. She could very likely lose her job if this keeps happening and then we fear they will end up homeless again. She has the training to be a doula and make more money to support her family, but she can't keep her current job or be a doula without reliable transportation. Another friend of hers and I were trying to come up with a solution so she doesn't end up back in a scary situation where she has no job and her and her daughter have no housing. She is the most amazing mother and we want her to be able to focus on that rather worrying if they will have a place to live next month. We just want to see our friend and her amazing daughter have the stability and security they deserve. We are so saddened and tired of watching them struggle no matter how hard she tries. After talking with our friend we realized the only solution to empower her to be able to take care of her family long term is to help her acquire reliable transportation. She doesn't have family with money to provide this and has never owned a reliable car. She is always putting forth all she has to do the best she can for her daughter. I know if we can get her a car that she won't have to worry about losing her job, not having childcare or being homeless ever again. A car could give her the one break she needs... A car would change their lives.
story_txt: My best friend is an awesome queer woman who dreams of being a midwife. She has trained to be a doula and is a single mother to an amazing two year old. They are really struggling right now. She has finally found a place and is no longer homeless. She has a job but it doesn't pay enough money for her to pay for child care. My friend's mother can watch her child for free but unfortunately she has no transportation most days to get her daughter to her mothers so she can go to work. She has been finding ways to make things work with friends helping out but these solutions aren't reliable. She recently started having to miss work due to lack of child care. She could very likely lose her job if this keeps happening and then we fear they will end up homeless again. She has the training to be a doula and make more money to support her family, but she can't keep her current job or be a doula without reliable transportation. Another friend of hers and I were trying to come up with a solution so she doesn't end up back in a scary situation where she has no job and her and her daughter have no housing. She is the most amazing mother and we want her to be able to focus on that rather worrying if they will have a place to live next month. We just want to see our friend and her amazing daughter have the stability and security they deserve. We are so saddened and tired of watching them struggle no matter how hard she tries. After talking with our friend we realized the only solution to empower her to be able to take care of her family long term is to help her acquire reliable transportation. She doesn't have family with money to provide this and has never owned a reliable car. She is always putting forth all she has to do the best she can for her daughter. I know if we can get her a car that she won't have to worry about losing her job, not having childcare or being homeless ever again. A car could give her the one break she needs... A car would change their lives.

story:
Jamaican Lesbian and Bisexual Women Need Your Support 

Quality of Citizenship Jamaica began on January 22, 2013. In August, QCJ was incorporated as Jamaica's first and only lesbian and bisexual organisation. 

The mission of QCJ is to improve the quality of lives for lesbian, bisexual and women who have sex with other women (WSW) by creating a safe space in which they can share emotional, social and other issues they are facing without fear or judgement and equipping them with knowledge and understanding to navigate the Jamaican society.

In this short period, we have positioned ourselves as an organisation that represents the lesbian and bisexual community - an under-served community, as well as a partner for the rights of women and girls; we are known locally and internationally and have been called on for insight and information.

This campaign will allow QCJ to continue the important work started in 2013 for the under-served lesbian, bisexual and WSW community in Jamaica. This year we want to provide programs to educate and empower lesbian and bisexual women, in the form of workshops, talks, focus groups, etc around issues which the community identifies as important, continue with our visible activism and engage in activities to help move the human rights of LGBT Jamaicans forward despite the challenges.




Below are photographs taken from stands/protests in Kingston Jamaica either organised or supported by QCJ (for a total of 10 stands)


QCJ in Action

story:
Our Healing Project 

Coming from a theatre arts and yoga background, I also along the way went to India and studied Reiki and Meditation with Grandmaster Swami Amitanand.  During my time with him, I realized the importance of spreading the techniques of meditation as a tool for healing. Now, as a member of the Naturo Care Meditation Trust, I have been elected to raise funds for construction of a brand new healing center in the foothills of the Himalayas.

With the hopes of spreading the message of mindful living to all people everywhere regardless of race, religion and cultural differences - through meditation, this center will be a beacon of light for all seekers of natural knowledge.  Meditation is our god-given birthright, as is knowledge about our natural surroundings - the herbs we use, the plants we eat and their healing properties.  To incorporate age old wisdom like yoga, meditation and self-healing into modern day living will be the key to the evolution of the human race.  

When this alternative healing center is built.  It will provide an affordable haven for those seeking to transform their lives from the inside out.  In this age of chaotic globalization, we seek to offer people the tools they need to live peacefully and harmoniously with each other and their surroundings.  

Sincerely,

- Johnson Anand Saurabh

Reiki Master, Yoga/Pilates Teacher, Naturo Care & Meditation Center Fundraiser

What We Need & What You Get

This is our first round of fundraising for initial construction costs.  Building in rural Rishikesh, India takes time as most modern ways of construction aren't available.

  • We need $15,000 USD initially to help clear the untouched land.  (30 min north of the spiritual center of Rishikesh, India).
  • This fundraising money goes towards initial building costs in our 2-3 year construction project for the center, with our long term goal of raising $95,000 USD.
  • Donate and become an official member of the Naturo Care & Meditation Trust, where you will receive discounts on services and accommodation.
  • Select any of the perks to the right!  Or if you don't wish to receive any of them also let us know.  
  • In the event, we don't achieve our initial goal of $15,000 USD, the funds will still go towards the Naturo Care Meditation Trust's Construction Fund.  

The Impact

Modern life is plagued by dis-order and disorders whether physical, mental or emotional.  An epidemic of terminal diseases like cancers are exponentially rising as pharmaceutical companies make it difficult for treatment.  However, MINDFUL PREVENTION and ALTERNATIVE HEALING through ancient meditation techniques and harmonizing with nature can put an end to all of the unnecessary suffering.  

In conjunction with Swami Amitanand's Reiki healing/meditation techniques and his teaching of people how to be a responsible human being, he has successfully healed various cases of terminal diseases including cancers.  His deepest hope is to instill in everyone their innate potential and power when they open up to access their highest of intentions.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute.  Please follow our campaign, and sign up for the www.jasananda.com Newsletter to receive updates on our progress, and spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, etc.

If you are passionate about this cause, and would like to help us organize a sister fundraising campaign, please email johnson@studioanya.com with the subject - Naturo Care Meditation Center Fundraising.

Thanks for helping us make the world a better place.

story:
Our Mission

Sustainable Wares provides a full range of mindfully curated earth-friendly gifts and necessities. We are here to promote companies and artists that create products in a socially and environmentally responsible manner. We want to change what you buy and be mindful of your purchases. We want to inspire you to take the steps you need to create a comfortable, enjoyable, happy, fun, beautiful, sustainable, earth-friendly life. Besides providing a sustainable shopping experience we want to provide information and community outreach on transitioning to a more sustainable, low waste lifestyle.

We have been dreaming of expanding our refill and zero-waste section and now is the time to make those dreams come true. With this campaign, Sustainable Wares will help you achieve your goals of a low-waste lifestyle. If we reuse and refill we can reduce our community's need to recycle or send waste to the already full landfill. Save the planet, save our community!

No contribution is too small, and no effort to reduce our waste is too small! Let's do it one bottle at a time!

What We Need & What You Get

Sustainable Wares needs help to create a new low-waste, refill section in our Homer, AK store. We want to be completely transparent about how the funds will be invested so here is the breakdown. Please keep in mind these are only estimates of what we need to get this refill dream made into reality.

  1. $500 Scales, we would like to have two high-quality scales. This will include the necessary permits and certifications.
  2. $500 Small dishwasher and installation. Having a dishwasher will allow us to include a bottle exchange/donation program.
  3. $1000 Advertising and promotions. The majority of this budget will go towards becoming an underwriter for KBBI again and sponsoring non-profits that work to promote sustainability in Homer and all of Alaska. A very small portion will be used for social media advertising.
  4. $1000 Bulk bins and dispensers. These are surprisingly expensive! We will be using upcycled and used items as much as possible.
  5. $1000 Construction. We will have a countertop and table made out of upcycled materials. This also includes other supplies (signage) and labor costs.
  6. $4500 Inventory and freight. The big expense! This includes the initial low-waste, plastic-free, and bulk merchandise.
  7. $500 Miscellaneous and unknowns. There are always unknown expenses!

If we go beyond our funding goal Sustainable Wares will have the opportunity grow into a mightier and more impactful store for the Homer community. Let's go beyond this goal so we can go CRAZY AND GROW!

If we don't reach our goal we will still create a system to make your refill purchases easy and add more refillable options as our budget allows. We carefully choose your perks so that they will still be available no matter how close we get to our goal.

Get excited about the INVENTORY! What will be available in beginning?

  1. Alpenglow Skincare Products: We will add their very popular face cream to our selection. We will also be able to have a larger quantity of all their products. Having locally made reduces our carbon footprint and shipping costs!
  2. Molly's Suds: One of Sustainable Wares' favorite laundry detergent already, they now have bulk options available. Molly's Suds has recently introduced a variety of other cleaning products like All-Purpose Cleaner and Dish Soap. This is what inspired us to make our refill dreams come true!
  3. Dental Care: Toothpaste, Toothpowder, and tablets. All refillable or completely recyclable!
  4. Natural fiber and wood brushes: Compostable, replaceable, biodegradable cleaning brushes.
  5. More, more, and more so our community can have less waste!: More reusable bags and containers.

Tell us in the comments what you want to see in Sustainable Wares' refill, less-waste section!

The Impact

What is Homer's waste impact? In FY 2019 Homer hauled out:

  1. 8,264 tons of solid waste
  2. 342 tons of recyclables
  3. 649 tons of metals
  4. 9.39 tons of electronic recyclables

FY 2019 Homer landfill data from https://www.kpb.us/swd-waste/about-solidwaste

What is Sustainable Wares' small and mighty (and growing!) impact?

  1.  In 2019, we added to our selection of Alpenglow Skincare Products and sold 631 floz., which is equivalent to 78.88 8 floz bottles not going to our landfill or recycling system. This is currently the only refillable option in the store. We have a very small but dedicated group taking advantage of this option. Just imagine if we were able to let all of Homer know they can get their favorite skincare product and not add to the tons of waste we have to ship out! Side note: Homer has to ship all waste and recycling out because our landfill is FULL! 
  2. Once we are able to add more refillable options to the store the impact will be felt throughout Homer and all of our households! Let's break it down and look at laundry detergent because that will be the first addition to our expanded refill section. Let's say a household buys 5 (I made this amount up!) bottles of detergent in a year, and 2,000 (I made this amount up also, but you get the point!) households switch to our refillable options, we will save 10,000 bottles from hitting the waste/recycling stream every year! That is a  mighty impact for Homer and Sustainable Wares!
  3. Let's talk about packaging! Nope, that is too big of a topic to get into here! Just know we will use these funds to reduce the packaging that comes into Homer and in turn be shipped out (remember, our landfill is FULL!). We will also be increasing our inventory of reusable, package-free, and plastic-free items. That way, you will be able to reduce your impact on the waste/recycling stream in Homer.

Risks & Challenges

Because we have some awesome friends and supporters, we have full confidence that we will reach our funding goal to expand the refill, reusable, and plastic-free section of Sustainable Wares. If that does not happen, the money that is raised will still go towards the growth of Sustainable Wares and this refill dream but at a smaller and slower scale.

The perks we choose to show our appreciation are not dependent on the money raised as they are already a part of our inventory. Everyone will still receive the perks they requested. Sometimes things are completely out of our control. If problems do arise there might be a delay in delivery of your requested perk or we might need to change your perk to something equivalent.

Other Ways You Can Help

Believe me, I know that even donating $5 to a cause that is important to you and your community is sometimes impossible. Luckily there are so many other ways to contribute to our campaign.

  1. Get the word out about our campaign to bring refillable and zero-waste to Sustainable Wares. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, share everybody! Shout it to the world!
  2. Share, share, and share on social media! You have 30 days of sharing! And ask your friends, family, co-workers, and everybody to share! Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
About me

My name is Giovannia Musella and I live in Guatemala City. I'm 19 years old and I have been passionate about horses since I was a baby. I rode before I could even walk, and I found my passion for jump riding 7 years ago.

(I'm the one with the pony tail) 

My dream is to become a professional rider and every day I'm getting one step closer for achieving my goal. This sport in particular is very expensive and that's why I am asking you to help me get to the Winter Equestrian Festival in Wellington, Florida. 

By competing internationally I believe its a big step for my equestrian career. I'll get to experience a higher competitive level as well as a unique cultural expeirence. I'll have the oportunity to meet many professional riders and make my country be one step closer for having the same level of other countries who are known for having the best riders.


What I Need & What You Get

Since it is very expensive to take my own horses all the way to Florida, I will be renting one for a week, which will help me compete in different categories, going from jumping 1.20m until 1.30m (3' 11.2" - 4' 3.2"). Im asking for $2,500 wich will help me pay the horse rent as well as the registration fees for competing. If I don't reach my entire goal at least I believe I will be able to pay some of the expenses.

What I am offering you in exchange for helping me is:

  • My experience, contacts, videos and pictures of the event and my competitions. 

  • If you have a business and you help with my funding, I will use your logo on my show jumping jacket, or in the horses saddle pad. I will promote your business by telling everyone how you helped me funding my cause.

story:
Who We Are

Since 1958, the Knoxville Volunteer Emergency Rescue Squad (KVERS) has served all areas of Knox County, along with surrounding communities.  We are open to serve 24 hours a day and 365 days every year. Our 160 volunteers provide many services to our community, including: primary rescue, secondary vehicle rescue, primary technical rescue, emergency medical first response, medical stand-by, animal rescue/removal, and water rescue/recovery.

Aside from these main rescue services, we have six Specialty Rescue Teams who perform various services:

•  Cave, vertical, and confined space operations

•  Heavy and technical rescue—farm accidents, airplane accidents, trench collapses

•  Water rescue—top and underwater operations

•  Land based search operations

•  Support services

•  Disaster and medical operations.

   

What We Need

KVERS services the community in a variety of ways and at no charge to those in need.  Knoxville County considers our organization an essential service, just like the Knoxville Police Department (KPD), Knoxville Fire Department  (KFD), and Rural Metro. Our organization has served the community at large for 55 years, but we need your help in order to continue to provide our services.

Unlike the much larger budgets of Rural Metro and KPD, KVERS offers its services solely through our volunteers, saving Knox County residents over $800,000 a year in tax payer dollars. In order to maximize efficiency and save precious time, we desperately need funds in order to digitize our entire collection of paper files.  An estimated amount for our organization to accomplish this goal is $5,800. 

To begin, we are asking you to help us out with small portion of this overall cost. Our set goal is to raise a total of $1,500 by April 26th, 2014. This will move us closer to our target goal and will allow the organization to better serve its number one priority, the residents of Knox County. 

  

What You Get

In response to your gracious donation, you will be able to choose from a variety of outstanding perks. For a donation of five dollars, you will receive a shout-out on our Facebook page. For fifteen dollars, you will receive a KVERS bumper sticker, and a twenty-five dollar donation will get you a KVERS collector’s coin. These two items are a KVERS exclusive and will remind you, as well as others, that you are supporting our cause.

For those wishing to donate more, a donation of seventy-five dollars will allow you the opportunity to take a CPR training class. This life saving skill will not only benefit you, but your donation will go directly toward saving lives right here in our community. Any amount over seventy-five dollars will receive all previously mentioned perks, as well as a handwritten thank you note from all of us at KVERS.

   


How It Helps

Most citizens do know that in many cases, KVERS may be the first responder when they are in a crisis. Your generous donations will allow us to continue serving our community on a day to day basis. Rest assured that your donation goes directly to KVERS and is used solely to better our organization.

How Else You Can Help

Help us get the word out by liking or sharing our Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/knoxrescuesquad

Like any other volunteer organization, time spent helping others is key! Sign up to be a volunteer today. http://www.kvers.org/volunteer/online-application/

Have an old vehicle you don’t want? Be sure to give us call. We will even pick it up for free! Call  865-546-4852

this overall cost. Our set goal is to raise a total of $1,500 by April 26th,
2014. This will move us closer to our target goal and will allow the
organization to better serve its number one priority, the residents of Knox
County.    What You Get

In response to your
gracious donation, you will be able to choose from a variety of outstanding
perks. For a donation of five dollars, you will receive a shout-out on our
Facebook page. For fifteen dollars, you will receive a KVERS bumper sticker, and a twenty-five dollar donation will get you a KVERS
collector’s coin. These two items are a KVERS
exclusive and will remind you, as well as others, that you are supporting our
cause.
For those wishing
to donate more, a donation of seventy-five dollars will allow you the
opportunity to take a CPR training class.
This life saving skill will not only benefit you, but your donation will go
directly toward saving lives right here in
our community. Any amount over seventy-five dollars will receive all previously mentioned perks, as well as a handwritten thank you note from all of us at KVERS.     How It Helps 
Most citizens do know that in many cases, KVERS may be the first responder
when they are in a crisis. Your generous donations will allow us to continue serving our community on a day to day basis. Rest assured that your donation
goes directly to KVERS and is used solely to better our organization.
How Else You Can Help
Help us get the word out by liking or sharing our Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/knoxrescuesquadLike any other volunteer organization, time spent helping others
is key! Sign up to be a volunteer today. http://www.kvers.org/volunteer/online-application/
Have an old vehicle you don’t want?
Be sure to give us call. We will even pick it up for free! Call 
865-546-4852

story:
Over the past two years I have been involved with the Good Times Diner, a local student run soup kitchen in Kingston, Ontario. This kitchen acts as a cornerstone to support those in need and routinely serves 50 people twice a week. I would like to support this cause because of its tremendous impact on the community and me, by running a marathon on May 3rd in Vancouver. 

Why a marathon? Through both running and the kitchen, I was able to see a side of Kingston that would have otherwise gone unnoticed. With each step, I hope to support the diner as it continues to build a relationship between students and the community.

Over the next few months, I will be committing myself to training while supporting awareness in the community. I plan to do this through various bake sales, as well as support from you, my friends and family.
