I plan to do this through various bake sales, as well as support from you, my friends and family.

story:
It has not been the best end or start of the year. Wolf got laid off at the beginning of Dec. We decided to go visit family because chances of finding a new job around the holidays are slim (hasn't stopped him from trying of course, but the CO Workforce page has had 1 job for him all month, good thing he isn't relying on them!). Today we got notice that the unemployment we were counting on to make bills won't be coming through. Since Wolf left the job before this last one voluntarily (he hurt his back and his supervisor was a jerk), he doesn't qualify for more than 2 weeks of unemployment! You can do the math, he's already been off work for a month!

The really bad news came on New Year's Day. We got a call from our house sitter. One of our water pipes burst and flooded our basement. At first I'm thinking it's bad, but then we Skype and it's not just bad, it's disastrous. There's a couple inches of water throughout the basement kitchen, family room, dining room, and bathroom, plus the main level bathroom, and water pouring out of what's left of the ceiling. The ceiling had fallen in multiple areas, the carpet was a lake, and the patio outside was an ice rink from the water pouring out of the house! The mitigation crew gets started almost immediately and by the time we come home a few days later we have nothing left of the basement but studs and a bath tub. Oh, and 15-20 really loud fans and dehumidifiers, and a lovely curtain wall keeping us from our bedroom. Our original campaign was to purchase some appliances for that kitchen and open it as a commercial kitchen for use for local foodies. The floors in both bathrooms were also on our "one day" list to update. Unfortunately that "one day" wasn't in the plans any time soon! Yes, we are lucky enough to have insurance, and yes, they are covering the damage. Unfortunately we have the typical large deductible and while they cover the damage, they do not cover the plumbing work to fix the problem. Which isn't just a simple patch job. We need to move multiple pipes out of the exterior walls, and into an interior spaces, so we don't have this problem every time it drops below -10 or so. It doesn't seem right to me that they won't cover that part, but that's what they say. A contractor was just here to give an estimate and said not to be surprised by the large difference in what the insurance will give us and what it's actually going to cost. He said there is a lot of work that needs to be done to bring things up to code. He also mentioned the insurance will give us values that are depreciated not actual replacement value. He said we aren't going to like the quote. 

Now if that isn't enough for you. As we are poking around looking at this plumbing problem we find not one but 3 more leaks! Since these leaks are small ones that haven't caused disasters, insurance will not be covering those. The leaks are in the walls so they weren't visible until the dry wall was removed. They are serious enough to cause mold though. 

Now not only are we faced with a deductible and large plumbing bill, we are faced with the decision to figure out a way to pay for the upgrades to the planned areas out of pocket right now or have them replaced with similar stuff that was there before and tear it all up later to upgrade. Of course the latter just seems silly so we are trying to find the money to make the upgrades now. This will allow us to put in the stuff we want to make that area a workable space. We aren't talking granite counter tops here, just changing wood floors and carpet to all tile in the kitchen/dining area, and adding one cabinet to make the island a better use of space. Our goal is to hold community homesteading classes (beekeeping, cheese making, incubating, chicken raising, knitting, canning, etc) in there as well as provide a store area for local homesteaders to showcase their stuff and have a central location for buyers to purchase from multiple vendors without having to wait for farmer's markets, and without charging the vendors an arm and a leg. 

So, now your money will be helping us rebuild into an even brighter future of helping our local homestead community and beyond. 


Background on us....

We've always known locally produced items are good in multiple ways including environmentally, sustainability, and economically. Unfortunately we can't always pay the large prices that usually come attached to local products or find sources for homemade products outside of a farmers market. We buy a lot from farmer's markets but have recently found that the choices of actual local grown produce is getting harder and harder to find there. I can guess one reason for this is the high prices the market's charge vendors. It just doesn't make sense as an individual to sell there. 

7 months ago we were lucky enough to find some land and be able to start a hobby farm where we can provide some of these items for ourselves. We know we are not alone in our desire to support local artisans/farmers and not being able to. We realized we'll be able to produce a lot more than we need for our small family and want to share it, but after looking into local markets, it doesn't make financial sense to go that route. We have decided it is a great opportunity for us to allow others access to local foods and products without that overhead. This is not intended to be a commercial operation or to make a profit. We don't expect to be able to quit our day jobs or have no expenses. But if we can offset our expenses a little and help others have access to products and customers we are happy. For instance we sell our extra non-gmo, free range eggs for $3/dz, the same price you can buy non organic, "cage-free" at our local grocery store. This comes nowhere near covering the cost of the chicken feed, but our options are to feed the extra eggs to the animals or provide others an opportunity to experience home grown food at a price they can afford while lowering our feed costs a bit. We would much rather do the latter. 

Talking with friends and neighbors we realized others are also making and growing items that they would like to offer others but don't have a place or time to make it a reality. We would like to bring other artisans/homesteaders/gardeners a place to come together and provide a community setting to buy/sell/exchange items. This would provide a place to get honey from one person, eggs from another, and vegetables from a third all in one trip for example. Or have some extra eggs but your tomato plants didn't do well? Work out a trade with someone. Nowhere else will you find that flexibility. We will allow buyers access to products without having to wait for a certain day or season, and vendor's wont have to spend every saturday sitting at a farmers' market and paying to be there. 

We were originally trying to raise money to expand our operation with the following projects. As you've read though, all money will now go to just getting us up and running again. I've kept the list below to show what our plans are for one day.

  • A greenhouse so we can offer fresh produce year round. 
  • An aquaponics system will be combined with the greenhouse to reduce our water usage, provide organic nutrients, and add fresh fish to our offerings. 
  • A water catchment system to further reduce our water usage.
  • A Dexter cow - we have had a lot of interest in organic raw milk shares as well as grass fed beef. (Dexter cows are great dual purpose cows)  - who will now be named Estelle thanks to the wonderful donation of Katharine! 
  • Appliances to upgrade our extra kitchen into a commercial kitchen for community members to use at no cost  I spoke with the county and unfortunately this will not  be doable because we are on well and sewer. :(
  • A storage system to hold ours' and others' products in a store like environment
  • A honey extractor for community members to use
  • A "classroom" for sharing knowledge (including cheese making, canning, gardening, bee keeping, etc)

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Lazer and I'm 9 years old. I’ve been skateboarding since I was 5 years old and I’ve always wanted to be a professional skateboarder. It's my dream to become a professional skateboarder and I know I'm right on track! With the right support, commitment and hard work I know I can do whatever I put my mind to. I feel blessed to have found something I love and am passionate about at such a young age. See the gallery for photos and videos of me skateboarding (link Below)https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-child-skate-prodigy-lazer-crawford-turn-pro/x/8722739#gallery 


What I Need & What You Get

I've been able to achieve great success at a young age with the support of my family and friends, but in order to progress to the next level and skate as a professional, I need more hours of professional instruction and exposure to competitions worldwide.

The money we raise will all be going towards professional instructors and more excitingly, the opportunity to travel and enter competitions worldwide.

    The Impact

    The campaign goal of $24,000 was set with one single focus: Opportunity.

    • This amount will cover 12 months of focused professional instruction.
    • The full year of instruction will allow me to dedicate at least 30 hours a week to training & practicing with world class instructors at world class facilities.
    • Any additional money raised will be used to provide me the opportunity to travel and enter competitions worldwide!
    One thing my family has taught me is that hard work and dedication are extremely important to becoming a successful person. I have learned about the 10,000 hour rule, which basically says that if you put in the time and effort to perfect your skill set, you will become a professional. I love to skate and compete more than anything in the world and I'm looking for the opportunity to do it as much as I can and at the most competitive level. This is my dream!  And I know that with your help; in addition to hard work and dedication, my dreams will come true!
    Thank You and God Bless!

story:
Who's Kita?

Kita is the leader of Apple Kissa Cafe-- a performance & maid cafe group in New York. She's been running it since its start at New York Anime Festival and continues to run it today. Recently, Apple Kissa Cafe was at Rhode Island Comic Con where we all helped run the booth of her old job which was sponsoring us to get the word out about them.

During this weekend, Kita allowed all 9 of us to stay at her house. She provided us with food and gave us a place to sleep while there. Now that she's been abruptly laid off, I feel horrible that I can't repay her for her kindness. 


Help my friend pay for her rent!

Kita's a really good friend of mine. After being laid off from her job unexpectedly without being given a real reason, she now finds herself without a means to pay for this month's rent and the rest of her bills for the month. Any money at all can help her-- even $1! If 100 people donate $1 each, we can get her at least enough money to pay a portion of her rent, and that's already amazing. If you can't donate, (and we completely understand if you can't) the best way you can help is by sharing this and getting the word out to your friends. 


What We Need & What You Get

Any money at all can help her-- even $1! If 100 people donate $1 each, we can get her at least enough money to pay a portion of her rent, and that's already amazing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, (and I completely understand if you can't) the best way you can help is by sharing this and getting the word out to your friends.


I apologize in advance for not being able to offer anything in return for helping my friend out. I'm a poor girl myself and if I could offer anything, I would've given Kita all my money to help her out.

story:
The story

I'm Erica Jayne Walsh, a full-time MBA student at Haas School of Business (U.C. Berkeley).  This year, a record 43% of our incoming full-time class were women! However, many Haas traditions still favor men, including our annual fundraising campaign ('Movember'), where Men grow beards to raise money for charity. Typically, female participation is a 'write off' and the women just get their friends to donate to their male counterparts campaigns. 

This year, a few other women and I are fighting back against male dominated activities and pledging to beat the men at their own 'Movember' game, by using all means necessary, including by offering to shave our heads (Mohawk is the new sexy, especially when going through Corporate Recruiting)!

How you can help

Since I am (fortunately) unable to grow a beard, I've devised a number of ways I can make my participation in 'Movember' visible and known to the MBA community and beyond.  Check out the options to the right (--->) and pick the donation amount and perk that best suits your interests!  The campaign ends on November 30, 2014!

The impact

All of the money I raise will go to one of two outstanding charities:

  • Special Olympics (http://www.specialolympics.org/)
  • Alameda Point Collaborative (http://www.apcollaborative.org/)
This fundraising campaign is part of a Haas-wide effort to participate in the 'Challenge 4 Charity' (http://www.haasc4c.org/). Challenge 4 Charity is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization that draws on the talents, energy, and resources of MBA students from nine West Coast business schools to support Special Olympics, Boys and Girls Clubs, and other family-related local charities, to develop business leaders with a lifelong commitment to community involvement and social responsibility.

story:
U P D A T E 

We have successfully reached our minimum target and this project is finally realised! We thank everyone who has supported us along the way and we hope that we all continue to spread the word :)

Our online shop is available here!

C U R R E N T L Y   L O O K I N G   F O R :

People of Karen descent! Are you Karen? Do you live in Thailand or overseas? Drop us a comment in the comment box or email us at hellomaesa@gmail.com to say hi! We'd love to hear from your opinions about this project!

 

Why we need your help

This campaign is designed to kickstart weaving as an alternative source of income for artisanal Mae Sa villagers. Before the introduction of commercial corn farming, the villagers only farmed rice for subsistence. Even so, corn farming has produced many other problems, which do not secure them a stable income. An additional source of revenue will enable families to send their children for higher education and support their livelihoods. Read more about Mae Sa here!

Every amount you pledge will go directly to the weavers.

Mae Sa: A Karen Story

Up in the hills of Chiang Mai Province of Northern Thailand lies the largest village of Mae Chaem District, Mae Sa. The villagers are of Karen descent, an ethnic minority found mostly in Thailand and Myanmar. As the story goes, it hasn’t been long since the village experienced waves of development in terms of education, livelihood, electricity and internet connectivity. However, as much as development has improved their lives, the villagers struggle to survive on minimal income. This village stands at that crossroads between the onslaught of development and the sustaining of their Karen culture. 

We thought: Why not embrace both?

By turning their excellent weaving craft into a source of revenue, we aim to preserve the Karen culture through you (the international community) and simultaneously support the villagers through gaining access to agents of development.

Weaving has been a large part of any Karen lady’s life. As young as 14 years of age, girls are taught to weave their own white dress in which they can wear on special occasions or to school weekly. The villagers take pride in their ethnic wear that each household weaves specially for their family members. Each dress, every pattern and sequence, symbolises the women’s individuality and dedication to her craft.

 

Perks

The perks can be divided into two weaving categories: traditional and the modern. The  traditional method is tedious and time-consuming, yet the intricacy is something the modern way can never achieve. Sadly, lesser and lesser number of women in the village continue this form of weaving. With a bigger weaving stand, the modern method enables women to produce in larger amount but quality is not skimmed upon as everything is still handmade.

Saro and Phrai Pon hand-weave the Karen Headscarf worn by females of all ages using the traditional method. They are two of the three weavers left in the village who still practice the traditional way of weaving these headscarves thread by thread. Paying attention to every detail and pattern, each of them make up to 2 headscarves a week. While Karen women don the headscarf to complete their ethnic wear, the embroidered fabric can be used for other decorative purposes as well! Use the fabric to make your very own ethnic pouch too! 

Comes in three colours: Red, Maroon and Salmon.

 

Women in the village have also adopted the modern way of hand-weaving. The women pull spools of thread from nail to nail to create a set of thread of more than 40 metres. The thread is then boiled in dye then stringed to create a tie dyed-like effect. Though the process is long and tedious, these women stay true to the whole practice. The coloured thread is intricately arranged to create the unique Karen style fabric woven today. Products available are the Karen Bag,  Karen Cloth/Sarong and Karen Shirts.

 

 

 

Apart from the simple collection, we also have a wide array of beaded shirts! Each a reflection of the weaver's individuality and skill in sewing detailed patterns, the following shirts are available on demand. Email us at hellomaesa@gmail.com and we'll gladly share with you in detail the patterns available as well as the price range.

 

Campaign Timeline

We strive to ship the products as soon as they are made and collated. We envision all items to be shipped out by September.

About

This campaign is a part of a social participatory project kickstarted by a team of three students from Singapore and Myanmar.

Driven by the idea to empower ethnic minorities in the hills of Northern Thailand, we wanted to provide means in which the villagers, themselves, can innovate and participate in improving their lives. After living in Mae Sa for a month, we learnt that they aspire to weave more and explore the possibility of earning small amounts from this skill. Thus, we brought together the women of the village to form a weaver’s committee for e-commerce. While we trained the committee on the basics of managing an online business, the committee took charge of conducting fair trade and practiced equitable opportunities for all members. Our hope for this project is to inspire these women to sustain their own economy independently. 

Your pledge will go a long way in empowering the village women and supporting the development of their families.

Newly formed committee (From the left): Phrai Pon, Za Chi Kyi, Su Wa Nan, Sam, Wi Lai Wan, Paw Mu Nar, Kwan

Florence (SG), Sophy (SG) & Htee Moo (Myanmar) from Hello Maesa

For more information about Mae Sa, visit http://hellomaesa.wordpress.com or if you have any comments, drop us an email at hellomaesa@gmail.com!
story_txt:
U P D A T E We have successfully reached our minimum target and this project is finally realised! We thank everyone who has supported us along the way and we hope that we all continue to spread the word :)Our online shop is available here!C U R R E N T L Y   L O O K I N G   F O R :People of Karen descent! Are you Karen? Do you live in Thailand or overseas? Drop us a comment in the comment box or email us at hellomaesa@gmail.com to say hi! We'd love to hear from your opinions about this project! Why we need your helpThis campaign is designed to kickstart weaving as an alternative source of income for artisanal Mae Sa villagers. Before the introduction of commercial corn farming, the villagers only farmed rice for subsistence. Even so, corn farming has produced many other problems, which do not secure them a stable income. An additional source of revenue will enable families to send their children for higher education and support their livelihoods. Read more about Mae Sa here!Every amount you pledge will go directly to the weavers.Mae Sa: A Karen StoryUp in the hills of Chiang Mai Province of Northern Thailand lies the largest village of Mae Chaem District, Mae Sa. The villagers are of Karen descent, an ethnic minority found mostly in Thailand and Myanmar. As the story goes, it hasn’t been long since the village experienced waves of development in terms of education, livelihood, electricity and internet connectivity. However, as much as development has improved their lives, the villagers struggle to survive on minimal income. This village stands at that crossroads between the onslaught of development and the sustaining of their Karen culture. We thought: Why not embrace both?By turning their excellent weaving craft into a source of revenue, we aim to preserve the Karen culture through you (the international community) and simultaneously support the villagers through gaining access to agents of development.Weaving has been a large part of any Karen lady’s life. As young as 14 years of age, girls are taught to weave their own white dress in which they can wear on special occasions or to school weekly. The villagers take pride in their ethnic wear that each household weaves specially for their family members. Each dress, every pattern and sequence, symbolises the women’s individuality and dedication to her craft. PerksThe perks can be divided into two weaving categories: traditional and the modern. The  traditional method is tedious and time-consuming, yet the intricacy is something the modern way can never achieve. Sadly, lesser and lesser number of women in the village continue this form of weaving. With a bigger weaving stand, the modern method enables women to produce in larger amount but quality is not skimmed upon as everything is still handmade.Saro and Phrai Pon hand-weave the Karen Headscarf worn by females of all ages using the traditional method. They are two of the three weavers left in the village who still practice the traditional way of weaving these headscarves thread by thread. Paying attention to every detail and pattern, each of them make up to 2 headscarves a week. While Karen women don the headscarf to complete their ethnic wear, the embroidered fabric can be used for other decorative purposes as well! Use the fabric to make your very own ethnic pouch too! Comes in three colours: Red, Maroon and Salmon.



 

Women in the village have also adopted the modern way of hand-weaving. The women pull spools of thread from nail to nail to create a set of thread of more than 40 metres. The thread is then boiled in dye then stringed to create a tie dyed-like effect. Though the process is long and tedious, these women stay true to the whole practice. The coloured thread is intricately arranged to create the unique Karen style fabric woven today. Products available are the Karen Bag,  Karen Cloth/Sarong and Karen Shirts.






 






 
 



Apart from the simple collection, we also have a wide array of beaded shirts! Each a reflection of the weaver's individuality and skill in sewing detailed patterns, the following shirts are available on demand. Email us at hellomaesa@gmail.com and we'll gladly share with you in detail the patterns available as well as the price range.




 
Campaign Timeline

We strive to ship the products as soon as they are made and collated. We envision all items to be shipped out by September.
About
This campaign is a part of a social participatory project kickstarted by a team of three students from Singapore and Myanmar.
Driven by the idea to empower ethnic minorities in the hills of Northern Thailand, we wanted to provide means in which the villagers, themselves, can innovate and participate in improving their lives. After living in Mae Sa for a month, we learnt that they aspire to weave more and explore the possibility of earning small amounts from this skill. Thus, we brought together the women of the village to form a weaver’s committee for e-commerce. While we trained the committee on the basics of managing an online business, the committee took charge of conducting fair trade and practiced equitable opportunities for all members. Our hope for this project is to inspire these women to sustain their own economy independently. 
Your pledge will go a long way in empowering the village women and supporting the development of their families.

Newly formed committee (From the left): Phrai Pon, Za Chi Kyi, Su Wa Nan, Sam, Wi Lai Wan, Paw Mu Nar, Kwan
Florence (SG), Sophy (SG) & Htee Moo (Myanmar) from Hello Maesa
For more information about Mae Sa, visit http://hellomaesa.wordpress.com or if you have any comments, drop us an email at hellomaesa@gmail.com!

story:
Do you ever think about how much a period costs? Women living in poverty have to think about it, and sometimes have to choose between pads or tampons and food or electricity. Not only do manufacturers make around 60% even before the retailers add their profit margin, but the UK government adds VAT to this insult to women, judging their monthly needs to be ‘non-essential’ in VAT law.

Edinburgh Women for Independence and our sister organisations in East Lothian and Midlothian think this situation is bad enough for those who can afford period products but completely shameful for poor women and girls.  We want to raise £1000 to put pads and tampons in every food bank in Edinburgh.

The government should stop adding VAT to sanitary items and recognise them as ‘essential items’ in the same way as food. That would save most women around £1 per period – you might not think that is a lot, but if so, it’s because you aren’t in these women’s shoes. VAT is added to luxury items, but sanitary products are a necessity! Why are women and girls being taxed unfairly? We don't pay VAT on going to the bingo, on crocodile & ostrich meat, on a wee Tunnock's teacake, on a box of herbal teabags, or on edible cake decorations! Which do you think is more essential than sanitary products?

It's a global issue

Periods and poverty are keeping women and girls away from education and economic independence around the world. Many girls are missing from school during their periods because their family cannot afford sanitary towels. 

There will be girls in Scotland not attending school because their parents haven't been able to afford sanitary towels for them. This will be kept a secret and won't be showing up on any statistical explanations for school absences. Pads and tampons  are not provided in girls’ toilets at school alongside free soap, paper, towels and toilet paper, instead girls face the humiliating task of asking at the school office for help.

It's an equality issue

Women are bearing 85% of the financial burden of austerity policies in this country, and women are going to food banks every day to feed themselves and their families.  The least we can do is make sure that they can get supplies for their periods as well as food.  Periods are a natural part of girls and women's lives, and should never be seen as a source of embarrassment. It certainly should not isolate, oppress or shame girls and women. 

Help us help, please!

story:
I'm Siân and I'm the owner of Braydon Maize Maze. This is our 2nd year and this tent will allow me to have an undercover place for visitors to hang out should the british summer be a damp one!

With your help, I'll be able to buy the tent and say yes to more of the groups asking for visits. This will be an investment for me to use year on year and help us grow.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically I need a tent to set up as a place for visitors to take a break from the sun (or rain!) when they visit us. 

We are the only maize maze in North Wiltshire, and although we are only in our 2nd year, we had a huge impact last year and many people have been asking when we're opening again this year.

We've got a visitor book full of praises, and already this year I have bookings for an engagement party, a collage visit for 60 kids taking part in the National Citizenship Service programme, a birthday party and a Charity Day raising money for Variety the Children's Charity. 

Last year we had a few straw bales and a 2nd hand garden tent which only had a roof as cover, so this tent will be a huge asset to us and will be used for years to come. I just need to raise the cash to buy it!   

Ideally I'd love to get the whole amount to buy the tent, but if not any funds will help me hit my target to buy it!

The Impact

This will be a dry cosy place for visitors to come and enjoy a cuppa and watch as their children enjoy themselves outside. A place for groups to come and have their lunch. A place for us to raise awareness of Variety the Children's Charity. A place for children to draw pictures. A great asset for us and the local community.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is not getting enough raised to buy the tent! If this happens, depending on how much you wonderful people raise, I will either put it towards the cost of the tent (if I can raise the shortfall) if not I will give the money to Variety the Children's Charity. Likewise, if I raise more than the cost of the tent I will give the remainder to Variety! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you cannot help! If you think that this is a good idea, please tell others about me! 

Many, many thanks! 

Siân

story:
What do you get when you take 4 young adult creatives and bore them with traditional, terrestrial radio and repetitive BOREdora?  You get interactive radio by millennials.  Yep. Inter-active.

BossFM is set to launch June 30th -- with their flagship station having a major online presence. The first station will follow a hip-hop/pop format with DJs [and VJs] that are young, fresh, opinionated and entertaining. 

Who Are We?

The creatives behind BossFM: Alex Haynes, Stan Rucker, Jasmine Alyce and Courtney Cleveland.

Alex and Stan began their explorations in radio during their college years as 'DJ AppleJacx' and 'Prince Amir' (catchy, right?) and in an attempt to bring a female perspective to their show brought Jasmine Alyce (who went to a performing arts high school with Stan) to the team and voila.. magic: The AppleJacx Daily Show was complete.

The show grew in its 5 Years on air and eventually the team formed a station, UC1025, with a number of other shows added to the mix, including "The After Party," hosted by the hilariously unfiltered Courtney “Courtney C” Cleveland.

After taking a three year hiatus,  growing up AND growing bored with the progression (or lack thereof) of radio, the four decided to get back into the game and be the change they wanted to see in the industry. [Here's where you come in...]

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT?

Starting a radio network ain’t cheap and since we all are young professionals, we could definitely use your help.  We are trying to raise $5,000... thats right FIVE THOUSAND dollars. Your donations would go toward the equipment we need to run this flagship station, and will ensure that it doesn’t sound like its in outer-space or underwater. We want to produce quality. It is definitely the only way we are going to accomplish the change we desire!!

Here is where your money would go: 

  • Studio Space (security)
  • Studio Desks and chairs* 
  • Computers and Monitors
  • Sound Board
  • Microphones and Mic Stands
  • Promo Items* 
  • Web Cams* 
  • VoIP phones

* = Of course your money isn't the end all be all.  We're young creatives -- we will find a way, even if there's nowhere to sit!

WHAT DO YOU GET?

If funded, you get a brand new radio station to enjoy any time and at any time with hosts who don’t have lame segments and where you won’t hear that same song every 10 minutes. In fact -- you get the first one.  You're like the spark that start's the fire!  You will get quality. You get some free stuff too check out the right side of the page for more specifics.

story:
PERKS - You will be added to HALL of FAME + FREE High RES PICS - see Perks for details.

Who are we and What is the Vision ?

Hello Folks ! We are a bunch of experienced Stanford graduates (SOE) who have the dream that Crowdfunding should maximize returns to the Project Creator. That means no paying of 5 to 15% Service fee. We have therefore setup this awesome Crowdfunding platform and site to bring your funding dreams closer to you for a flat rate of 3% Fee. We charge the lowest in the Industry . The Catch is that we run on donations and online advertising also. We are inspired by awesome Crowdfunding sites like Indiegogo and we want to take it to the next level through complete democratization of fund raising for a very low service fee and payments processing through PayPal and Bitcoins.

Fundho - Raise More Money. We are a full featured Crowdfunding + Social network Site in one. Our USA site is already live and online at http://www.fundho.com

We are fresh and new and we need help from Donors like you. We have limited resources of our own and are quickly running out of our own savings, in other words we are struggling, but we will do our best to bring you an experience that you will think as awesome.

We believe that if we help you receive donations then we should not charge you any. It is not our money to start with. So please, come on over guys. Lets share the freedom !!﻿

More About us...

Fundho’s mission is to combine the tools of CrowdFunding and Social Networking to make project funding available for anyone.

We are the only CrowdFunding site that charge a low 3% fee !

Power to the People. Period.

  • Fundho is the only CrowdFunding plus Social Network site in one.

  • It’s a place where people with creative ideas and need for project funding can create projects and get funded. The social networking technology incorporated on Fundho lets project fund seekers and potential donors network in a unique way. They can meet online or face-to-face through what we call as self organized Pitch Parties.

  • We are a KiA - Keep it All platform. The project creator gets to keep the money, weather or not the goals are met.

  • Hey, we think that a startup needs as much money as possible. Project creators can keep what they can make, less 3% fee and Credit card charges, as set in our terms of Service.

  • An added feature is that besides networking with everyone and anyone on the internet, our project owners can choose to invite potential local fund donors to rendezvous locations to socialize, maybe buy you a free coffee but above all it’s a way for the project owners to connect with potential local donors and show what they got ! All this using the integrated social networking platform.

  • We believe that the days when one can seek funding from Venture Capital organizations only is sure in the past.

  • This is the new age of funding.

The Impact

  • Goodbye Sand Hill Road !

Not Just a Concept, A Live business Now !

  • We are not just a Startup Concept.
  • We are live for business at http://www.fundho.com

What do we need the Funding For ?

Its an Irony ! We are in the business of Crowdfunding but we are in need of raising Money.

Successful funding via Indiegogo will take care of development, operations and other expenses.

Thank you !

All Donors will get free High Resolution Images as additional Perks for the following, no matter what Perk is chosen. For personal (non-commercial) use only. Download Link will be sent to all Donors after Campaign ends.



Death valley National Park, CA State Route 374



Parakeet - Native Australian Bird



Santa Cruz, CA Moon Rise


Big Sur Beach, CA Sunset


Masai Woman, Kenya Africa


Sentinel Bridge, Yosemite National Park, CA


Stanford Quad, Stanford University, CA

story:
What Are Hookah Gems™?

Absolute Fusion Hookah Gems™ are a revolutionary tobacco-free shisha alternative making Hookah safer, and more enjoyable than ever before. Featuring unique flavors from around the world and exotic combinations, we are confident that you will find a flavor to suit your tastes. Hookah Gems™ work just like any other shisha, simply load your funnel bowl with Hookah Gems™, apply coals and enjoy. Because our product uses pure glass, natural ingredients and heat to release steam you can trust Hookah Gems™ to always produce the coolest, cleanest, most flavorful clouds of hookah “smoke” that you will ever experience. Gone are the days of smoking harsh, bland and burnt tobacco shisha, so forget smoking and start steaming today with Absolute Fusion Hookah Gems™!

TOBACCO AND NICOTINE FREE:

  • Hookah Gems™ are 100% tobacco and nicotine free. We have eliminated the need for tobacco filler in shisha by replacing it with premium glass Gems. Our proprietary Steam Solution™ mixed with our Gems is made with natural food grade ingredients. This allows us to omit the nicotine and tobacco -- eliminating most health risks that come with smoking traditional shisha. When you steam our product, you can be confident that you are getting the healthiest puffs possible.

EXTENDED SMOKE TIMES:

  • We are proud to say that with Hookah Gems™ you can more than double the length of your hookah session. While tobacco shisha may smoke up to 30-45 minutes, switching to Hookah Gems™ allows you to steam over 2x longer on the same bowl. No more changing multiple messy bowls during the middle of a party or hookah session; relax knowing that our Hookah Gems™ will provide you with thick clouds until you and your friends are finished steaming.

NEVER HARSH:

  • Hookah Gems™ are manufactured from premium glass and can never burn. These glass Gems are then mixed with our Steam Solution™ which is made with only the purest and highest quality flavorings available. There are absolutely no sugars, dyes, or perfumes added in our flavoring process. This makes the steam smooth and extremely flavorful. Do not worry about waking up tomorrow morning with a sore throat from harsh shisha; our steam is cool and refreshing. Add as many coals as you see fit and you will not receive any throat bite.

STEAMS COOLER, CLEANER, AND THICKER THAN TOBACCO SHISHA

  • Unlike traditional tobacco shisha, which smokes good for half hour then loses flavor and thickness, Hookah Gems™ will smoke cool, clean, and thick for hours longer. The steam solution and our revolutionary Gem shape make this possible. Heat retention and increased airflow allow our steam to be like nothing you’ve experienced before. When it comes to flavor, thickness, and cleanliness, Absolute Fusion Hookah Gems™ exceed all others.

100% REUSABLE:

  • Hookah Gems™, unlike any other hookah product on the market, have the ability to be reused. The premium glass construction allows you to wash them off after a session and use our refill kits* to revive the Gems for more steaming. This allows users to mix flavors down to the drop.

*We plan to offer refill kits of our Steam Solution™ within 60 days of the end of our campaign.


CUSTOMIZABLE FLAVORING:

  • The size and consistency of our Hookah Gems™ allow you to experiment with flavors like never before. Mixing flavors with precision gives users the ability to create thousands of unique flavor combinations. Each of which is easily repeatable from one session to the next.

                                             Our Eight Mouthwatering Flavors


Who Are We?

We are Josh and Hunter, two college students trying to live out our dreams. From early ages, we have both been engaged in various entrepreneurial ventures; starting clothing, media, and various product businesses. Recently, we were both featured on Business Insider as two of the top 20 under 20 in the world of finance. Among other things we share a great passion for hookah and the sense of community it brings to both friends and strangers.

We love hookah and how it enables friends to relax and enjoy each others company and conversation. But we noticed that not all of our friends were willing to try traditional hookah, mainly due to the fact that they didn’t want to smoke tobacco. This was our main motivation behind the creation of Hookah Gems™. To reinvent hookah and provide a tobacco free alternative that everyone can enjoy.


What if you back us?

If you decide to be awesome and back us, you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped make hookah safer and more enjoyable than ever before. You will forever have our appreciation and depending on your level of support you will receive exclusive incentives.

$1 - Amber -

  • Our Love!
  • Your name featured as an Amber level donor on our site.

$8 - (1) Bottle of Steam Solution™ - Early Bird

  • (1) 2oz Bottle of Steam Solution™
  • Only 100 Available!
$14 - Early Bird Special -

  • (1) 250gr jar of Hookah Gems. Pick 1 Flavor.
  • Your name featured as a Topaz level donor on our site.
  • Only 50 Available!
$19 - Topaz -

  • (1) 250gr jar of Hookah Gems. Pick 1 Flavor.
  • Your name featured as a Topaz level donor on our site.

$35 - (5) Bottles of Steam Solution™ - Early Bird

  • (5) 2oz Bottles of Steam Solution™
  • Only 50 Available!

$49 - Ruby -

  • Three (3) 250gr jars of Hookah Gems™. Pick 3 flavors.
  • Your name featured as a Ruby level donor on our site.

$99 - Emerald -

  • Eight (8) 250gr jars of Hookah Gems™. This includes 1 jar of every flavor offered in the initial launch.
  • Your name featured as an Emerald level donor on our site.

$149 - Sapphire - Complete hookah package that includes:

  • One (1) Limited Edition Absolute Fusion Hookah with all the essential accessories.
  • Three (3) 250gr jar of Hookah Gems™. Pick 3 Flavors.
  • Your name featured as a Sapphire level donor on our site.

$249 - Diamond - Complete hookah package that includes:

  • One (1) Massive Limited Edition Absolute Fusion Hookah with all the essential accessories.
  • Three (3) 250gr jars of Hookah Gems™. Pick 3 flavors.
  • Your name featured as a Diamond level donor on our site.

$1000 - Black Diamond -

  • We will work with you to create the flavor of your dreams.
  • Custom Branding for your store or lounge.
  • One Hundred (100) 250gr jars of Hookah Gems™.

$5000 - Hope Diamond -

  • We will work with you to create the flavor of your dreams.
  • Custom Branding for your store or lounge.
  • Eight Hundred (800) 250gr jars of Hookah Gems™.




Risks and Challenges

We have already spent countless hours perfecting and testing our design. From experimenting with different materials and shapes to formulating our solutions for maximum flavor intensity and cloud output, we've tried it all. We want to make Hookah Gems™ the highest quality hookah product on the market. Unfortunately, that does not come easy. As with any start-up we have some challenges to bring this product to you in it's finest form possible. Your backing will allow us to optimize manufacturing, open up distribution, and finalize R&D.

Our plan of action is well thought out and we are ready to implement every aspect, from raw material acquisition to delivery. Fulfillment of your donor incentives in a timely manner will be our first priority.

Our future goals include developing new and tantalizing flavors that have never been used in hookah before. We plan to bring Hookah Gems™ to stores and hookah lounges around the world so that everyone will be able to enjoy Hookah Gems™ as much as we do.


See Hookah Gems in Action
story_txt:
What Are Hookah Gems™? Absolute Fusion Hookah Gems™ 
are a revolutionary tobacco-free shisha alternative making Hookah safer,
 and more enjoyable than ever before. Featuring unique flavors from 
around the world and exotic combinations, we are confident that you will
 find a flavor to suit your tastes. Hookah Gems™ work just like any 
other shisha, simply load your funnel bowl with Hookah Gems™, apply 
coals and enjoy. Because our product uses pure glass, natural 
ingredients and heat to release steam you can trust Hookah Gems™ to 
always produce the coolest, cleanest, most flavorful clouds of hookah 
“smoke” that you will ever experience. Gone are the days of smoking 
harsh, bland and burnt tobacco shisha, so forget smoking and start 
steaming today with Absolute Fusion Hookah Gems™! 
TOBACCO AND NICOTINE FREE: 


Hookah Gems™ are 100% tobacco and nicotine free. We have
	eliminated the need for tobacco filler in shisha by replacing it
	with premium glass Gems. Our proprietary Steam Solution™ mixed
	with our Gems is made with natural food grade ingredients. This
	allows us to omit the nicotine and tobacco -- eliminating most health risks that come with smoking traditional shisha. When you
	steam our product, you can be confident that you are getting the
	healthiest puffs possible.
EXTENDED SMOKE TIMES: 


We are proud to say that with Hookah Gems™ you can more
	than double the length of your hookah session. While tobacco shisha
	may smoke up to 30-45 minutes, switching to Hookah Gems™ allows
	you to steam over 2x longer on the same bowl. No more changing
	multiple messy bowls during the middle of a party or hookah session;
	relax knowing that our Hookah Gems™ will provide you with thick
	clouds until you and your friends are finished steaming.
NEVER HARSH: 


Hookah Gems™ are manufactured from premium glass and can
	never burn. These glass Gems are then mixed with our Steam Solution™
	which is made with only the purest and highest quality flavorings
	available. There are absolutely no sugars, dyes, or perfumes added
	in our flavoring process. This makes the steam smooth and extremely
	flavorful. Do not worry about waking up tomorrow morning with a sore
	throat from harsh shisha; our steam is cool and refreshing. Add as
	many coals as you see fit and you will not receive any throat bite.
STEAMS COOLER, CLEANER, AND THICKER THAN TOBACCO SHISHA


Unlike traditional tobacco shisha, which smokes good for half
	hour then loses flavor and thickness, Hookah Gems™ will smoke
	cool, clean, and thick for hours longer. The steam solution and our
	revolutionary Gem shape make this possible. Heat retention and
	increased airflow allow our steam to be like nothing you’ve
	experienced before. When it comes to flavor, thickness, and
	cleanliness, Absolute Fusion Hookah Gems™ exceed all others. 
	
100% REUSABLE: 

Hookah Gems™, unlike any other hookah product on the
	market, have the ability to be reused. The premium glass
	construction allows you to wash them off after a session and use our
	refill kits* to revive the Gems for more steaming. This allows users to mix flavors down to the drop.*We plan to offer refill kits of our Steam Solution™ within 60 days of the end of our campaign. 
CUSTOMIZABLE FLAVORING: 


The size and consistency of our Hookah Gems™ allow you to experiment 
with flavors like never before. Mixing flavors with precision
	gives users the ability to create thousands of unique flavor
	combinations. Each of which is easily repeatable from one session to
	the next.

story:
Click Here for English!

Bonjour à tous!


J'ai 25 ans et je participe à ce magnifique projet plein de sens et générateur d'espoir... 

Les Apprentis de l'Espérance, association culturelle pour le développement social, développe actuellement un chantier ecovolontaire qui prend racine à Rio de Janeiro en collaboration avec SUSTENTARTE, Ong spécialiste en Eco construction et éducation environnementale, et l'Institut pour le Développement et la Communication (ICADC), une Ong impliquée depuis 1989 dans la promotion des jeunes et les échanges interculturels. 

L'idée:

Il s'agit de reconvertir une maison de pêcheur, renommée le Jardim de Gaya, située dans une zone écologique protégée, en structure hôtelière à vocation éco touristique (20 couchages). À moyen terme, elle va acquérir son autogestion par de l'hébergement, de la restauration, de l'animation culturelle, de la production artisanale et le produit de ses manifestations. Une fois la structure mise aux normes, 10 emplois pourraient être créés pour maintenir l'accueil, l'animation et l'administration de la structure.


                      

Utilité de ma mission:

-  Aider concrètement au développement local (création d’emplois à moyen terme)

-  Soutenir l'autonomie, l'animation et la pérennité d'une structure d'accueil à vocation sociale et culturelle

-  Promouvoir et participer à un chantier international, ouvrant à une formation aux techniques bio constructives, avec l'application pratique sur le terrain : création de nouveaux talents pour de jeunes volontaires

-  Apporter à une cause sociale et environnementale mon savoir et expérience en commerce et marketing, et me réaliser à travers cette initiative

-  Contribuer à l’émancipation de jeunes brésiliens(nnes)

                                                                                     

Dans quoi va partir ma contribution?

J'ai réuni mes économies pour moyenner mes ambitions, et pour me préparer à cetteincroyable aventure qui m'attend... cela représente un vrai challenge personnel.

Je m’autofinance pour payer mon billet aller-retour, mon hébergement sur place (totalité du séjour).

                 

Cependant, j’ai encore besoin de récolter 3000 euros pour coordonner en amont la mise en place du chantier:

-  Achat d'outillage et matériel nécessaire aux travaux de nettoyage et aménagement du jardin (1400 m2): 1 tondeuse, 1 débrousailleuse, 1 élagueuse sur perche, 1 taille haie, petit outillage (sécateurs,  cisailles, serpes, fauchards, plantoirs, serre, bacs à semis…).

-  Participation au tronc commun, soutien et accompagnement de l'équipe locale.

-  Repérage pour réaliser une vidéo documentaire, témoignage de notre action.


Chaque apport est un grain de sable considérable pour la réalisation de notre structure eco-touristique. Si je n'atteins pas les 3000 euros que j'espère, la somme récoltée permettra évidemment d'avancer quand même sur le projet, à pas plus lent, lent mais sûr!

Dans les faits, la réalisation complète du projet est estimée à 60 000 euros. Si la bonne volonté de tous nous accompagne, et que nous excédions les 3000 euros, cela financera l'achat de matériaux écologiques, afin d'assurer la rénovation de la structure et construction d’un kiosque, four et toilettes sèches en bambou et terre crue, adaptation des structures hydro-électriques, etc.

 


L'impact de notre projet:

Intérêt du chantier est multiple. Il peut se décliner en trois points essentiels:

1. Soutenir la viabilisation d'une structure d’accueil autogérée, dans un lieu protégé, destinée à la mise en œuvre et à la diffusion de programmes de sensibilisation et de formation spécifiques (Education à l’environnement, Agro écologie, Ecotourisme)

SUSTENTARTE, ONG spécialiste en Eco construction et éducation environnementale et l'ICADC impliqué depuis 1989 dans la promotion des jeunes et les échanges interculturels seront les garants de ce programme. 

2. Promouvoir un chantier international, ouvrant à une formation aux techniques bio constructives, avec l'application pratique sur le terrain, où tradition et modernité seront mêlées pour rénover, améliorer et protéger l'existant de façon coordonnée.

A savoir:

 - Permettre l'évacuation rationnelle des eaux usées

- Reprendre et adapter les installations hydro-électriques au normes de sécurité

- Viabiliser un grand salon polyvalent doté d'une couverture végétale pour des activités abritées

- Construire un Kiosque, un four et des toilettes sèches en bambou

- Nettoyer et aménager le jardin pour l'implantation d'espaces dédiés à la production organique

Thèmes abordés :

- Le bambou : techniques structurelles, construction des éléments

- La terre : Usages et techniques de construction (adobe, torchis et pisé), modélisation

- La couverture végétale : alternative urbaine durable, étanchéité et finitions

- Les peintures naturelles : développement et application élargir la capacité d'accueil


 3. À terme: Contribuer à soutenir l'essor de la population locale par l'apprentissage et la formation des jeunes et des femmes, dans le cadre de programmes intégrés de préservation de l'environnment et d'économie solidaire, d'après les principes du développement durable.

Valeurs écologiques:

Niché au cœur. de la Réserve écologique et archéologique de Guaratiba, sur la côte Ouest de Rio, O Jardim de Gaya est situé face à la mangrove, non loin des immenses plages de Recreio et Grumari, dans la fameuse Mata Atlântica (Forêt Atlantique).

L’environnement est composé d’un écosystème riche de plus de 200 000 espèces animales et végétales. C’est un lieu privilégié pour la découverte et l’étude de la faune et de la flore.

   

Le site représente des caractéristiques naturelles qui favorisent l’étude de l’écosystème et le développement de l’Ecotourisme. 


D'autres façons d'aider

J'espère de nombreuses participations pour soutenir ce challenge basé sur des valeurs sociales, environnementales et (inter)culturelles. J'espère être encouragée à poursuivre  et à concrétiser mon projet personnel.

Si vous ne pouvez pas donner, mais mon projet vous touche, par sa valeur sociale, culturelle ou environnementale, faites-le connaître autour de vous. Beaucoup d'entreprises ont une politique RSE largement orientée vers le developpement social et le respect de l'environnement, parlez-leur de ma démarche! Si vous vous déplacez près de Rio, n'hésitez pas à venir nous voir. 

Partagez un projet solidaire!


Toutes les participations sont les bienvenues. Je vous remercie d'avance de votre soutien qui m'encourage à poursuivre. Un compte rendu vous sera adressé sur demande pour vous permettre d'accompagner l'évolution de mon entreprise. 


Qu'est-ce que nous vous proposons en échange?


Voici les contreparties qui seront proposées par l'association:

10 €

Carte postale de la région ou de nos actions, envoyée à domicile

20 €

Carte postale de la région ou de nos actions + Marque page personnalisé envoyés à votre domicile 

50 €

Contrepartie précédente + Tshirt imprimé avec un motif exclusif issu de nos travaux ou paréo Brésil

100 €

Contreparties précédentes + Compte rendu trimestriel +  2 entrées au Jardim de Gaya pour une animation musicale aux chandelles OU BIEN 2 Tshirts personnalisés 

200 €

Contreparties précédentes +  2 entrées au Jardim de Gaya pour une animation musicale aux chandelles + 1 Nuit pour deux au Jardim de Gaya OU BIEN 2 Tshirts personnalisés + Objet design fabriqué par nos artisans 

300 €

Contreparties précédentes + 1 Costume de Carnaval, OU BIEN 2 Tshirts personnalisés + Objet design fabriqué par nos artisans + 1 tableau de Guaratiba peint par nos artistes

500 €

Contreparties précédentes+ Apparition de votre nom ou de votre logo sur tous nos supports de communication

1000 €

10 Cartes postales de la région ou de nos actions + 10 Marques page personnalisés + 2 Tshirt imprimé avec un motif exclusif issu de nos travaux + 2 Paréos Brasil + Objet design fabriqué par nos artisans + 1 grand tableau de Guaratiba peint par nos artistes + 1 Nuits pour deux au Jardim de Gaya + 1 diner avec animation musicale aux chandelles + 2 Entrées au Carnaval en costume + Apparition de votre nom ou de votre logo sur tous nos supports de communication

                                                     




Hello everyone!

I am 25 years old and I am supporting a French NGO currently working on deploying a beautiful project full of meaning and hope...  

Les Apprentis de l'Espérance, is a cultural NGO for social development. They are setting up an eco-friendly volunteering worksite taking place in Rio De Janeiro in association with SUSTENTARTE, NGO specialist in eco-friendly construction and environemental education, and ICADC (Instituto para Desenvolvimento e Comunicaçâo),an NGO involved since 1989 in intercultural and youth exchanges.


The concept:

O Jardim de Gaya aspires to become a host venue and a place focused on cultural and technical exchanges in the fields of environmental education and social tourism. 

The project is focused on converting O Jardim de Gaya, a fisherman's house, located in the middle of an ecological reserve,into an Eco-friendly touristic house (for about 20 people). In the medium term, the goal is giving autonomy to this place of living by offering accommodation, restauration and animation of social, cultural and environmental activities...

Renovating and livening up the site will be a source of local employment and emancipation (positions for managing the organisation and all the activities).


Utility of my mission:

-  Helping local development (positions opening in the mid-term)

-  Supporting the autonomy, the animation and the sustainability of a multipurpose center

-  Promoting and participating in an international work-site, offering an Eco-friendly construction techniques training,together with practice in location: creation of new talents for young volunteers.

-  Bringing my educational background and experience in business and marketing area to a social cause/matter

-  Contributing to the local emancipation of Brazilian's youth                                                                                                                              


Where is my contribution going?

I gathered my savings for reaching my ambition, and for getting ready to this amazing Eco-friendly adventure... That represents a real challenge. 

I am self-financing my round trip ticket and my accommodation expenses.

                                                         

However, I still need to collect 3000 euros to carry out in advance the organization and coordination of the work-site:

-  Purchased set of tools and equipment necessary to the cleaning up and layout of the garden (1400 m2): 

1 lawn-mower, 1 brush cutter, 1 pruner, 1 hedge trimmer, common small tools (pruning shears,  shears, billhooks, dibbles, greenhouses, etc.).

-  Participated shared expenses (food, water, electricity, Internet, etc.), supported local team on site.

-  Location scouting for making a documentary to record our action.


Each and every input is critical, it is a grain of sand for the multipurpose Eco-friendly center achievement. If I could not reach the expected 3000 euros, what will be collected will allow us to carry on this project anyway, slower but for sure!

The reality is that the complete budget for creating this project is evaluated to be around 60 000 euros. If the good will of you all follows us, and we over-achieve the amount of 3000 euros,it would pay for buying Eco-friendly tools in order to guarantee the renovation of the existing structure (fisherman's house) and the construction of a pavilion, oven and dry restrooms in bamboo and mud, hydroelectric adjustment, etc.


The concerns of this project are multiple:

* Supporting the promotion and animation of O Jardim deGaya as a lasting  and sustainable project.
• Giving the opportunity to youth and families to participate actively in the social, cultural and economic development of their region, a hotel and tourism eco paid business                                                                                                                                

•Encouraging education, learning, training andresearch, and support the discovery andpreservation of biodiversity

                                                  

•Accommodating a public eager to discover and experience Brazilian cities differently and foster international cooperation
•Strengthening the participation of local schools and communities
•Settig up artisanal workshops to expand the solidarity trade (recycling, jewelry, crafts, cooking)
•Enhaninge direct and indirect job creation, related to the services provided in support of the structure

                                                   

•Transfering knowledge and know-how through the exchange of information and ecological experience (SUSTENTARTE):
> BAMBOO : structural techniques, construction of elements.
> CLAY : uses and techniques of building up (adobe and cob), models.
> VEGETAL COVERING : urban sustainable alternative, impermeability, completion.
> NATURAL PAINTS : developing and applying.
•Organizing excursions to discover the ecosystem,flora and fauna of the region

                                                         

•In a longer term, establishing an economically viable business with the
construction and equipment of a rural guest house, by 2014 (World Cup Football)

Other ways to help us out:

I am expecting loads of constributions to support this challenge based on social, environmental and (multi)cultural values. I hope you will all cheer me on to pursue and make this project real.

If you cannot afford a donation, but the project makes sense to you and affect you, please let your family, friends, colleagues know about it. 

Many companies are Corporate Social Responsability (CSR) oriented, tell them about our project!If you go to Rio, you are more than welcome to stop by! 

Let's share a project of solidarity!


There isn't a minimum donation, all contribution are important to us! I thank you in advance you support to pursue this adventure and challenge. A report will be sent over on request to allow you following our progression. 

What are we offering in return?

€ 10 

Postcard from the region or of our actions, sent home

€ 20

Postcard from the region or of our actions + Customized bookmark sent home 

€ 50

Previous rewards + Tshirt printed with an exclusive design from our work or "Pareo Brazil"

€ 100

Previous rewards + Quarterly updates + 2 entries for a candle-light musical entertainment in O Jardim de Gaya OR 2 Customized Tshirts

€ 200

Previous rewards + 2 entries for a candle-light musical entertainment in O Jardim de Gaya + 1 Night for two people at O Jardim de Gaya OR 2 Home made gifts (by local craftsmen)

€ 300

Previous rewards + 1 Carnival Costume, OR Tshirts + 2 Home made gifts (by local craftsmen) + 1 painting of Guaratiba by our artists

€ 500

Previous rewards + Your name or logo display in all our communication media

€ 1,000

10 Postcards from the region or of our actions + 10 bookmarks + 2 Tshirt printed with an exclusive design from our work + 2 "Pareo Brazil"+ 1 Homemade gift (by local craftsmen) + 1 large paiting of Guaratiba by our artists + 1 night for two people at O Jardim de Gaya + 1 candlelight dinner with musical entertainment + 2 Entries to the Carnival in costume + Your name or logo display in all our communication media

J'ai 25 ans et je participe à ce magnifique projet plein de sens et générateur d'espoir... Les Apprentis de l'Espérance, association culturelle pour le développement social, développe actuellement un chantier ecovolontaire qui prend racine à Rio

promotion des jeunes et les échanges interculturels. L'idée:Il s'agit de reconvertir une maison de pêcheur, renommée le Jardim de Gaya, située dans une zone écologique protégée, en structure hôtelière à vocation éco touristique (20 couchages).
