story:
Hi, my name is Greg Loomar and my company is EzBizDocs. I have managed my own law firm in the South Florida area for over 20 years and have been helping people and businesses succeed in commercial and business transactions.  Two years ago I decided to create EzBizDocs.com, an online business marketplace where people could visit and purchase EzBizDocs DIY business forms and personal documents, in addition to searching for professional assistance with legal, accounting, real estate and various other business and personal situations. Our Team needs your help to make it easier for people to find the necessary documents or professionals in their area to protect many more people so that they can achieve their dreams. In addition, we also need your help in fighting both kidney and stroke diseases as well as supporting #GivingTuesday, the movement to create a global day of giving on Tuesday, December 3rd. 

We need $50,000 for a brand new easier to use website so that users can more easily find what they need as well as dramatically increase the numbers of DIY documents available to help many more people. Your contribution will allow us to help so many more people that have a dream of starting and running their own business but lack the funds to pay an attorney or other financial professionals to protect themselves so that they may concentrate on their success. We are offering fantastic perks from EzBizDocs comprehensive documents for your protection all the way to my personal services in evaluating your particular business or personal financial needs.

In addition to the extremely useful perks descibed below, we are making a commitment to donate 20% of the funding proceeds to help end both kidney and stroke diseases in addition to supporting #GivingTuesday, the global day of giving movement. Over the last year we have had two team members affected by these two crippling afflictions and our support due in fact to the miraculous recovery both have undergone is just another way our organization desires to help others.

Make a $5.00 contribution and you will receive a 25% coupon toward any EzBizDocs high content, easy to use. color coded document as well as a personal Thank You from Greg.  Click here to see some of the EzBizDocs high content DIY documents.

A $10 contribution will result in you receiving your choice of two different Health Documents. Please choose either a Designation of Healthcare Surrogate or a HIPPA Release and Authorization Form. These documents have a $19.95 value

Make a $15 contribution and receive a Living Will Document which sells for $29.95 normally.

A $25.00 contribution will result in you receiving both the Living Will and your choice of the Healthcare Surrogate or HIPPA forms described previously. These documents normally sell for $49.95.

Make a $40 contribution and receive a Revocable Trust Agreement which has a retail value of $79.95.

A $100 contribution will result in you receiving a comprehensive Last Will and Testament which has a $199 selling price.

Make a $500 contribution and you will receive  a 3 hour Comprehensive Review and Evaluation of a business and its operational procedures ($1125.00 Value) provided personally by Business and Transaction Attorney L. Gregory Loomar. Greg's 20+ years of handling complex business transactions, representing both buyers and sellers provides him an invaluable insight into the protection of both sides of a transaction. Greg's normal fee for this type of review is a minimum of $1125.00.

A $1500 contribution will result in you receiving  an 8 hour Comprehensive Review and Evaluation of a business and its operational procedures by Attorney L. Gregory Loomar. Greg  will then provide the recommendations to taking the necessary steps for protection of both the business and personal components of the owners. This Review and Evaluation is never less than $3000.00.

story:
WE ARE STILL RAISING FUNDS!

**UPDATE :  We need more than our initial goal! Any dollar raised beyond the first goal helps us reduce our loan of $150,000- and we really need to do that.  And, any funds beyond that (let's be crazy optimists!  Why not?) would go to actually equip the kitchen!  So - let's blow right past our goal with this final momentum!

The Historic Walter Schmidt Tavern was built in 1893 and is located at 1848 W. Fond du Lac Ave. in Milwaukee’s Lindsay Heights neighborhood. Wally and Belle Schmidt ran the joint from 1935 to 1968. The tavern was famous for its steak sandwiches and fish fries. It was also a favorite hangout spot for Milwaukee's politicians and ballplayers alike -  famous Braves baseball player Warren Spahn held his son's birthday parties here (For more read about it in the newpaper story posted under the Gallery tab).  In 1968, the McCarthy family leased the tavern and renamed it Max & Mildred’s (Later M & M Lounge).  The lounge closed in 2010 and has been vacant since.

Much of the tavern’s original historic features are still in place, including a patterned hex-tile floor, finished wood molding and millwork, the historic bar, wrought ironwork, and embossed glass in the tavern’s entry door. Exterior features include a terra cotta roof, leaded glass windows, and decorative Mission Revival style piers. 

Juli Kaufmann (www.fixdevelopment.com) and Jeremy Davis have joined as partners to reclaim the building for a new sit-down restaurant on the first floor and offices on the second floor.  Juli has developed lots of local real estate recognized for its social and environmental impact.  She has also co-founded a pioneering crowdfundng vehicle called Fund Milwaukee where regular Milwaukeeans invest in local businesses and real estate.  Jeremy is a Lindsay Heights resident and works for Walnut Way Conservation Corp (www.walnutway.org), bringing extensive experience in community development both locally and globally. 

Duh.  This is an abandoned, foreclosed building that has suffered fire damage and vandalism.  It's located in Milwaukee's lowest income neighborhood. Overcoming these challenges will make success so much sweeter.  

We are bringing back the Wally Schmidt Tavern so that it can catalyze economic investment in the neighborhood, support three new small businesses, create local jobs, and make positive change.

In the Lindsay Heights neighborhood, systematic disinvestment has created a downward economic spiral - leaving a neighborhood that traditional investors and financial instutions now ignore.  Where homes and businesses once created a vibrant community, foreclosures have now reached a crisis level and more than half of commercial properties currently stand vacant.   

While these statistics evidence complex challenges, there is also tremendous potential. Many residents, businesses and partners are now successfully working together to begin transforming the community. 

  • Mentorship:  An experienced developer (Juli) partners with a local resident (Jeremy) to enable skill transfer and capacity building through hands-on learning embedded right in the neighborhood.

  • Community-identified economic development needs:  The Lindsay Heights neighborhood residents have identified this building and the proposed uses as high priorities to have catalytic impact on the neighborhood.

  • Direct investment by community residents, and sustained community ownership: Local residents will participate as investors using a crowdfunding ownership model and local businesses are sought as tenants to ensure local wealth-building, local job creation, and local economic impact.  

If you'd like this model explained in more detail, just ask us because we'd love to tell you.  This is our secret sauce!   


This project will cost $500,000 and here's some good news. We've already raised much of it!  We have a loan, we have some investors, we have some grants, and we have our own real money and sweat equity.  We also have lease commitments for three of the four tenant spaces. So, if we build it - they will come and pay rent!  We are working on the final space - the restaurant- and conversations are exciting, but not yet official.  We really need help getting the kitchen transformed and our current funding is not enough.  

So check out our perks to the right.  Every dollar raised will go toward renovating the building into something special.  Minimally, we need $31,000 to fill a gap in our construction budget.  Any dollar raised beyond our goal would help us reduce our loan of $150,000- and we really need to do that.  And, any funds beyond that (let's be crazy optimists!  Why not?) would go to actually equip the kitchen!  And then you can come visit!

Well, the obvious impact will be a super cool restored building that is home to a fabulous restaurant where new memories can be made.  But, its about a lot more than that.  

The historic Wally Schmidt Tavern has been identified as an ideal project that fits the goals of the neighborhood with a high probability of success and an ability to have significant economic impact on Lindsay Heights because it will:

  1. Locate on Fond Du Lac Avenue, a key commercial corridor near the critical intersection at North Avenue;
  2. Eliminate blight by redeveloping a vacant and foreclosed commercial property;
  3. Be developed and owned by partners willing to serve as active citizens in the local business community;
  4. Enable local wealth building through local ownership as well as local hiring practices;
  5. Attract occupants that are entrepreneurs and locally-owned micro-businesses committed to social, environmental and economic returns (a triple bottom line);
  6. Create new jobs;
  7. Add tax-paying commercial uses and contribute property tax value to the business improvement district; and,
  8. Provide healthy products and services accessible to the local community that add to the local quality of life.

Even if you, personally, can't donate...we are sure you know someone who can. Won't you please share this with your social media world? Link to us on Facebook or Twitter. Become an advocate for our work, if you aren't already. You'll be amazed at what's possible when people put their minds to something.

story:
HoopsForSmiles is striving towards non-profit status

An idea that was birthed from the simple question, whats your passion? I am Dominique*The Fruit Hoop Gypsy on my path I have used hula hooping to heal emotionally as well as physically. At HoopsForSmiles we promote a nutritionally fitness based focus. Everyone should have a beautiful hand crafted hula hoop that they can share with others.

I had been diagnosed with a condition called Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome that had been keeping me bed bound for nearly 2 years. My doctors told me I needed to find a low impact aerobic exercise to strengthen my nervous system and heart. I was also feeling very low and directionless and wanted to start eating a cleaner diet and find my passion in hopes of healing. What happened when I picked up a hoop is just that and so much more.

Now, almost one year later no matter where I go my hoops follow. Whether its the grocery store, or physical therapy there is never enough time in a day to spread hooping love to everyone I meet. 

We are working towards $1,000 for 100 hoops

Each hoop is worth anywhere from 10 to 25 dollars. Each tape roll costs anywhere between $5-30 and it takes anywhere from 1-4 tape rolls a hoop!
Tubing starts at $15 for regular PVC tubing that we find at Lowes and can go up to $50 for better quality Polypro and HDPE tubing that is found online. For all the suppplies we find online we have to take into account shipping fees.

*As far as how much time it takes to create a hoop, one hoop that does not fold takes about 30 min and collapsibles take about an hour.*
$1,000 would raise enough money to donate 100 hoops and really spread the word. It would also enable us to file officially for non profit ($75) something we are striving do do at this very moment

To date HoopsForSmiles has donated anywhere from  30-50 hoops 16 of those hoops were donated by OuttaControl Smokeshop(Thank you!!) in Keyport, New Jersey. The other 14 or so came out of pocket as well as shipping fees for where some are going in the states and out. In order to be compensated for our time and supplies we needed to ask you for help because we cannot survive single handed. We are a community based project so its time we brought it to our community.

**Even if you cant contribute monetarily it doesnt mean that you cant help at all! Spread the word about hooping and HoopsForSmiles and what we're doing, word of mouth is fabulous. Send some good vibes our way and lots of smiles and most of all pick up a hoop and really see what we're about.**
story_txt:
HoopsForSmiles is striving towards non-profit status
An idea that was birthed from the simple question, whats your passion? I am Dominique*The Fruit Hoop Gypsy on my path I have used hula hooping to heal emotionally as well as physically. At HoopsForSmiles we promote a nutritionally fitness based focus. Everyone should have a beautiful hand crafted hula hoop that they can share with others.I had been diagnosed with a condition called Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome that had been keeping me bed bound for nearly 2 years. My doctors told me I needed to find a low impact aerobic exercise to strengthen my nervous system and heart. I was also feeling very low and directionless and wanted to start eating a cleaner diet and find my passion in hopes of healing. What happened when I picked up a hoop is just that and so much more. Now, almost one year later no matter where I go my hoops follow. Whether its the grocery store, or physical therapy there is never enough time in a day to spread hooping love to everyone I meet.  We are working towards $1,000 for 100 hoops
Each hoop is worth anywhere from 10 to 25 dollars. Each tape roll costs anywhere between $5-30 and it takes anywhere from 1-4 tape rolls a hoop! Tubing starts at $15 for regular PVC tubing that we find at Lowes and can go up to $50 for better quality Polypro and HDPE tubing that is found online. For all the suppplies we find online we have to take into account shipping fees. *As far as how much time it takes to create a hoop, one hoop that does not fold takes about 30 min and collapsibles take about an hour.*$1,000 would raise enough money to donate 100 hoops and really spread the word. It would also enable us to file officially for non profit ($75) something we are striving do do at this very momentTo date HoopsForSmiles has donated anywhere from  30-50 hoops 16 of those hoops were donated by OuttaControl Smokeshop(Thank you!!) in Keyport, New Jersey. The other 14 or so came out of pocket as well as shipping fees for where some are going in the states and out. In order to be compensated for our time and supplies we needed to ask you for help because we cannot survive single handed. We are a community based project so its time we brought it to our community. **Even if you cant contribute monetarily it doesnt mean that you cant help at all! Spread the word about hooping and HoopsForSmiles and what we're doing, word of mouth is fabulous. Send some good vibes our way and lots of smiles and most of all pick up a hoop and really see what we're about.**

story:
What is the Recovery Walk Ireland event?

If you are not based in Ireland, please don’t stop reading! Addiction affects people across the globe and does not differentiate between gender, skin colour, sexual orientation, social class, political affiliations or religion. We hope that we can fan the flame that is the powerful Recovery Walk movement to other countries across the world, but for the moment, let’s make Ireland a reality!

We took the idea from our colleagues in the USA and UK and introduced Recovery Walk Ireland in 2012. It is a celebration of recovery from all addictions whether it’s alcohol, drugs, eating, gambling, sex, etc. It kicks off with a short symbolic walk in Dublin city centre led by the Lord Mayor of Dublin. The event is then formally launched by our Guest Speaker, then followed by a concert (check out our web site to see who these 8 talented singers and bands are - www.recoverywalkireland.com). A great range of children's entertainment is also provided – and it's all free!  

Our Guest Speaker in 2013 was the incredible force that is Father Peter McVerry, an outspoken advocate of Recovery. In 2012, we were honoured to have GAA All-Star Oisín McConville who humbled us with his own inspiring story of his struggles with gambling, alcohol and depression.


When and where?

Recovery Walk Ireland will take place on Saturday 20 September behind Christchurch, Dublin, in the Wood Quay Amphitheatre space beside the Dublin Civic Centre, from 12.30 to 5pm.

Who we are?

We are unpaid volunteers from diverse backgrounds and we’re passionate about Recovery from addiction! We set up a not for profit company 3 years ago in order to host this unique event in Ireland and all our accounts are checked and audited by independent Accountants.

Our aims and goals for Recovery Walk Ireland

We want to reach out to the community (indeed the global community) as a whole and make this an all-island affair and together celebrate Recovery. We hear plenty about addiction in the media (and often in our own lives) and want to balance that with proof that Recovery is possible and real and happens every day right here in our community and across the world. We want a platform to celebrate Recovery not just for individuals in Recovery, but for their families, friends and the whole community. We aim to:

·  Celebrate and support recovery

·  Promote the positive impact of recovery on individuals, families and the community

·  Remove the stigma surrounding addiction.  


Why we need funding?

Unlike our USA friends, recovery in Ireland is still often buried under shame and stigma and we have been unsuccessful in getting corporate sponsorship, so we are seeking help from you, our global community, to help make the 2014 event a reality.

Everyone involved in organising the event is an unpaid volunteer, and even though we keep costs to an absolute minimum, they do exist e.g. insurance, hiring a sound system, security, portaloos, printing costs, and so on. This is our 3rd year and we need YOU to make it a reality. We hope that whether you are in Recovery or not, you will join us in SUPPORTING Recovery and will help our fundraising efforts to make this free event a reality.

We believe Recovery is possible and happens across the world every day.

Thanks and credits

This video was made possible by the expertise and generousity of Barry Doyle and with the help of Brenda Harkin. Oh, and to you for reading this of course.

story:
“Help keep abandoned babies from being left on the streets or strangers’ doorsteps.”




Located amidst an array of small apartment buildings and villas on the outskirts of Seoul resides a small church. The area is far from affluent and is comprised of mostly residences and small schools. On the side of the church there’s an inscription that reads, “Raising a baby with a disability as a single mother is never an easy task. But before you decide to give up, open this handle and let us try.” The inscription is located on a small box that’s built into the wall surrounding the church with a handle on each side of the wall. “Babybox” is what the locals refer to is as.

It was a cold brisk winter morning in 2007 when Reverend Lee received a call just before dawn. The caller stated that they had left a child outside of the church and to please watch over him. Reverend Lee rushed outside to find a box that reeked of fish with a baby wrapped in a blanket inside. It was so cold that the baby was nearly frozen and there was a large cat lurking around because it had caught the scent of the fish. It was then that Reverend Lee decided, if he can’t prevent parents from abandoning their children, he can at least guarantee them a loving home and safety under his roof. And that is how “Babybox” came to be.



That baby in the fish box was premature and also suffered from Down syndrome. Because of the weather, the baby appeared to have been suffering from Bronchitis and could not eat either. The local hospital said it would be difficult for the baby to survive and it would be better to just give up on him. Miraculously, that little baby has grown up and is now living a full and healthy life and attending elementary school thanks to Reverend Lee’s efforts.

That box on the side of the wall allows parents to leave their babies anonymously in hopes that they will feel less ashamed for giving up their child. This also encourages them to come back for them if they can. Handles on each side of the wall allow the Reverend to open the box from within the walls of his church. All that he asks is that they provide the child’s name and date of birth in order to keep track of them better. This also allows parents to come back once they feel that they can better care for their children.

All babies that are received through Babybox are taken to the Seoul Municipal Hospital for a full checkup. Those that are found to have disabilities are sent to a special needs facility while those that are in full health are sent to an orphanage. However, those that have congenital disorders are rejected from both special needs facilities and orphanages. Reverend Lee ends up taking care of these children and that amount is already at a startling 21 children. With his house already being modest as it is, as the family grows larger, the amount of available space is shrinking. One day, one of the children went to a friend’s house and came back and said, “Why don’t I have my own room?” This upset the Reverend as he simply could not afford to expand his church and provide rooms for any of the children.

In total, about 500 children have been left in Babybox. Thankfully, around 150 of those children’s parents have come back for their child and nothing makes Reverend Lee happier than seeing parents coming back for their children.

With the increase of babies being placed in Babybox every month, it’s getting harder and harder for Reverend Lee to keep up with the children as well as the deteriorating state of his church and living quarters. 



2015 Babybox Calendar

story:
Cliquez ici pour la version française

Make your trips a personal enrichment: Échappée Australe, future tour operator.

Do you think that a price of USD 3 500 or USD 4 600 (€ 3 000 or € 4 000) for a 10 days trip in South Afria (for 2 people without fly tickets) is expensive?
Do you think that this price is expensive for trips offering hostel without charm?
You don't find travel agencies or tour operator offering trips truly off the beaten track?

We encountered these problems.

That's why we will launch a tour operator to sell affordable trips in Southern Africa and in the Indian Ocean islands. For example, we can sell you a trip in South Africa for USD 2 400 (€ 2 000).

Meeting locals and other travellers are a key point of our vision. Moreover, we think that accommodations should give something to improve you trip: originality, situation, charm or favouring the sharing of experiences. We tested accommodations and we validated with these criteria.

We travelled in Southern Africa as backpackers many times (9 months): by foot, by bicycle, by hitch hiking, by typical means of transports and by car. We tested different sort of accommodations: homestay, guest houses, B&B, backpackers, lodges, campsites... We practised too many unusual activities.

We know the destinations that we offer and have been organized trips for friends: they really enjoyed!

Contents

  • Our project
  • About us
  • Our vision
  • The awards
    • For a donation of USD 50 (€ 43): we will send you a than-you email
    • For a donation of USD 250 (€ 216): you will have a 5% discount
    • For a donation of USD 500 (€ 432): you will have a 10% discount
    • For a donation of USD 2 000 (€ 1 730): you will discover the Western Cape (for 2 people)
    • For a donation of USD 2 200 (€ 1 900): you will discover the Eastern Cape (for 2 people)
    • For a donation of USD 3 000 (€ 2 590): You will discover many places from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth (for 2 people)
  • Find us on the internet
  • What are the risks?
  • FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions
    1. The trips that you offer are for how many people?
    2. The discounts are available for me and for my friend?
    3. Can we change the trips that you offer depending on our wishes?
    4. Can we choose the date of departure?
    5. Does the price change depending on the date of departure?
    6. What is the best season to watch whales?

Our project

We want to launch a tour operator specialized in Southern Africa. We will sell trips only via the internet (without physical agency). All our trips will be tailor-made: each trip is unique and is designed with the customer. We ensure that the trip matches with the customer. Each trip will include car rental, accommodations and activities. The accommodations will be mostly backpackers, guest houses and bed & breakfasts. The key point for the accommodation is to give more to the experience: originality, situation, conducive to meet people. Activities will be booked directly with us. We will offer affordable trips: we will work directly with our local partners.

About us

We are two people working on this project:

  • Amandine Deslangles who have a tourism degree in trips design and a baccalaureate in accountancy and business management. She worked in different travel agencies and tour operators.
  • Clément Pilchen, having a master degree in projects management and innovation, managed many projects in multiple sectors (building, pharmaceutical, business launching) and worked during 2 years in IT.


Since 2010, we have been working on this project. We went a 1st time in South Africa and in Swaziland in 2010 to discover these countries. In 2013 and 2014, we came back in Southern Africa during 7 months to meet trusted partners for the different services we will offer. We are sure that there is an unexploited potential in these countries for a different tourism, matching with our vision.


Our vision

We noted that the trips offered in Southern Africa by the travel agencies are generally the same and don't really facilitate discovering the countries. Moreover, they are expensive compared with the cost of living.

We will offer the opportunity to discover unusual sites, off the beaten track. We will use our experiences and knowledge of this part of the world. We will favor meeting and sharing with locals and other travellers. This is a key point of our vision because we think that a trip has to allow a personal enrichment.

Southern Africa is not really known to everyone. Security of our customers will be the heart of our services. That's why we decided to really explore these countries and to work with trusted partners.

Finally, the confidence of our customers is essential. Nobody is protected from a negligence of the tour operator, in particular on the internet. That's why, we will operate as follow: when we will receive the payment from our customers, we will pay immediately our partners to finalize the booking. You can think that it is normal and logical but usually tour operators pay their partners periodically (for example: one time by quarter). This way can cause debts that the tour operator can't cover and the customer risks to have no accommodation... That's why we want to subscribe to a financial guarantee for an amount of €200 000. This guarantee will be subscribe to cover the debts in case of problems. With us, the customer can't have unpleasant surprises!

The awards

With the crowdfunding, we offer you the opportunity to become our first customers: you can have discounts for our future trips or you can obtain an affordable trip in South Africa for 2 people.

For a donation of USD 50 (€ 43): We will send you a thank-you email

No contribution are too short, and we really appreciate your support! That's why we will send you a personal email to thank you when the campaign will be finished. Moreover, we will tell you everything about the project's progress.

For a donation of USD 250 (€ 216): You will have a 5% discount

To have an idea of a 5% discount, we need to give you an example. The trip that we offer for a donation of USD 2 000 (€ 1 730 / Western Cape by car for 2 people) will cost approximately USD 2 400 (€ 2 000). In fact, when we will open our tour operator, we will have different charges and taxes. That's why the price of the trip will be more than the crowdfunding price.

If you have a 5% discount, you will pay for this trip approximately USD 2 250 (€ 1 90).

Please, note that it is an example. Your 5% discount will be available for the trip of your choice (including tailor-made trip) in Southern Africa and in islands of Indian Ocean.

For a donation of USD 500 (€ 432): You will have a 10% discount

To have an idea of a 10% discount, we need to give you an example. The trip that we offer for a donation of USD 2 200 (€ 1 900 / Eastern Cape by car for 2 people) will cost approximately USD 2 600 (€ 2 250). In fact, when we will open our tour operator, we will have different charges and taxes. That's why the price of the trip will be more than the crowdfunding price.

If you have a 10% discount, you will pay for this trip approximately USD 2 300 (€ 2 000).

Please, note that it is an example. Your 10% discount will be available for the trip of your choice (including tailor-made trip) in Southern Africa and in islands of Indian Ocean.

For a donation of USD 2 000 (€ 1 730): You will discover the Western Cape (for 2 people).

Normal price (once opened): USD 2 400 (€ 2000).


During 11 days, you will visit these cities: Cape Town, Hermanus, Struis Bay, Arniston, Swellendam and Stellenbosch. We think this trip is perfect to discover one of the most beautiful and famous South African provinces.
Western Cape is the most European province of the country: big cities, malls and vineyards. Nevertheless, the amazing landscapes, the traditions that are always there, or the architecture of the colonial buildings will remind you that you are in Africa. Moreover, Western Cape have a rich history, from the arrival of the first settlers (visits of old buildings such as the Castle of Good Hope) to the end of the apartheid (visit of Robben Island, former jail of Nelson Mandela) and the current story (visit of a township).

For more information about this trip, you can download the detailed brochure here.


For a donation of USD 2 200 (€ 1 900): You will discover the Eastern Cape (for 2 people).

Normal price (once opened): 2 600 (€ 2 250).


During 11 days, you will visit these cities: Port Elizabeth, Storms River, The Crags, Elundini and Hogsback.
This trip is wild oriented and will bring you in unbelievable sites. All the outside activities are available: hikes, bungy jump (from the worlds highest commercial bungy bridge), canopy tour, sandboard... You will find your happiness! It is the opportunity to encounter the South African fauna too: you will go on safari in one of the most wonderful park of the country to watch the Big Five, or you will meet the African Penguin during a hike on the beach or during a visit in a rehabilitation center. Moreover, you will discover the traditions and the lifestyle of locals during a stay in an authentic Xhosa village: unmissable!

For more information about this trip, you can download the detailed brochure here.


For a donation of USD 3 000 (€2 590): You will discover many places from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth (for 2 people).

Normal price (once opened): USD 3 500 (€ 3 000).


During 15 days, you will visit these cities: Cape Town, Hermanus, Struis Bay, Arniston, Mossel Bay, The Crags, Storms River and Port Elizabeth.
This trip mixes the two previous packages. It is perfect if you have two weeks for a first immersion in the country. You will learn the history of South Africa by visiting fascinating museums. One of them, at Mossel Bay, give you the opportunity to go in a real caravel, which sailed from Europe to South Africa! Activities into the wild will show you the incredible landscapes of this region. The fauna encounters are not forgotten: penguins, dolphins, whales, sharks,Big Five can be approached all along your trip. Moreover, you will have a stay in a township to discover the life of locals. 

For more information about this trip, you can download the detailed brochure here.


For more information, please contact us or visit our website.

Find us on the internet

  • our website: www.echappee-australe.com
  • on facebook:
  • on google+:
  • on youtube:

What are the risks?

The tourism industry is very regulated in France. It permit to protect the customer. The conditions to open a tour operator are:

  • Skills: a diploma in tourism and experiences. This condition is validated through Amandine.
  • A financial guarantee: it permit to cover the customer. This is the raison d'etre of our crowdfunding campaign. The amount depends on the organization of the tour operator (society, association, …).
1. If we will not reach our campaign's goal?
We will do our best to open our tour operator. We have different financial solutions. Moreover, we can open our company as an association: nothing will change for our customers and we will have less charges.

2. If we will not have a financial guarantee?
This is our biggest problem. We believe in our project and our close relations follow us: to obtain the guarantee, they will provide 200 000€ (via there properties). If we can't have this guarantee, we will do our best to reimburse donations.

Please, tell us if you think that there are other risks.

FAQ – Frequently Asked Questions

  1. The trips that you offer are for how many people?
  2. The discounts are available for me and for my friend?
  3. Can we change the trips that you offer depending on our wishes? 
  4. Can we choose the date of departure?
  5. Does the price change depending on the date of departure?
  6. What is the best season to watch whales?

1. The trips that you offer are for how many people?

The trips that we offer via the crowfunding are for 2 people. Car rental, accommodations in double bed room and activities are included (have a look in our brochures for more information). For example, 1 donation of USD 2 000 will give you a trip for you and for you wife/husband/friend.

2. The discounts are available for me and for my friend?

If you make a donation giving you a discount (USD 250 for 5% or USD 500 for 10%), this discount will be for the trip of your choice in our future catalogue or for a tailor-made trip. This discount will be for: accommodations, activities and car rental. The trip can be for a maximum of 4 people + 1 young child.

3. Can we change the trips that you offer depending on our wishes?

We can adapt your trips depending of what you want: we can change accommodations, add activities or complete it by the visit of other places. We can talk about that by email and/or by phone. From the beginning, it is very important for us that your trip will be exactly what you want.

4. Can we choose the date of departure?

The only important point for the date of your departure is to wait the opening of our business (our goal: April 2015). Then, we will organize your trip for the date of your choice.

5. Does the price change depending on the date of departure?

For a trip in 2015, normally, there will not have additional costs (excepting in case of an important variation of the exchange rates. Our partners told gave us price for 2015 and should not change.

6. What is the best season to watch whales?

Whales go along the south african coast during winter (in southern hemisphere): from July to November. The trips “Western Cape by car” and “from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth by car” pass by Hermanus. Many Whales stay in the bay and you can watch them from the coast. From the 2nd to the 4th October of 2015, there will be the Whale Festival in Hermanus. We suggest you to travel during this period.


   Click Here for English!

Faire de vos voyages un enrichissement personnel : Échappée Australe, futur tour opérateur.

Vous aussi vous trouvez que payer entre 3 000 et 4 000 euros pour passer 10 jours en Afrique du Sud à 2 (sans les billets d'avion), c'est cher?
Vous aussi vous pensez que payer cette somme pour des voyages dans des hôtels sans charme, c'est cher?
Vous n'arrivez pas à trouver des agences de voyages ou des voyagistes qui vous font réellement aller en dehors des zones touristiques ?

Nous avons rencontré les mêmes problèmes. 

C'est pourquoi nous voulons ouvrir un tour-opérateur abordable pour vendre des voyages en Afrique Australe et vers les îles de l'Océan Indien. A titre de comparaison, nous pouvons vous envoyer en Afrique du Sud pour 2 000 euros pour 2 personnes.

Nous privilégions la rencontre avec les locaux et les autres voyageurs et tenons à ce que les logements apportent un plus au voyage : originalité, situation, charme ou favorisant les échanges d'expériences. Nous avons testé les logements que nous proposons et les avons validés en fonction de ces critères !

Nous avons traversé l'Afrique Australe en mode routard à plusieurs reprises (9 mois au total): à pieds, en vélo, en stop, en transports locaux et en voiture. Nous avons testé toutes sortes de logements : chez l'habitant, en guest houses, en B&B, en backpackers, dans des lodges, dans des camping… Nous avons également testé des activités originales.

Nous connaissons les destinations que nous proposons et avons déjà organisé des voyages pour des amis : ils ont adoré !

Sommaire

  • Notre projet
  • Qui sommes nous?
  • Notre vision
  • Les récompenses
    • Pour un don de 50 USD (43 €): nous vous enverrons un email de remerciement
    • Pour un don de 250 USD (216 €): nous vous offrons une réduction de 5%
    • Pour un don de 500 USD (432 €): nous vous offrons une réduction de 10%
    • Pour un don de 2 000 USD (1 730€): nous vous ferons découvrir le Western Cape (pour 2 personnes)
    • Pour un don de 2 200 USD (1 900€): nous vous ferons découvrir l'Eastern Cape (pour 2 personnes)
    • Pour un don de 3 000 USD (2 590€): nous vous emmènerons de Cape Town à Port Elizabeth (pour 2 personnes)
  • Retrouvez-nous sur internet
  • Quels sont les risques pour ce projet?
  • FAQ - Foire Aux Questions
    1. Les voyages proposés sont pour combien de personnes ?
    2. Les réductions proposées sont-elles valables pour moi et mon conjoint ?
    3. Peut-on adapter les voyages que vous proposez selon nos envies ?
    4. Pour les voyages proposés, peut-on choisir la date qui nous convient ?
    5. Y a t-il un surcoût en fonction de la date du voyage ?
    6. Quelle est la meilleure période pour observer les baleines ?

Notre projet

Nous avons pour projet d'ouvrir un tour-opérateur spécialisé sur l'Afrique Australe. Nous vendrons nos voyages uniquement sur internet (pas d'agence physique). Les voyages seront à la carte : chaque voyage est unique et est élaboré avec le client afin qu'il lui corresponde. Les voyages seront composés des prestations suivantes : location d'une voiture, logements et activités. Les logements seront principalement des backpackers, des guest houses et des bed & breakfasts. L'important pour nous est que le logement apporte un vrai plus à l’expérience : originalité, positionnement ou tout simplement un lieu propice aux rencontres et au partage. Les activités pourront être directement réservées avec nous. Nous souhaitons proposer des voyages à des tarifs abordables : nous ne passerons pas par des intermédiaires.


Qui sommes nous?

Nous sommes deux personnes sur ce projet :

  • Amandine Deslangles qui, après avoir obtenu un bac STG en comptabilité et gestion des entreprises, a obtenu un diplôme Ventes et Productions Touristiques. Elle a également plusieurs expériences en agence de voyages et en tour opérateur.
  • Clément Pilchen, diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs spécialisés en gestion de projet et innovation, a géré des projets dans des secteurs variés (BTP, milieu pharmaceutique, aide en création d'entreprise) avant de travailler 2 années dans le secteur informatique.


Depuis 2010, nous travaillons sur ce projet de tour opérateur. Nous sommes ainsi partis une 1e fois en Afrique du Sud et au Swaziland en 2010 pour connaître ces pays. En 2013 et 2014, nous sommes retournés pendant 7 mois en Afrique Australe dans le but de trouver les partenaires fiables pour les différentes prestations que nous proposerons. Nous sommes ainsi certains qu'il y a un potentiel inexploité dans ces pays pour un tourisme différent, en adéquation avec notre vision.


Notre vision

Nous sommes partis du constat suivant : les voyages proposés en Afrique Australe par les agences de voyages sont tous les mêmes et ne permettent pas de véritablement connaître les pays. De plus, ils sont généralement assez chers compte tenu du coût de la vie de ces pays.

Nous voulons proposer la découverte de lieux insolites et réellement hors des sentiers battus. Nous nous basons sur nos expériences et nos connaissances de cette région du monde. Nous voulons privilégier les rencontres et les échanges, que ce soit avec les populations locales ou avec les autres voyageurs. Nous pensons que le voyage doit être un enrichissement personnel, c'est pourquoi ce point nous est important.

L'Afrique Australe n'est pas forcément une région très connue. La sécurité de nos clients sera au cœur de nos prestations. C'est pourquoi nous avions décidé de réellement explorer ces pays et de travailler avec des partenaires en qui nous pouvons avoir confiance.

Enfin la confiance du client est primordiale. Personne n'est à l'abri d'un manquement de son voyagiste, en particulier sur internet. Pour éviter tout problème, notre mode de fonctionnement sera le suivant : dès que nous recevrons l'argent du client, nous le reverserons à nos prestataires afin de finaliser la transaction. Cela peut sembler logique mais, bien souvent, les versements de l'argent aux prestataires s'effectuent par période (par exemple : tous les trois mois). Cela peut entraîner des dettes que le voyagiste ne serait pas en mesure de couvrir et le client risque de se retrouver sans logements une fois dans le pays… L'autre aspect de cette confiance sera de souscrire à une garantie financière à hauteur de 200 000€. Cette garantie aura pour objectif de payer les dettes en cas de manquement de l'entreprise. Le client n'aura donc aucune mauvaise surprise avec nous !

Les récompenses

Par le crowdfunding, nous vous proposons de devenir client avant l'heure : que ce soit par des réductions sur les voyages que nous vendrons ou tout simplement par des voyages à prix réduits.

Nous proposons ainsi de vous organiser des voyages en Afrique du Sud pour 2 personnes.

Pour un don de 50 USD (43 €): Nous vous enverrons un email de remerciement

Toute contribution est la bienvenue et nous aidera énormément. C'est pourquoi nous vous enverrons un email pour vous remercier, dès que la campagne de financement sera terminée. De plus, nous vous tiendrons informé de l'avancé de notre projet.

Pour un don de 250 USD (216 €): Nous vous offrons une réduction de 5%

Une fois notre tour opérateur ouvert, vous bénéficierez d'une réduction de 5% à valoir sur le voyage de votre choix (dont les voyages sur mesures) à destination de l'Afrique Australe et sur les îles de l'Océan Indien.

Par exemple, le voyage que nous proposons actuellement pour un don de 2 000 USD (environ 1 730 € / Western Cape en voiture pour 2 personnes) coûtera environ 2 400 USD (environ 2 000 €). Cette différence provient des charges et taxes que nous auront une fois le tour opérateur ouvert.

Avec votre réduction de 5%, vous pourrez bénéficier de ce voyage au prix de 2 250 USD (environ 1 900€).

Pour un don de 500 USD (432 €): Nous vous offrons une réduction de 10%

Une fois notre tour opérateur ouvert, vous bénéficierez d'une réduction de 10% à valoir sur le voyage de votre choix (dont les voyages sur mesures) à destination de l'Afrique Australe et sur les îles de l'Océan Indien.

Par exemple, le voyage que nous proposons actuellement pour un don de 2 200 USD (environ 1 900 € / Eastern Cape en voiture pour 2 personnes) coûtera environ 2 600 USD (environ 2 250 €). Cette différence provient des charges et taxes que nous auront une fois le tour opérateur ouvert.

Avec votre réduction de 10%, vous pourrez bénéficier de ce voyage au prix de 2 300 USD (environ 2 000€) .

Pour un don de 2 000 USD (1 730 €): Nous vous ferons découvrir le Western Cape (pour 2 personnes).

Prix normal (une fois ouvert): 2 400 USD (2 000€).


Pendant 11 jours, vous visiterez les villes suivantes: Cape Town, Hermanus, Struis Bay, Arniston, Swellendam, Stellenbosch. Nous pensons que c'est l'idéal pour découvrir sur une courte durée l'une des plus jolies et célèbres régions d'Afrique du Sud.
Le Western Cape est la région la plus européenne du pays: des grandes villes, des centres commerciaux, et des domaines viticoles. Vous n'en serez pas moins en Afrique comme vous le rappelleront les paysages extraordinaires, les traditions toujours présentes, ou encore l'architecture des bâtiments d'époque. Le Western Cape, c'est également une région riche en histoire, de l'arrivée des premiers colons (visites de bâtiments d'époque comme le fort de Bonne Espérance) jusqu'à la fin de l'apartheid (visite de Robben Island, ancienne prison de Nelson Mandela), sans oublier l'histoire actuelle (visite d'un township).

Pour plus d'informations sur ce voyage, vous pouvez télécharger la brochure détaillée ici.


Pour un don de 2 200 USD (1 900 €): Nous vous ferons découvrir l'Eastern Cape (pour 2 personnes).

Prix normal (une fois ouvert): 2 600 USD (2 250€).


Pendant 11 jours, vous visiterez les villes suivantes: Port Elizabeth, Storms River, The Crags, Elundini et Hogsback.
Ce circuit est très orienté vers la nature et vous emmènera dans des sites majestueux. Toutes les activités d'extérieur sont possibles: randonnées, saut à l'élastique (le plus haut du monde depuis un pont), accrobranche, sandboard... Vous y trouverez forcément votre bonheur! C'est également l'opportunité de découvrir la faune sud-africaine: un safari dans un des plus beaux parcs du pays vous permettra d'observer les Big Five, ou une rencontre avec les manchots du cap, que ce soit au hasard d'une sortie en bord de mer ou en visitant un centre de réhabilitation qui leur est dédié. Enfin, nous vous proposons d'en apprendre plus sur les traditions et sur le mode de vie des locaux en séjournant dans un authentique village Xhosa: immanquable! 

Pour plus d'informations sur ce voyage, vous pouvez télécharger la brochure détaillée ici.


Pour un don de 3 000 USD (2 590 €): Nous vous emmènerons de Cape Town à Port Elizabeth (pour 2 personnes).

Prix normal (une fois ouvert): 3 500 USD (3 000€).


Pendant 15 jours, vous visiterez les villes suivantes: Cape Town, Hermanus, Struis Bay, Arniston, Mossel Bay, The Crags, Storms River et Port Elizabeth.
Ce circuit est un mélange des deux packs précédents. C'est l'idéal si vous avez 2 semaines pour une première immersion dans le pays. Vous pourrez apprendre l'histoire de l'Afrique du Sud en visitant les musées tous plus intéressants les uns que les autres. L'un d'eux, à Mossel Bay, vous offre l'opportunité de monter à bord d'une véritable caravelle qui a fait le voyage entre l'Europe et l'Afrique du Sud! Les activités en pleine nature vous permettront de découvrir les paysages extraordinaires de la région. La découverte de la faune n'est pas en reste: manchots, dauphins, baleines, requins, Big Five sont à rencontrer tout au long de votre voyage. Enfin l'immersion dans un township vous fera découvrir la vie des locaux: nous vous avons prévu un séjour dans l'un d'eux.

Pour plus d'information sur ce voyage, vous pouvez télécharger la brochure détaillée ici.

Pour plus d'informations, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter ou à consulter notre site internet.

Retrouvez-nous sur internet

  • notre site internet: www.echappee-australe.com
  • notre page facebook:
  • notre page google+:
  • notre chaîne youtube:

Quels sont les risques pour ce projet?

Le secteur du tourisme en France est très réglementé. L'objectif est de protéger au maximum le consommateur. Les conditions pour ouvrir un tour-opérateur sont les suivantes:

  • La compétence: un diplôme reconnu dans le tourisme et de le l'expérience. Cette condition est remplie grâce à Amandine.
  • Obtenir une garantie financière dont le montant varie selon la forme du tour-opérateur (société, association, etc.). C'est la raison de notre campagne de financement participatif. Cette garantie a pour but de couvrir les clients face aux défaillances éventuelles de l'entreprise. 
1. Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif de campagne?
Nous ferons tout pour ouvrir notre tour-opérateur. Nous avons d'autres solutions financières viables. De plus, une solution consiste à ouvrir notre agence sous forme d'association: cela ne changera rien pour nos clients mais de notre côté les coûts sont moindres.

2. Si nous n'obtenons pas la garantie financière?
Il s'agit de notre principal obstacle. Nous croyons réellement en notre projet et nos proches y croient également: pour obtenir la garantie financière, ils s'engagent à hauteur de 200 000€ (par des biens immobiliers). Si malgré tout, nous n'obtenions pas cette garantie, nous nous engageons à rembourser au mieux les dons perçus (à 90% de leur valeur, Indiegogo prenant environ 10% des dons).

Si vous voyez d'autres risques, n'hésitez pas à nous en faire part afin que nous les étudiions.

FAQ - Foire Aux Questions

  1. Les voyages proposés sont pour combien de personnes ?
  2. Les réductions proposées sont-elles valables pour moi et mon conjoint ?
  3. Peut-on adapter les voyages que vous proposez selon nos envies ?
  4. Pour les voyages proposés, peut-on choisir la date qui nous convient ?
  5. Y a t-il un surcoût en fonction de la date du voyage ?
  6. Quelle est la meilleure période pour observer les baleines ?

1. Les voyages proposés sont pour combien de personnes?

Les voyages que nous proposons via le crowdfunding sont pour 2 personnes. Ils incluent la location d'une voiture, des logements en chambre double et des activités (je vous invite à lire nos brochures pour plus d'informations). Par exemple, 1 don de votre part de 2 000 USD vous donnera droit à un voyage pour vous et pour votre conjoint (ou toute autre personne vous accompagnant).

2. Les réductions proposées sont-elles valables pour moi et mon conjoint?

Si vous nous faites un don vous donnant droit à une future réduction (250 USD pour 5% ou 500 USD pour 10%), cette réduction portera sur un voyage de votre choix de notre catalogue (disponible à partir de l'ouverture de notre tour-opérateur) ou sur un voyage sur mesure. Cette réduction s'appliquera sur les prestations suivantes: logement, activités, location de voiture. La réduction s'appliquera pour un voyage pour vous, votre conjoint et pour d'autres personnes vous accompagnant (un voyage pour 4 personnes + 1 enfant en bas âge maximum).

3. Peut-on adapter les voyages que vous proposez selon nos envies?

Nous pouvons adapter le voyage à vos goûts en changeant le type de logement, en ajoutant des activités ou en le complétant par la visite d'autres lieux. Nous pourrons en discuter par email et/ou par téléphone. Dès le début, nous accordons de l'importance à ce que votre voyage corresponde à vos envies.

4. Pour les voyages proposés, peut-on choisir la date qui nous convient?

Concernant la date, il faut tout d'abord attendre que nous soyons ouverts (nous envisageons de démarrer courant Avril 2015). Les premiers voyages pourront donc se faire dès le mois de juin.

5. Y a t-il un surcoût en fonction de la date du voyage?

Pour ce qui est de l'année 2015, il ne devrait pas y avoir de surcoûts (sauf en cas de grande variation des taux de change USD-Euro-ZAR). Nous avons contacté nos partenaires et les tarifs qu'ils nous ont donnés s'appliqueront normalement pour toute l'année 2015.

6. Quelle est la meilleure période pour observer les baleines?

Les baleines longent la côte sud africaine pendant l’hiver australe: de Juillet à Novembre. Les voyage « Western Cape en autotour » et « de Cape Town à Port Elizabeth en autotour », vous emmènent à Hermanus. Les baleines y viennent en nombre et reste dans la baie. Vous pourrez les observer depuis la côte. Du 2 au 4 Octobre 2015, il y aura un festival dans cette ville: The Whale Festival. Nous vous conseillons d’y aller à ce moment.

Cliquez ici pour la version française
 
Make your trips a
personal enrichment: Échappée Australe, future tour operator.
Do you think that a price of USD 3 500 or USD 4 600 (€ 3 000 or € 4 000) for a 10 days trip in South Afria (for 2 people without fly tickets) is expensive?
Do you think that this price is expensive for trips offering hostel without charm?
You don't find travel agencies or tour operator offering trips truly off the beaten track? We encountered these problems. That's why we will launch a tour operator to sell affordable trips in Southern Africa and in the Indian Ocean islands. For example, we can sell you a trip in South Africa for USD 2 400 (€ 2 000). Meeting locals and other travellers are a key point of our vision. Moreover, we think that accommodations should give something to improve you trip: originality, situation, charm or favouring the sharing of experiences. We tested accommodations and we validated with these criteria. We travelled in Southern Africa as backpackers many times (9 months): by foot, by bicycle, by hitch hiking, by typical means of transports and by car. We tested different sort of accommodations: homestay, guest houses, B&B, backpackers, lodges, campsites... We practised too many unusual activities. We know the destinations that we offer and have been organized trips for friends: they really enjoyed!

Our project
About us
Our vision

The awards

For a donation of USD 50 (€ 43): we will send you a than-you email
For a donation of USD 250 (€ 216): you will have a 5% discount
For a donation of USD 500 (€ 432): you will have a 10% discount
For a donation of USD 2 000 (€ 1 730): you will discover the Western Cape (for 2 people)
For a donation of USD 2 200 (€ 1 900): you will discover the Eastern Cape (for 2 people)
For a donation of USD 3 000 (€ 2 590): You will discover many places from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth (for 2 people)


Find us on the internet
What are the risks?

FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions

The trips that you offer are for how many people?

Our project

We want to launch a
tour operator specialized in Southern Africa. We will sell trips only
via the internet (without physical agency). All our trips will be
tailor-made: each trip is unique and is designed with the customer.
We ensure that the trip matches with the customer. Each trip will
include car rental, accommodations and activities. The accommodations
will be mostly backpackers, guest houses and bed & breakfasts.
The key point for the accommodation is to give more to the
experience: originality, situation, conducive to meet people.
Activities will be booked directly with us. We will offer affordable
trips: we will work directly with our local partners.

About us

We are two people
working on this project:

Amandine
Deslangles who have a tourism degree in trips design and a
baccalaureate in accountancy and business management. She worked in
different travel agencies and tour operators.
Clément Pilchen,
having a master degree in projects management and innovation, managed
many projects in multiple sectors (building, pharmaceutical, business
launching) and worked during 2 years in IT.


Since 2010, we have
been working on this project. We went a 1st time in South
Africa and in Swaziland in 2010 to discover these countries. In 2013
and 2014, we came back in Southern Africa during 7 months to meet
trusted partners for the different services we will offer. We are
sure that there is an unexploited potential in these countries for a
different tourism, matching with our vision.

Our vision
We noted that the
trips offered in Southern Africa by the travel agencies are generally
the same and don't really facilitate discovering the countries.
Moreover, they are expensive compared with the cost of living.

We will offer the
opportunity to discover unusual sites, off the beaten track. We will
use our experiences and knowledge of this part of the world. We will
favor meeting and sharing with locals and other travellers. This is a
key point of our vision because we think that a trip has to allow a
personal enrichment.

Southern Africa is
not really known to everyone. Security of our customers will be the
heart of our services. That's why we decided to really explore these
countries and to work with trusted partners.

Finally, the
confidence of our customers is essential. Nobody is protected from a
negligence of the tour operator, in particular on the internet.
That's why, we will operate as follow: when we will receive the
payment from our customers, we will pay immediately our partners to
finalize the booking. You can think that it is normal and logical but
usually tour operators pay their partners periodically (for example:
one time by quarter). This way can cause debts that the tour operator
can't cover and the customer risks to have no accommodation... That's
why we want to subscribe to a financial guarantee for an amount of
€200 000. This guarantee will be subscribe to cover the debts in
case of problems. With us, the customer can't have unpleasant
surprises!

The awards
With
the crowdfunding, we offer you the opportunity to become our first
customers: you can have discounts for our future trips or you can
obtain an affordable trip in South Africa for 2 people.
 
For a donation of USD 50 (€ 43): We will send you a thank-you emailNo contribution are too short, and we really appreciate your support! That's why we will send you a personal email to thank you when the campaign will be finished. Moreover, we will tell you everything about the project's progress.
 
For a donation of USD 250 (€ 216): You will have a 5% discountTo have an idea of a 5% discount, we need to give you an example. The trip that we offer for a donation of USD 2 000 (€ 1 730 / Western Cape by car for 2 people) will cost approximately USD 2 400 (€ 2 000). In fact, when we will open our tour operator, we will have different charges and taxes. That's why the price of the trip will be more than the crowdfunding price.If you have a 5% discount, you will pay for this trip approximately USD 2 250 (€ 1 90).Please, note that it is an example. Your 5% discount will be available for the trip of your choice (including tailor-made trip) in Southern Africa and in islands of Indian Ocean.
 
For a donation of USD 500 (€ 432): You will have a 10% discountTo have an idea of a 10% discount, we need to give you an example. The trip that we offer for a donation of USD 2 200 (€ 1 900 / Eastern Cape by car for 2 people) will cost approximately USD 2 600 (€ 2 250). In fact, when we will open our tour operator, we will have different charges and taxes. That's why the price of the trip will be more than the crowdfunding price.If you have a 10% discount, you will pay for this trip approximately USD 2 300 (€ 2 000).Please, note that it is an example. Your 10% discount will be available for the trip of your choice (including tailor-made trip) in Southern Africa and in islands of Indian Ocean.
 
For
a donation of USD 2 000 (€ 1 730): You will discover the Western Cape (for 2
people).Normal price (once opened): USD 2 400 (€ 2000).
During
11 days, you will visit these cities: Cape Town, Hermanus, Struis
Bay, Arniston, Swellendam and Stellenbosch. We think this trip is
perfect to discover one of the most beautiful and famous South
African provinces.Western Cape is the most European province of
the country: big cities, malls and vineyards. Nevertheless, the
amazing landscapes, the traditions that are always there, or the
architecture of the colonial buildings will remind you that you are
in Africa. Moreover, Western Cape have a rich history, from the
arrival of the first settlers (visits of old buildings such as the
Castle of Good Hope) to the end of the apartheid (visit of Robben
Island, former jail of Nelson Mandela) and the current story (visit
of a township).For more information about this trip, you can download the detailed brochure here.
 
For
a donation of USD 2 200 (€ 1 900): You will discover the Eastern Cape (for 2
people).Normal price (once opened): 2 600 (€ 2 250).
During
11 days, you will visit these cities: Port Elizabeth, Storms River,
The Crags, Elundini and Hogsback.This trip is wild oriented and
will bring you in unbelievable sites. All the outside activities are
available: hikes, bungy jump (from the worlds highest commercial
bungy bridge), canopy tour, sandboard... You will find your
happiness! It is the opportunity to encounter the South African fauna
too: you will go on safari in one of the most wonderful park of the
country to watch the Big
Five,
or you will meet the African Penguin during a hike on the beach or
during a visit in a rehabilitation center. Moreover, you will
discover the traditions and the lifestyle of locals during a stay in
an authentic Xhosa village: unmissable!For more information about this trip, you can download the detailed brochure here.
 
For
a donation of USD 3 000 (€2 590): You will discover many places from Cape Town
to Port Elizabeth (for 2 people).Normal price (once opened): USD 3 500 (€ 3 000).
During
15 days,
you will visit these cities: Cape Town, Hermanus, Struis Bay,
Arniston, Mossel Bay, The Crags, Storms River and Port
Elizabeth.This trip mixes the two previous packages. It is
perfect if you have two weeks for a first immersion in the country.
You will learn the history of South Africa by visiting fascinating
museums. One of them, at Mossel Bay, give you the opportunity to go
in a real caravel, which sailed from Europe to South Africa!
Activities into the wild will show you the incredible landscapes of
this region. The fauna encounters are not forgotten: penguins,
dolphins, whales, sharks,Big
Five can be approached
all along your trip. Moreover, you will have a stay in a township to
discover the life of locals. For more information about this trip, you can download the detailed brochure here.
For
more information, please contact us or visit our website.

Find us on the internet

our website: www.echappee-australe.com

on facebook: 

on google+: 

on youtube: 


 
What are the risks?

The tourism industry is very regulated in France. It permit to protect the customer. The conditions to open a tour operator are:
Skills: a diploma in tourism and experiences. This condition is validated through Amandine.

A financial guarantee: it permit to cover the customer. This is the raison d'etre of our crowdfunding campaign. The amount depends on the organization of the tour operator (society, association, …).
1. If we will not reach our campaign's goal?We will do our best to open our tour operator. We have different financial solutions. Moreover, we can open our company as an association: nothing will change for our customers and we will have less charges.
2. If we will not have a financial guarantee?This is our biggest problem. We believe in our project and our close relations follow us: to obtain the guarantee, they will provide 200 000€ (via there properties). If we can't have this guarantee, we will do our best to reimburse donations.

Please, tell us if you think that there are other risks.

 
FAQ – Frequently Asked Questions 

The trips that you offer are for how many people?
The discounts are available for me and for my friend?
Can we change the trips that you offer depending on our wishes? 
Can we choose the date of departure?
Does the price change depending on the date of departure?
What is the best season to watch whales?

 
1. The trips that you offer are for how many people?The trips that we offer via the crowfunding are for 2 people. Car rental, accommodations in double bed room and activities are included (have a look in our brochures for more information).
For example, 1 donation of USD 2 000 will give you a trip for you and for you wife/husband/friend. 
 
2. The discounts are available for me and for my friend? If you make a donation giving you a discount (USD 250 for 5% or USD 500 for 10%), this discount will be for the trip of your choice in our future catalogue or for a tailor-made trip. This discount will be for: accommodations, activities and car rental. The trip can be for a maximum of 4 people + 1 young child. 
 
3. Can we change the trips that you offer depending on our wishes?We can adapt your trips depending of what you want: we can change accommodations, add activities or complete it by the visit of other places. We can talk about that by email and/or by phone. From the beginning, it is very important for us that your trip will be exactly what you want. 
 
4. Can we choose the date of departure?The only important point for the date of your departure is to wait the opening of our business (our goal: April 2015). Then, we will organize your trip for the date of your choice. 
 
5. Does the price change depending on the date of departure?For a trip in 2015, normally, there will not have additional costs (excepting in case of an important variation of the exchange rates. Our partners told gave us price for 2015 and should not change. 
 
6. What is the best season to watch whales?Whales go along the south african coast during winter (in southern hemisphere): from July to November. The trips “Western Cape by car” and “from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth by car” pass by Hermanus. Many Whales stay in the bay and you can watch them from the coast.
From the 2nd to the 4th October of 2015, there will be the Whale Festival in Hermanus. We suggest you to travel during this period.
