story:
[ADDED Feb 27, 2015]Only 67 hours left to go until the campaign is completed. Last effort to double the efforts. We've already achieved our goals. But this last stretch is to increase the number of the bee hives.

[ADDED Feb 26, 2015]If everyone in the organic communities were to donate 1 dollar, we could double even triple the efforts of this campaign. Humbly asking everyone to consider helping.

[Added Feb 2, 2015] $5 Refer a friend contest. top 5 referrers will win this awesome shirt showing their love of bees in the U.P.

[Added Feb 2, 2015] $2 Refer a friend Tshirt contest. top 5 referrers will win this awesome shirt showing their pride in the U.P.

[Added Feb 1, '15] Aside from a few minor issues with the yooperhoney.com website.
For the most part it is completed. However, we will not be opening the actual storefront, at least until we've established a good number of hives, and we have a steady flow of honey and wax.

We Want to thank everyone so far who has helped out so far.

Every little bit goes a long way.
[Added Jan 24, '15] Official Fund Raising T-Shirt. Get yours today


[Added Jan 22, '15]We're almost done with our new website thanks to everyone who helped so far.   
Http://yooperhoney.com
[Added Jan 22, '15] Wood that was ordered is now underneath a tarp  waiting for spring thaw, to start making new hives. We are still looking for more help.





[Added Jan 3, '15]Why are Bee's SO important. Please watch the video.

I moved here to the tip of the Upper Peninsula 13 years ago, my other half was going to MichiganTech to finish off her PhD in Computer science. When we arrived I couldn't believe how beautiful and lush everything was in the Upper Peninsula. I grew up in Minnesota the Land of 10,000 lakes, and even the Boundary Waters Canoe Area where I worked for several years with the DNR can not match the beauty of the U.P.

  As the years went by I learned they... no scratch that. "WE" don't say Upper Peninsula, we say U.P. or Yoopers.

"Say Hey to the U.P. Eh"

In the past five years I have noticed a sharp decline in the bee population, and because of this, I have also taken note and documented the decrease in fruit production and flowers.

I am not quite sure for certain if it is because the dramatic weather changes,
or because of the pesticides and GMO crops that farmers have been planting,
or the toxic clouds from the wood and coal mines and factories that creep down from Canada.

Honeybee's are very finicky and fragile creatures and are considered a keystone species because of their role in the environment . If the bees die, so do all sentient life. Because the bees are what keep the cycle of life going with their pollination of plants.

I am not a tree hugging hippie EPA nut. I just have a passion, to see the future of our planet continue.

I am reaching out to people who share my passion,
To see a project like this grow.

The goal.
*To build 100-200 hives made of untreated lumber and fastened together with sap and wood pegs, to be distributed in the state parks across the Upper Peninsula Michigan.
(With the permission from the DNR with the help of H. Russel from MSU to erect these stands in designated areas of the state forest to avoid human interaction. State Parks that are participating in this venture are ...
-Porcupine Mountains,
-Ottawa State Forest
-Nicolet State Forest
-Isle Royale
-Hiawatha State Forest )
*To monitor and document the health and population level of each hive.
*To monitor the environment around the hives in 5 mile increments.
*To sell the honey to use the monies for upkeep and travel expense to maintain, and to build more hives, and to pay the helpers.

This is a non-profit venture.

My passion is nature, I have no interest in making money off this personally, but there is the initial overhead.

What We Need & What You Get

We need wood, wood and more wood. To build these hives. Also fuel to transport each of these to locations in a 250 mile diameter. Since we cant exactly ask for wood on here, we are asking for monies to purchase wood.

The rest you can see on the side.

The Impact

With GMO Companies trying to change the way crops are farmed just so they can patent seeds and make more money, and the use of some very toxic pesticides and herbicides the bees are dying off at an alarming rate. There is also a new disorder amongst bee colonies that causes the queen bee to literally suicide herself leaving the rest of the bees with out a matron or direction and eventually dying.

By contributing you will be helping the future of bees.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by spreading the word of this project. The more people know about it. The faster this project will grow.

The idea is to keep the bee population healthy and abundant so crops and plant life are lush and beautiful.

Please help.

By raising the extra monies, More hives can be supplied to private land owners wanting to bee keep.



[Added: Jan 1, '15] If you live in the Upper Peninsula MI.,  and you prefer donating materials please feel free to contact via email and arrange for pick up or drop off.
ceric.lasentri@gmail.com

[Added:  Jan 3, '15] We are already a 1/4 way into it, and not even 1/8th of the way through yet. Much love to those who participated by contributing so far. I see this project succeeding beyond expectations. <3 <3

across the Upper Peninsula Michigan.(With the permission from the
DNR with the help of H. Russel from MSU to erect these stands in
designated areas of the state forest to avoid human interaction. State Parks that are participating in this venture are ...-Porcupine Mountains,-Ottawa State
Forest-Nicolet State Forest-Isle Royale -Hiawatha State
Forest )*To monitor and document the health and  population level
of each hive.*To monitor the environment around the hives in 5
mile increments. *To sell the honey to use the monies for upkeep
and travel expense to maintain, and to build more hives, and to pay the helpers.This is a non-profit venture. My passion is nature, I have no interest in making money off this personally, but there is the initial overhead.What We Need & What You Get
We need wood, wood and more wood. To build these hives. Also fuel
to transport each of these to locations in a 250 mile diameter. Since
we cant exactly ask for wood on here, we are asking for monies to
purchase wood. The rest you can see on the side. 

The Impact
With GMO Companies trying to change the way crops are farmed just so 
they can patent seeds and make more money,
and the use of some very toxic pesticides and herbicides the bees are 
dying off at an alarming rate.
There is also a new disorder amongst bee colonies that causes the queen 
bee to literally suicide herself leaving the rest of the bees with out a
 matron or direction and eventually dying.  By
contributing you will be helping the future of bees. Other Ways You Can Help
You can help by spreading the word of this project. The more
people know about it. The faster this project will grow. The
idea is to keep the bee population healthy and abundant so crops and
plant life are lush and beautiful.Please help.By raising the extra monies, More hives can be supplied to private land owners wanting to bee keep.[Added: Jan 1, '15] If you live in the Upper Peninsula MI.,  and you prefer donating materials please feel free to contact via email and arrange for pick up or drop off.ceric.lasentri@gmail.com[Added:  Jan 3, '15] We are already a 1/4 way into it, and not even 1/8th of the way through yet. Much love to those who participated by contributing so far. I see this project succeeding beyond expectations. <3 <3

story:
Introduction to Managing Company

DC ROOTS is a multi-media management group based in the Washington, DC community. Our motto is “Shaping You from the Roots Up.” We are artists, filmmakers, event planners, educators and designers. Using film, music, photography, social media expertise and thoughtfully planned events, DC Roots reaches the target audience via many online and in person mediums. We help to build and expand both our own community and the communities of our clientele in a positive and enriching manner. 

This campaign seeks to raise funds for our small business costs that support local artists, other small businesses and community organizations.  It is important we be able to serve as many clients as possible in a cost effective manner. Your contributions will ensure we are offering as quality services as possible. It will also help to support:
  • Our Black History Month Gala
  • Upcoming Events
  • Office Operations
  • Equipment & Production Costs
We are committed to raising funds to support the continued development of a community for artists in the DMV.
What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise $7,000. Those funds will be used for:

  • A scholarship for a member of the Class of 2015 for support as they begin their study at an undergraduate institution
  • Small Event Costs associated with our Black History Month Black Tie Gala and other Upcoming Events (including securing space, technology needs, food & beverage, paying vendors etc.)
  • Office Operations
  • Equipment

As a donor, you receive the following as our appreciation for your gift:

  • Up to $25: Listing on the "Donor" section of our website
  • $25-$50: Listing on the "Donor" section of our website & DC Roots T-Shirt with Logo
  • $50-$100: Listing on the "Donor" section of our website, DC Roots T-Shirt, Photo Feature on main website page
  • $100-$250: Listing on the "Donor" section of our website, DC Roots T-Shirt, Photo Feature on main website page, Thank you Gift
  • $250 and Up: Listing on the "Donor" section of our website, DC Roots T-Shirt, Video Feature on main website page, Thank you Gift, & (1) complimentary DC Roots service
  • * $1,000 donors will receive listing on the "Donor" section of our website, DC Roots Jacket with logo, Video Feature on main page of our website, Thank You Gift, "Season Pass" comp. entry to a year's worth of DC Roots events & custom event planning services for an event of your own!
The Impact

To date, there is no established community and arena that artists, creative persons and other start-up groups and organizations can look to to begin to build themselves up in the DMV. DC Roots seeks to fill this need. Your contributions allow us to work with artists from all genres of media (music, film, visual etc.) and other clientele offering premium services and access to networks and events they may not otherwise be able to afford. 

We have successfully executed the following events:

  • Baked Goods (pastry and artist showcase for up and coming chef, music and visual artists)
  • Artist Mingle (networking event for artists throughout the DMV)
  • Run Joe 48 (48-hour film competition, winners were DCPS Wilson SHS students)
  • Unplugged DC (small concert showcase for DMV vocal artists and bands)
We also invest back in our community with our work with Food & Friends, The Sasha Bruce Foundation and Coyaba Dance Theatre.

Risks & Challenges

Starting a company is no easy feat. When we decided to found DC Roots in May 2014, our goal was to add structure and a network to the informal ways that each member was individually supporting our community in hopes of combining skill sets, talents and experience that  would enable us to bring the dreams of others into fruition. 

We do not pay ourselves. We charge our clients as minimally as possible to ensure a mutually beneficial relationship: they are able to enlist our help and we have what we need to create the projects-executed as closely to their original vision as possible.

That is why this campaign is so important. We truly need your contributions and support to continue operating. Your help is invaluable. We are truly grateful for your love and support through our process. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our video, work, our website and this Campaign with your network!

Below is our contact information

DC Roots

thedcroots.com

Twitter/Instagram: @thedcroots

Facebook Group Page: DC Roots

Link to this fundraising campaign:

Link to our promotional video: http://youtu.be/GrqcIDjRolU

________________________________________________________________________

Thank you for your love and support! We promise to keep bringing you the best while making a difference in our community!

Sincerely,

Abijah Stokes, Jasmine T.Q. McLaurin, Naomi Washington-Roque & Jasmin Cook

story:
Hello green beauties! My name is Jenny. Seven years ago, my dream was to provide non-toxic, eco-friendly beauty treatments and events. Just think--no more chemical smells in salons. No more toxic garbage finding its way to soil and groundwater. Through hard work and inspired persistence, I made my dream happen in 2013—it is called Noktivo Spa, and it is in Lincoln Square in Chicago. In just one year, my staff and I produced a thriving business that brings health and beauty to both people and the planet.

Unfortunately, just as Noktivo was taking off, flooding and water damage forced us out of our space. We have a proven record and an incredibly unique product. But we exhausted our resources trying to keep our space that, now, we have lost. We need your help now to build a new home for Noktivo.

We know how to do this. We’ve done it before, successfully. And, if we work fast enough, we will retain our amazing and supportive client base. We have big, big dreams. We have a lot of energy—more than enough energy to make those dreams happen. We just need a little bit of go-go.

Noktivo has already changed the standard for health in beauty services in Chicago. Help me build on that change. We are planning to open in a new space in July 2015.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $20,000 for Buildout

Most of the money we are raising is going to build the actual business, no fluff stuff; drywall, painting, plumbing, flooring, lighting, equipment, signage, permits, licenses, and so on.

  • We need $3,500 for PR and Marketing

Marketing materials such as postcards, flyers, brochures and business cards to tell new and existing clients about our new space. We have produced our own marketing materials and press releases in the past, but handing this over to an expert would free up much needed time to focus on the nuts and bolts of building.

We love bartering! If a generous supporter wants to offer marketing services in exchange for beauty services, we are so game! Please contact us via email.

  • We need $1,500 to cover unforeseen costs

We have learned this year that there will always be some "Oh, crap!" moments. We don’t want unforeseen bumps to slow us down one bit!

Time is of the essence. The longer we wait, the harder it will be to regain any lost momentum. We have a loyal client base and dedicated, talented nail techs now. Noktivo can’t afford to lose them!

  • We win, you win!

We've created some amazing deals on day spa products and services exclusively for Indiegogo supporters! I want you to come in and experience the dream that has been dancing in my head and that you will have helped make happen. Click on "Perks" to see ALL the fabulous things you can get for supporting us!

The Impact

  • We've measured the ecological impact of a spa service from Noktivo versus from a traditional nail salon. Yep, that's right. We've done the math: each non-toxic nail service eliminates the use of close to 1lb per client,  per year, of toxic materials. With our current customer base of 1,200 beauties, that's literally over A TON of chemicals we save from entering our waterways each year. You, and the biodiversity of our Lake Michigan can rest easy.
  • We are able to source, 75% of our supplies and products from local manufacturers, primarily minority owned as well, keeping our dollars here in the local economy and reducing the pollution and packaging associated with transport.
  • Our exclusive Indiegogo shirts, hoodies and totes are designed and made by Vfish Designs, a local woman-owned company. We are a mom-owned business supporting mom-owned businesses! 

We are here to build a healthy beauty community. Our business is for-profit, but, just as importantly, our business is for-people. You can't create effective social change without both. Our bottom line is to foster a discussion of what we are putting on our bodies and creating a healthy work environment for technicians. We aim to build on this through advocacy, education and lobbying efforts for reform.

Risks & Challenges

With great risk comes great reward. Noktivo is being forced to expand two years earlier than my business plan accounted for. While I am confident and ready to hustle for it to happen, it still comes with risk. We will have to market and advertise a brand new location; while some of our clients will follow us, some will not strictly based on geography. 

With the plan we have in place and your support, I have no doubt at all that these barriers can be overcome!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Share our campaign, share our mission and our plight! A good word goes a long way. It's simple to share using the social media buttons on the campaign, or you can embed a link and explain to your friends and family your personal touch with our story. 
  • Come see us for a non-toxic nail service or beauty product. Every penny we make is going towards a new home. Visit us in our temporary location inside Chroma K8 Beautique at 5425 N. Lincoln Avenue, Chicago, IL 60625. 
  • Watch this campaign! Follow us on our social channels @noktivo! It is our goal that you will be able to walk into Noktivo’s new home by July 2015. We can’t wait to see you there!

story:
Rotaract Club Tuzla initiative

(Rotary Club Tuzla Youth Program)


For the last couple of days, Bosnia and Herzegovina has suffered severe flooding, flooding that we have not seen for at least 120 years.  Some people have lost their lives.  Some news sources say that 35 people have been killed--many believe it's more—but the figures have not been made public so as to not cause panic.  Many houses have been damaged or destroyed, roads closed due to soil erosion, and bridges collapsed.  Even worse, some places do not have water, electricity, and people have been moved to shelters where they need everything:  food, water, blankets and a place to stay.  

1, 500  hectares of agricultural fields are currently under water.  Power supply stations are also under water.  There have been over 1500 landslides from soil erosion in and around the city of Tuzla alone, and the number of dead is still rising. Many bridges have been wiped away. Hence, the road infrastructure is closed--and for many cities there is nobody going in or out.  11.000 households are without electricity just in Tuzla.

The weather has taken its first lives. What’s worse, it is said that landslides are moving some of the unexploded landmines left over from the 1992-1995 war, which presents an present an even bigger danger now. 

It is estimated that this has struck over 1 million people.

We do not have digital TV, but luckily we still have an analogue signal so we can watch the news.  The police, fire departments,  and military are all fully engaged.  But more help is needed.

We at Rotaract Club Tuzla have started an initiative to collect money for those in urgent need: funds will be used to buy food, water, or to pay for motel stays if shelters fill up (some cities had to evacuate over 10,000 people).  Moreover, we currently also need supplies like water pumps and water purification products.  Some places have access water only up to an hour a day because of restrictions and new contamination of springs.  And bottled water is gone almost the second it hits the shelves.

We have set a goal of EUR 4,000--lower than originally planned so we can get funds to those in need sooner--but I believe that together, we can exceed this goal if there are enough backers.  Any amount helps and goes directly to those in need.

If not by donating, you can always help by sharing this link.

story:
Why?

A couple decades ago, a brother of the Delta Sigma Phi took his life inside our chapter house. Since the tragic death of one of our brothers, we have supported community resource centers such as our community mental health center and suicide hotline.

All proceeds of this fundraising campaign will benefit Community Elements in Champaign, Illinois. Community Elements educates, advocates, and helps build communities of well-being by providing individuals and families a range of prevention, intervention, and behavioral health treatment services. These services are culturally inclusive, client/family-focused, and recovery-centered through service excellence, mentoring, and leadership. More information can be found here.

Every year, we hold a benefit concert to help raise money for Community Elements. This year, Sounds for Support will be held on Saturday, April 12 at the Delta Sigma Phi house on 105 E Armory Ave.

Any donation of at least $1 receives a personalized email thanking your for your support. In addition, for every $5 you donate you will receive one admittance to the show.

This year's bands playing are:

Illini Contraband

The Phantom Broadcast

Church Booty

and our very own Forty Cents Flat

Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites. It is YOU that allow us to make this event successful. The brothers of the Alpha - Alpha Chapter at the University of Illinois appreciate any support that is given, financially or otherwise. Donate to join us in making a difference.

story:
Our mission to grow and share good food with veterans and with you!

Dylan, Heidi, Cypress and Manuel Stockman

This mission has evolved over many years and the educational process has taken us far and wide.

Since Dylan is a Veteran of the US Army, we have become aware of a growing movement to retrain veterans into farmers. (For more info on this, check out the Farmer Veteran Coalition and Ground Operations)  It makes perfect sense that farming, gardening, cooking and all of the associated tasks would be restorative to soldiers.  

We believe in appreciating these young men and women as people who believe in SERVING; people who worked hard and gained valuable skills to improve their lives. After the intensity of military life, some people wish for a change of pace and some personal restoration.  We want to offer people a place to learn all about food production, and allow them to contribute with whatever special skills or interests they may have.  For example, Maria was a mechanic in the Air Force and she comes to our farm to learn about cooking. Maria may earn room and board by helping with cooking, and she may earn extra cash by putting her mechanical abilities to use assembling our wind turbine, or fixing a tractor.

While Veterans represent a group near and dear to us, and they will receive priority for spaces, we plan to consider all types of people as students.  Individuals and families are encouraged to apply for a work-trade, or just rent a space for a short time.


We realize that our goal is BIG! You may ask, "How are you qualified for this endeavor, and what are you Stockpeople bringing to the table?"

-Over the years, we have fed many thousands of people!  In restaurants, in farmer's market stands, at farm dinners, catering events, packing CSA boxes, working on various farms.

-We have already invested in many tools of the trade.  We have most hand tools necessary for small farming. We have small livestock fencing as well as deer fencing.  We have kitchen and catering implements as well as the gear for a farmer's market stand. We could serve dinner for 50 this weekend! We could grow a CSA for 20 families in spring 2015.


-We have given our lives completely to this mission of food, often passing up higher paying jobs to stick with our hands-on educational work.  We have demonstrated our commitment to always learning and growing.  In fact, once we settle, we plan to continue our education in Permaculture design and Environmental studies.

-We have built and operated three profitable businesses, each one focusing on an aspect of the ultimate goal. 

If our funding falls short of the goal, we are still moving forward, taking steps to make this dream a reality.  We will continue to pursue a farm to invest in.

- Over the past ten years, we have traveled and worked hard together, learning the skills and valuable life lessons necessary to build and operate our dream farm.  

-The last five years have been farm focused; before that we were restaurant and hospitality focused.

-Being on a wide variety of farms we have seen great examples of common practices, what types of projects we like best, systems that work well and not so well.  We have distilled a vision of a farm for education and restoration, for veterans and for anyone.

- NOW feels like the critical moment where we have served our time working other people’s farms, and it’s time for our own. Here is the course we wish to take.


Your Contribution will help us acquire the physical farm and build the kitchen/dining hall. This will be a place for nourishment and restoration. 

First and foremost, we grow a small sustainable farm to feed ourselves and our neighbors. We grow diverse foods, providing as much of our diet as we can, and trading with others for their specialties.  We have a commercial kitchen and dining room on the premises where we process, preserve and serve our harvests.  We also generate some revenue by renting this facility. We have rooms, yurts, or other guest spaces to accommodate veterans, individuals and families who want to learn about homesteading, gardening, cooking, livestock, hospitality, renewable energy, and living a sustainable, self sufficient lifestyle.


Estimated Farm Start Costs

$255,000 Taxes, fees and perk fullfillment

$300,000 Land with house and some outbuildings with infrastructure in place.

$50,000 Build kitchen (hopefully within existing structure) with indoor/outdoor dining space. Permitting and inspection fees

$40,000 Farm truck

$25,000 Small tractor and implements

$20,000  3 or 4 Guest rooms such as yurts or rustic cabins

$5,000 Research and development travel to Veterans Farm and

Growing Veterans.


A long time in the making...

Dylan and Heidi both grew up in rural settings, helping with family gardens.  Both Dylan and Heidi spent their early adulthood overseas, Dylan in the military, and Heidi  studying community in the middle east.  We met back at the turn of the century working in a restaurant in Seattle, WA. 


After working in many fine-dining establishments together and becoming increasingly involved with the local farm scene,  we and our young son formed a Farmer’s Market restaurant.  Our motto was "Fast food with a conscience."  We took great pains to source directly from our farm friends and avoid the industrial food machine as much as possible. 

While this was a tremendous growth experience, it was ultimately unsustainable and our desire was really to be growing the food.  So we closed our business, donated or sold most of our worldly possessions and set out on an epic two-year road trip.  We drove deep into rural Mexico and criss-crossed the U.S. a few times, gaining great hands-on experience with all kinds of agricultural enterprises.  Finally, in 2011 we returned to Heidi’s native state of Michigan, and began getting to know and work with local farmers.  During the 2012 growing season, we tested our accumulated farming skills and built a small Community Supported Garden. We grew a variety of produce, as well as chickens and pigs.  

In March of 2013, we began our StockWild Culinary Gardening business. Our mission has been to bring gardens and all of the benefits of gardening to individuals and families who want to cultivate a greater sense of wellness through good food and quality time spent outdoors.

Our StockWild Farm Kitchen will finally put together all of our skills and experience in a restorative farm setting where we can continue to grow and share good food. A place for veterans and anyone to grow and share good food.


If you are not comfortable using the internet to make a monetary donation, please see our website for other ways to support this endeavor.  Thank You for your help!
story_txt:
Our mission to grow and share good food with veterans and with you!
Dylan, Heidi, Cypress and Manuel Stockman
This mission has evolved over many years and the educational process has taken us far and wide.





Since Dylan is a Veteran of the US Army, we have become aware of a growing movement to retrain veterans into farmers. (For more info on this, check out the Farmer Veteran Coalition and Ground Operations)  It makes perfect sense that farming, gardening, cooking and all of the associated tasks would be restorative to soldiers.

story:
My name is Ryan Brune. I am fundraising to support my Eagle Scout Project to build picnic tables to be placed in local community gardens. An Eagle Scout project is a project that is required to advance to the final Boy Scout rank of Eagle. The main purpose of an Eagle Scout project is to positively impact the community.

For my Eagle Scout project I am working with the Athens Community Food Initiative (CFI,http://www.communityfoodinitiatives.org/). The goal of the CFI is to provide food security throughout our Appalachian community. One of the programs they run is the community food garden system. In this system they open up areas in the community for growing food and then help explain the benefits of doing so. To help increase the usage of the gardens, I am constructing picnic tables, as we believe they will greatly increase the popularity of outdoor areas - for kids and adults.

I will be constructing six hig quality, durable picnic tables. I have calculated that each bench will costs ~$250. At this point I have raised $1000. If you would be interested in helping me, your contribution would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

story:
Info ID es un sistema de información útil en el caso de que se pierda tu mascota. Consiste en servicio en línea, cuyo acceso es un código QR que está grabado con láser sobre una placa de acero inoxidable. Este código, al ser escaneado, activa alertas y permite que el dueño de la mascota perdida la encuentre más fácilmente.


Al final (abajo) en Preguntas frecuentes te explicamos cómo reclamar o comprar tu recompensa y añadir gastos de envío.

Recuerda: Elegimos financiamiento flexible lo que significa que a pesar de no llegar a la meta igualmente recibirás la recompensa que hayas comprado.

¿Por qué Info ID es más completo?

Info ID habla por tu mascota y te ayuda a encontrarla si se pierde


¿Dónde estamos?

Actualmente tenemos una base del software que ha sido mejorado y está en constante actualización. Hemos hecho ensayos en servidores privados y de lectura directa sobre placas de muestra.  

Nos falta afinar detalles del software para tener una versión terminada del desarrollo y dedicarnos a la producción. 

¿Porqué te necesitamos?

Todos tenemos un amigo o conocido que a perdido o encontrado la mascota de alguien y nos dimos cuenta que cuando eso ocurre, no existen formas que sean rápidas para acceder a información vital de tu mascota entregando la ubicación.

Queremos minimizar todo lo posible que alguien pueda perder su mascota. Necesitamos tu ayuda para lograrlo. Estamos en una etapa en la que solo falta el aporte económico y que sin ti, no lo lograremos.


Somos un grupo de fanáticos de las tecnologías y amantes de los animales, que estamos convencidos de que podemos ayudar a que las mascotas perdidas que usan Info ID, vuelvan a casa. #NoMasMascotasPerdidas.

 Damari Vergara

Licenciada en Diseño Gráfico de la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Valparaíso y Diseñadora de la misma casa de estudios. Experta en diseño editorial, de identidad e imagen. Organizadora de causas benéficas en Chile.

Marcelo Giglio

Publicista y diseñador de Universidad de Artes, Ciencias y Comunicación. Ha fundamentado el crear de este proyecto desde el inicio, cuando detecta la necesidad y consciente de las posibilidades, levanta uno a uno los requerimientos desde la fuente para el desarrollo de esta idea.

Lesly Vergara

Ingeniera Comercial de la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Valparaíso. Su aporte al equipo se basó en su experiencia para comprender los requerimientos en la gestión del proyecto y sus alcances.

Nicolás Medina

Analista de factibilidad de proyectos. Ingeniero Comercial de la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Valparaíso. En equipo con Lesly Vergara, nos ha apoyado en la correcta proyección y gestión de los recursos con los que contamos para poder llevar adelante este proyecto.

Además, contamos con la colaboración en el área de desarrollo de software con un amigo Ingeniero informático muy talentoso, confiable, detallista y cumple con los plazos solicitados, ideal para esta labor.

Las fechas son acotadas porque confiamos en que tu nos apoyarás y queremos que tengas pronto en tus manos Info ID.

Nuestro objetivo es hacer el mejor producto posible y tenemos todo el ánimo y energía en eso.

Muchos pueden olvidar agregar los gastos de envío al comprar y obtener su perk (recompensa). Por favor recuerda hacerlo, hemos creado perks especiales para gastos de envío a Chile, abajo en Preguntas frecuentes te enseñamos cómo añadirlos.


¡GRACIAS POR TU APOYO!


Estamos todos los días respondiendo preguntas por las más diversas vías. En twitter y facebook. Acá están las que más comúnmente nos hacen. Si tienes más preguntas por favor hazlas a soporte@infoid.mobi y felices de responderte.

1. ¿Cómo reclamo o compro mi recompensa en Indiegogo?

Puedes acceder a la recompensa que quieras, haciendo click sobre ella e iniciando sesión con tu cuenta de facebook (allí aparecerá el monto y los datos para hacer el envío), luego tienes dos opciones para pagar: 

1. Tarjeta de crédito (ingresas tus datos y listo)

2. Paypal, que también está vinculada a tu tarjeta de crédito (usas tu cuenta paypal para hacer el pago).

Ahora, en cada recompensa aparece el costo de envío, luego busca el perk con el costo de envío a Chile de tu recompensa y haz los pasos anteriores de pago.

Recuerda colocar los mismos datos para identificar tu recompensa y tus gastos de envío.

Después, de hacer el pago con alguna de las dos opciones, recibirás en tu correo el comprobante y una vez se cumplan los plazos nosotros te enviaremos la recompensa que escogiste.

Si tienes otra duda nos puedes escribir a soporte@infoid.mobi 

2. Quiero pedir dos o más InfoID - uno para cada mascota. ¿Cada mascota tiene una ficha distinta?

Sí. Cada Info ID viene con su propio perfil. Es único para cada medalla. Estos son completados por Info ID que debe ser enviada previamente a la activación.

3. ¿Debo pagar por cuotas mensuales o anuales?

Durante el primer año desde la fecha de activación la mantención de la información es completamente GRATIS. Luego, para mantener la información de su mascota existe un valor a pagar de forma semestral o anual, pudiendo optar a una de las 2 alternativas.

El pago por seis meses tiene un valor de $6.000 pesos chilenos ( un poco menos de 10 USD) y el pago anual es de $10.990 ( cercano a los 22 USD) o sea menos de $31 pesos por día).

4. ¿Necesito un teléfono inteligente para leer el QR del Info ID?

Sí. Es necesario un Smartphone para la lectura del QR. Además el teléfono debe tener conexión a internet y permitirle al servicio de localización del móvil compartir la ubicación con la ficha. Esto nos sirve para enviar el mail con el lugar de dónde ha sido leído el código.

5. Mi smartphone no tiene un lector QR.

No te preocupes, solo debes ingresar a tu tienda de aplicaciones y buscar uno, existen muchos y gratis.

6. ¿Qué es un código QR?

QR (Es la abreviación en inglés de “Quick Response”) es una especie de código de barras de matriz específica (o código bidimensional) que puede ser leído por smartphones. En ellos puedes almacenar datos o leer datos. Además, pueden dirigirte a un sitio web específico y hacer muchas cosas más.

7. ¿Qué pasa si mi mascota pierde su Info ID?

En tal caso, debes contactarnos para dar de baja dicho código y solicitar uno nuevo. Muchas veces mantendremos precios especiales para estos casos. No dejes de consultarlo.

8. ¿Qué sucede si daño mi InfoID?

Nuestros Info ID son difíciles de borrar ya que han sido grabados con láser. Sin embargo, si por alguna razón el código es ilegible entonces debes contactarnos para 

dar de baja dicho código y solicitar uno nuevo con un precio preferencial.

9. ¿Qué pasa con los datos privados?

La información que deseas compartir con quien puede leer el código es totalmente opcional. Debes optar por completar o todos o algunos de los campos en el perfil de Info ID. Mientras más datos de contacto mantengas, más fácil puede ser que te contacten en el caso de perder tu mascota.

10. ¿Qué información se almacena?

Al momento de registrar el código, se almacena la información que has decidido colocar en ella. La totalidad de los campos considera el nombre de la mascota, fecha de nacimiento, medicamentos, teléfono del veterinario, alergias, nombre del dueño o cuidador de la mascota, su teléfono, correo y los datos de un segundo contacto.

11. ¿Qué debo hacer si encuentro a una mascota extraviada que porta un Info ID?

Si encuentras una mascota que se encuentra extraviada y porta un dispositivo Info ID, debes leer el QR con tu Smartphone (recuerda tener la localización activada y permitirle acceso de esa información a la página web), luego se abrirá una ventana con la información del perfil con los datos de contacto para que puedas comunicarte con el dueño de la mascota y así dar aviso de su localización. Además, una vez que leas el QR se enviará inmediatamente un mail al dueño de la mascota con tu ubicación.

dicho código y solicitar uno nuevo. Muchas veces mantendremos precios
especiales para estos casos. No dejes de consultarlo. 
8. ¿Qué sucede si daño mi InfoID?
Nuestros Info
ID son difíciles de borrar ya que han sido grabados con láser. Sin embargo,
si por alguna razón el código es ilegible entonces debes contactarnos para dar de baja dicho código y solicitar uno nuevo con
un precio preferencial.


9. ¿Qué pasa con los datos privados?
La información que deseas compartir con quien puede
leer el código es totalmente opcional. Debes optar por completar o todos o
algunos de los campos en el perfil de Info ID. Mientras más datos de
contacto mantengas, más fácil puede ser que te contacten en el caso de perder
tu mascota. 
10. ¿Qué información se almacena?
Al momento de registrar el código, se
almacena la información que has decidido colocar en ella. La totalidad de los
campos considera el nombre de la mascota, fecha de nacimiento, medicamentos,
teléfono del veterinario, alergias, nombre del dueño o cuidador de la mascota,
su teléfono, correo y los datos de un segundo contacto.
11. ¿Qué debo hacer si encuentro a una
mascota extraviada que porta un Info ID?
Si encuentras una mascota que se
encuentra extraviada y porta un dispositivo Info
ID, debes leer el QR con tu Smartphone
(recuerda tener la localización activada y permitirle acceso de esa información
a la página web), luego se abrirá una ventana con la información del perfil con
los datos de contacto para que puedas comunicarte con el dueño de la mascota y
así dar aviso de su localización. Además, una vez que leas el QR se enviará
inmediatamente un mail al dueño de la mascota con tu ubicación.

From the strip club to the nursing home, this message will be seriously delivered with a lace of humor. Well family.....ILL SEE YOU ALL SOON

story:
Hi Everyone,

The SHG Harvest Party is an annual event filled with creative costumes, games, activities, and lots of time to visit with friends, old and new.  This year's party will be held on October 25.

Last year we used crowd-funding to raise funds for the Harvest Party. Rather than selling tickets, we used donations to cover the costs of the party.  This approach was very successful.

We are now starting fundraising for this year's party. The system is simple enough. If we raise enough money, we get to have the Harvest Party. If we do not raise the money, we do not have the party, and everyone keeps the money they contributed/pledged. 

Recommended contributions are $30 per family. Larger contributions help us cover the costs of those who cannot afford to donate. 

There are many opportunities to volunteer your time and support our community at this event. Please contact Andrea at msmuppet@gmail.com for more information.

Thank you,

Your Harvest Party Team (Andrea Shullaw, Kristina Bulajewski, Sandee Lium,  and Scott Steinhorst)
